28.description: I keep coming back here, so I'm guessing it's really good. But really, everything I've had at Baba Pita has been absolutely delicious and for a fair price. Their schawrma, whether it be the beef or the chicken, is great. I keep going back and that's not going to change anytime soon.

1.description: I am going to be a bit harsh, but I am used to authentic Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cuisine, specifically in Bridgeview, IL... what I consider to be the mecca of this kind of cuisine.To the point, I went with the meat combo. Food arrived in 10-15 minutes and the person apologized that it "took so long" - I do not expect Middle Eastern cuisine to be fast, nor should it be.  It should be fresh always.  I immediately noticed the food was close to room temperature, it was not hot.  On to the details of the meat combo:Chicken shawarma:  Seemed like dark meat chicken?  The flavor was odd and not in a good way.  Someone in a prior review here on Yelp said the chicken tasted "old" - I agree with that statement.Beef kabob:  It wasn't a kabob at all (as stated in someone's previous review here on Yelp), just a very thin pounded piece of beef with some seasoning on it.  It was slightly fatty.Chicken kabob:  Just like the beef kabob, it wasn't a kabob.  It was a very thin slice of chicken breast with seasoning on it.  This was the most "okay" thing on my dish.Hummus:  It didn't taste like it was made fresh.  I don't know if it came out of a container, but I will not assume since I wasn't in the kitchen.Pita:  Cold.  But not stale.Salad:  Was expecting a Jerusalem salad or something from the same region.  Instead, just a salad with regular shreds of lettuce and a slice of tomato, spashed with some vinegar dressing.Rice:  The rice was actually good, nice seasoning.  But I was very hungry and it's RICE, so maybe I'm being a bit jaded after having ate the things as listed above.Strawberry Mint Lemonade:  VERY strong taste of plastic, kept sucking up lemon seeds through the straw but caught them in time before accidentally sucking one down.  Could not finish it.  As I sit here and write this review, I can still taste the plastic in my mouth one hour later.  Not good.Sorry Baba Pita, I usually give second chances but this was a rough one.  I do understand that  kabobs have a variety of presentations in the Middle East and not necessarily meat on a skewer, however a flat piece of beef, similar to an unbreaded schnitzel, I don't think qualifies, and what was really misleading was the photographs of the Kabobs on the wall.Thank you and good luck with your business.

9.description: Avoid this place unless you want the customer service to leave a bitter taste in your mouth.We ordered falafel, some tabbouleh, and beef kabob for delivery. First they put me on hold for 12 minutes. When I called back and placed my order they said it would be about 45 minutes to an hour. No problem it's a Friday night and I'm an understanding personThey called about 30 minutes later and said that the can't make the falafel. If find it strange they they wouldn't mention this at the time of order. I said that's fine we will just cancel the order because that was one of our guests main dish and we will order from some place else. "You CAN'T refuse" they said. They made the rest of the food already. We have to pay for the order.If we didn't get what we wanted why would we have to pay for it? The woman explained that the gas for the falafel maker wasn't working. I asked when it stopped working. She said "An hour ago." BEFORE WE PLACE OUR ORDER. Wouldn't this be something you would tell the customer upfront. If you couldn't make some of the order why make the rest of the food before informing the customer. The part that set me off is and made me write the review is that she said "I can't make you be a decent person." A decent honest person Would tell the customer upfront of an item they ordered isn't available.This place is alright if you don't mind being treated like scum.

29.description: Ordered the beef Shwarma pita twice and it's great!  Definitely will be going back.  The grilled salmon dinner looks really good too!! Have to try that next.

23.description: This place is awesome. I love the meat combo and the atmosphere is inviting. If you are looking for a authenic  middle-eastern restaurant this is the spot.

5.description: Ordered two things the chicken shawarma pita and two falafel pieces.  It came with two sauces.  One of the sauces tasted bad. To add to the kill,  the chicken tasted old definitely not fresh.  So I told the owner and they made me a falafel sandwich instead.But I am disappointed in the food.

31.description: Food is delicious. Clean environment. Service is slow for those trying to order over the lunch hour.Unwilling to make small changes to food orders, ex. putting humus on the side of the pita pocket instead of inside the pita pocket.

25.description: I have been eating here everyday for like a month when I am at work. This place is seriously DE-LISH. I really have only ever tried their beef kabob but it's because its seriously always so good! Their hummus is by far my favorite hummus. I don't know what they do to theirs that no one else seems to do, but I love it. I could eat just hummus for a life time I think. If you've read my reviews you know I'm obsessed with Mediterranean food. Of course there are more expensive options that have a much bigger selection of Mediterranean food, but for the price you really can't beat it. Please come here and please eat the hummus.

12.description: The food is great!The falafel is crunchy on the outside and soft and tasty on the inside. The Kuftka is sooo good!, and the people who work there are also very nice and very helpful. Everything is made FRESH! YOU CAN'T BEAT THAT!!

21.description: Didn't have our falafel delivery after already making our other food. They even told us that their fryer was broken before we ordered their food. Even though they didn't have what we ordered, they tried to make us take the rest of the food and pay the delivery minimum. Argued on the phone for 20 minutes and they still tried to make us take the delivery.

16.description: Picked up excellent lunches yesterday!  Tastes authentic!  Clean delicious place to eat!  Will keep going back when I'm in town!

17.description: My wife and I stopped in here a few nights ago and shared a Chicken Kabob and the Chicken Shawarma in pita pockets and they were both excellent. The hummus inside the pita was fantastic and all the ingredients tasted very fresh. The service and ambiance inside were also great. Can't wait to try more items on the menu!

10.description: I was introduced to this place from a coworker and was not disappointed! SOOO good! I love middle eastern food and have never particularly had lebanese food but it was amazing! I went there 2x in one week in consecutive days. Their hummus is my favorite!! If you want to try a little of everything like I did, I recommend the meat combo plate. I have also tried their dolma and falafel and it was also delicious! When I have the craving for middle eastern food I will definitely be going here again!

11.description: Willing to give it another try .. but if I get one more bone in my chicken shwarma I will be done with this place forever. Bones don't go in 9 dollar wraps. Also, if it says hummus is on a wrap.. there shouldn't be a need to ask for extra hummus. Thank you and here is hoping for the best.

26.description: I have not had the pleasure of visiting the restaurant itself, but I recently enjoyed a meal from their stand at the Randolph street market. I cannot speak highly enough of it. The employees were exceedingly sweet, and the food was phenomenal. I can honestly say they served the best falafel I've ever eaten. And I've eaten a lot of falafel in my life. I will definitely be visiting this restaurant in the near future.

27.description: This place used to be great but then something changed. The service is terrible and the food quality has declined. Their chicken shawarma used be something I could eat for 7 days straight; now it's dry and flavorless.  After 8 years of patronage, I'll be looking for other better options.

0.description: Certainly I wanted to try the meat combo, as everyone has been raving about, but let's go for a different view and taste. The beef kabob plate it is. With probably one of the freshest beef kabobs I've had in a while and the dill rice, ummmm yes ma'am! The beef Kabob was not the typical kabob as kabobs go. It wasn't in a skewer or in a cylinder shaped morsel. Instead it was presented on top of the rice in a very typical fashion, but it didn't bother me due the taste. I absolutely thought it was extremely tasty and so tender. I poured a little bit of the sauce that accompanied it and BAMM! I will definitely now be addicted, can you say uhhh ohhh! I think that the place is beautiful (as it use to be Grand Daddy's sub sandwiches) but now, they have transformed the interior into a Mediterranean spot. I certainly can appreciate the fact that an establishment could seriously begin an adventure like this in what was once Little Italy. I love the fact that they have given us variety, as well as a taste that usually is brought in to select neighborhoods. I see a good future for the Baba Pita, and I truly hope that more will come out and see what I have seen and tasted. I don't think you will be disappointed but if you feel overwhelmed at the variety, by all means ask for a suggestion as I did. The young lady asked what I was in the mood for and of course I said beef, and we settled on the actual beef kabob dinner which was perfect, but one problem, too much food so leftovers it was. I give them a good rating and I am sure you will also.

20.description: Avoid this place unless you want the customer service to leave a bitter taste in your mouth.We ordered falafel, some tabbouleh, and beef kabob for delivery. First they put me on hold for 12 minutes. When I called back and placed my order they said it would be about 45 minutes to an hour. No problem it's a Friday night and I'm an understanding personThey called about 30 minutes later and said that the can't make the falafel. If find it strange they they wouldn't mention this at the time of order. I said that's fine we will just cancel the order because that was one of our guests main dish and we will order from some place else. "You CAN'T refuse" they said. They made the rest of the food already. We have to pay for the order.If we didn't get what we wanted why would we have to pay for it? The woman explained that the gas for the falafel maker wasn't working. I asked when it stopped working. She said "An hour ago." BEFORE WE PLACE OUR ORDER. Wouldn't this be something you would tell the customer upfront. If you couldn't make some of the order why make the rest of the food before informing the customer. The part that set me off is and made me write the review is that she said "I can't make you be a decent person." A decent honest person Would tell the customer upfront of an item they ordered isn't available.This place is alright if you don't mind being treated like scum.

19.description: The mint tea is made for these winters. If you are dining in here, take the meat combos. More than enough for a single individual. One of the best falafels I have had.

2.description: What a difference a few weeks make. I raved about this place three weeks ago, but today I'm removing two stars. Maybe it's the fact that it's a Saturday afternoon rather than a Friday evening, or maybe it's the fact that there's a teenager in charge but everything is just so bad. From her lackadaisical attitude taking my order, to waiting 15 minutes for yogurt cucumber salad and lamb shank to be brought to us, and another 10 minutes for pita bread and falafel sandwich, which were ordered at the same time. The lamb shank platter seemed to have been microwaved because the rice was room temperature but the lamb was warm. So disappointed because last time I ordered it, it was one of the best meals I'd ever had. We've now been here 40 minutes, and the kibbeh STILL hasn't been brought out...I doubt I'll come back.

18.description: A.M.A.Z.I.N.G. I ordered the chicken kabob dinner. I didn't expect the kabob to be more of a tenderloin, I was very pleased that it was. The chicken was seasoned well, the rice, pita bread and hummus were great. I am so happy I ordered my lunch from here today! Staff was great and actually took time to explain some of the menu items.

13.description: Best hummus I've ever had (and I've had a lot of hummus both here in the USA and in the Middle East). The beef and onions were also excellent. My only small complaint is that the tahini was watered down.

4.description: By far, the best Mediterranean cuisine in the city! The vegetarian plate is delicious and the baba ghanoush is to die for!  Don't forget to top it off with mouthwatering baklava for desert!

24.description: This is a wonderful place! I wish I lived I. Chicago; if I did, you would probably find me here once a week. My boyfriend and I really enjoy Mediterranean food and have tried many different places, but this is some of the best we have ever had.We tried kibbeh for the first time here and we're really pleased with it. I also had the falafel, which was perfectly seasoned. Can't wait to come back to Chicago, so we can try some new things from the menu.The family that runs the restaurant is extremely pleasant and helped us decide what to choose from the menu. We really enjoyed our experience!

6.description: I have been eating here everyday for like a month when I am at work. This place is seriously DE-LISH. I really have only ever tried their beef kabob but it's because its seriously always so good! Their hummus is by far my favorite hummus. I don't know what they do to theirs that no one else seems to do, but I love it. I could eat just hummus for a life time I think. If you've read my reviews you know I'm obsessed with Mediterranean food. Of course there are more expensive options that have a much bigger selection of Mediterranean food, but for the price you really can't beat it. Please come here and please eat the hummus.

22.description: The food is great!The falafel is crunchy on the outside and soft and tasty on the inside. The Kuftka is sooo good!, and the people who work there are also very nice and very helpful. Everything is made FRESH! YOU CAN'T BEAT THAT!!

15.description: Stopped here after work on a Wednesday, great ambiance such a nice place. I ordered the meat combination plate they had it out in about 7-10 minutes, food was great and the hummus was on point, will be coming here more often.

7.description: Baba PitaBest Arabic food Ive ever had. Freshness servedHappy customer!Check it out.

8.description: Never had schwarma before, and thanks to that Avenger's Movie last scene- i had to try it.liked it and the atmosphere. my only only complaint was i thought the rice pudding had a touch too much cream/milk and not enough egg

30.description: It's about time a falafel house opened up in this area. And I was very happy with the meat combination meal on my first visit. Next time I went there, I had the falafel wrap; that was tasty, too. They really did a nice job with the interior of the place (cozy). They had nice Middle Eastern music at just the right level that provided a nice atmosphere. No complaints on the service; they were very nice and timely. Really, it is the best option as a coffee house, too, because there is none on Taylor Street in this Tri-Taylor neighborhood.

3.description: I ordered their catering service and have to mention I got rave reviews from the staff members.  The food was packaged nicely and everything was tasty.  I minused some points because they freaked me out earlier today.  I called 12 times in a row to confirm my lunch order to no available.  They either didn't answer and when they did, they hung up on me.  Finally someone answered to let me know the food was on their way.They claimed their phone was being fixed so I'll give them a benefit of a doubt.  They were a hit so I can't complain too much.  And the person I dealt with, Hannan, kept her word.  She promised my food would make it on time and it did.

14.description: Everything is good. The kufta is especially delicious. The atmosphere is a clean mix of modern and old world. The music is well-chosen and never too loud. The staff is friendly, relaxed, and very accommodating. You'll see some complaints about slow lunches, but this isn't a fast-food joint and they don't pretend to be, so expecting it is sort of ridiculous. Easily one of the best restaurants of its kind anywhere south of Devon.

3.description: Ok, so for the past 2 days I've been craving a Gyro & since my go 2 spot in Greektown closed, decided to try this place based on Yelp reviews & 4 1/2 Stars. Wow!! Where'd they get that notion from?? Did NOT like this place at all!! First sign should've been the spelling of Gyro- Giro!! Huh? He messed up my order, just meat & sauce, No tomato or onion!! Then, my daughter ordered Italian Beef dipped WELL w/hot peppers, got home, rubbery, tasteless beef...Dry ass sandwich w/NO peppers!! The only thing decent were the fries!! Wont EVER, I repeat, EVER go here again. Straight garbage!!

1.description: I honestly would have given this place a 4 out of 5 if it was 3 years ago. This place went from having some of the most decent weekend meals to regrets about how I ate wasted calories. Since I live close by I've witnessed the switch in management. The second manager sadly had the best approach to service, the cashier was friendly, the food was delicious and they made a lot of things from scratch; which I always appreciate. Now the vibe of the place is just off, when you walk in it's just this dead air about it, almost as haunting as the abandoned county hospital. You can tell that they've changed suppliers and the meat tastes like its been refrozen and thawed out so many times. The people who work there look like they hate their job so much, it's just a quick get in and get out type of hole in the wall place now. Back in its prime I remember seeing a lot of people eating inside. I ate there last week, the meal was so bad that it depressed me. Think I'm giving this place a rest. They should close it with some dignity and open a forever yoghurt or something. The Tri-Taylor area just needs some revamping food wise.

2.description: Order a hot dog with everything last time I was there.  The guy working there puts the dog in the deep frier to start with.  Everything was ketchup, mustard and lettuce. Worst hot dog in my life by far.  Never going back again. This place has switched ownership so many times since it open.  Every new owner keeps bringing this place down.  When it first open this place was ok to eat.

5.description: Great local gem!

0.description: Where do I begin?  The price - excellent.  For $6, you get a gyro, fries, and a drink.  The service - thoughtful.  We ordered it "To Go" and our bag came with ketchup, napkins, and salt & pepper.  Many places skimp out on all of those.  The food - fantastic.  I have eaten a lot of gyros in my time, and this was one of the best.  Healthy portions of onions and tomatoes to go with the meat; all complementing each other incredibly well.If you are looking for a great gyro place in tri-taylor, look no further.

4.description: So day two I decided to go in for some other Mediterranean tid bit. So I ordered the falsely. I guess I was too over anxious because when I ordered the falsely, the owner I believe said: "Oh I have to apologize, we no longer sell this due to not alot of customers requested it so we took it off the menu, so we basically don't serve any Mediterranean foods at this point, but maybe in the near future". Ummm not a good thing since I was so looking forward to it. Of course, I ordered a gyro platter which I spoke of yesterday. Oh well so lets skip the Mediterranean part for now.

3.description: I truly enjoyed the friendly and courteous service I received! I will revisit, especially with being a stickler for hospitality and they give 100%!

1.description: As a Californian I don't have the privilege of consuming White Castle burgers as I please. I had to a training to attend in Chicago back in April of 2014 and being that Chicago is one of the cities that do WC I decided to give them a try. The hype came from when I first seen Harold and Kumar, that movie really marketed WC, anyway, We pulled into the drive-thru, ordered 15 cheese w/ onions and 15 cheese w/ jalapeno. I was excited to finally have them, I unboxed them and they look just the frozen ones out here in the west, I bit into it and it taste just like the ones here, so I wasn't blown, the taste is like any other cheese burger, nothing extraordinary, I think its more for the experience, of course from west coast POV, I'd have them again, no doubt, but its nothing amazing, still white castle burgers nonetheless.I enjoyed everything the food, the experience and service. The food is not nasty, but I isn't anything different, I'd definitely recommend people try it (west coast people) just to live the experience.

2.description: Loool. I'm from California so I never had White Castle before. At night they had some sort of special so I ended up getting like 16 sliders. It's okay. The meat isn't big enough, though! Not enough protein!

9.description: this is only my second experience with white castle-I am not impressed-I had a rough day on saturday, and was pretty excited around midnight to hit up the white castle.  maybe it was because i wasn't drunk, or that i am a bit picky , but the fries were mealy, and the burger wasn't that tasty-  unless i decide to go on a bender near a white castle, which is very much not likely, i don't think i'll be back!

10.description: 5 stars for ANY white castle in North America, And if one more person compares whitey's to that nasty chain in the south I'm going to shoot myself, White castle is second to none with flavor and taste.

4.description: So not every trip to White Castle can be epic and involve a cameo from NPH.  In fact it may be preferable if it didn't because it took an implausibly long time for those boys to get some White Castle.  If you pull up and order in the drive through it will still take about 7-10 minutes to get your order.  That's if you're the only car in line.  McDonald's can get you a disgusting burger and fries in like 30 seconds most of the time.  White Castle is also the nails on a chalkboard of fast food.  The smell clears a room for everyone who didn't pick up a sack (maybe it's more like your own farts) but for those who did it's slider heaven.

6.description: I don't know if it was just this White Castle, but when we went here to try it it wasn't as great as we were thinking it was.The first couple of bites of the burgers are good, but afterwards it just started making us sick.BUT, on the upside their fries are probably my favorite thing that we ordered. But at least we can say we tried "White Castle"

11.description: This place is great.  Go there late night it takes forever to get your food but tastes delicious at 4 in the morning.  Ih and its on a corner that sometimes has some action as you are waiting in your car roll up your windows lock your doors and enjoy!

5.description: I love White Castle for sliders. I crave those steamed buns and little slabs of meat with onions. I've been to this location a couple of times with the drive thru. The drive thru is pretty fast and they usually get the order correct. Recently, my bf and I went there after a grocery shopping trip. We requested the sliders with cheese and half with no pickles. They all came with no pickles which didn't bother me, but it would have been nice to know when I was picking through each and every one to find the ones with pickles. It's a decent White Castle and always splurge worthy.

7.description: Why do you always drunk dial me at 3am?

8.description: Some may say I have a sick and twisted mind because I can eat these little sliders without having to be intoxicated.  It's not an indulgence I do very often but occasionaly I like to take a trip to slider town.  It's hard to call White Castle fast food, what they are doing to those tiny little sliders that takes so long to get from the griddle into that grease stained bag in my car alludes me.  Have you seen a slider patty?  It's as thick as a sheet of paper, I would imagine it would take nanoseconds to cook.  Oh well, it's worth the wait.  The service here is relatively pleasant.

0.description: Alright, so some of you have followed me YELP talk about how I'm Canadian where WC's don't exist and have never experienced a "slider" after two years of living in the US.It is Nov. 13, 2007 - 12:47.I've just returned from "my first time.David W. - wish you were there to admire and be envious of my first time experience.I went to this White Castle because it is closest to work.  There is a drive through and parking for about 8 cars.  At first glance, I thought there would be an opportunity to sit inside to enjoy the whole experience of "my first time".  But, I was disappointed to learn that there was only a walk-in window.The staff were friendly. Service a little slow - probably because it was lunch time.  I peer into the window and saw four others frantically preparing a number of crave cases.  I wanted one too - only because it had a Soduku game on the cover the the box. I wasn't in a rush - so it didn't bother me that it took a few longer mins than usual to prepare my lunch.Finally, 7mins and 20 sec. later, I had Meal #3 in my hands (consisting of 10 sliders with cheese), 2 orders of fries and two soft drinks.  (I went with a coworker).The smell of the greasiness wasn't new to me.  It smells like any other fast food joint.  Delicious! (ok maybe I was hungry). We sat in the car and proceeded to pull out the buns packed in two's.Mmmm....first bite - no pickles.  tasty!Second bite...PICKLES - the pickles definitely rounded out the flavor. YUMMY!The texture? I can't really describe it.  Perhaps like a dumpling with pasty meat?  The bun was soft and midly sweet.  The cheese was great because I actually LIKE processed cheese served right.Whatever, I liked it...alot.  I ate 3 of them. and I still have more to take home.  Maybe I'll just eat it again for dinner.Will be interested to try these next time:  Chicken rings on a bun, sweet potato fries with cinnamon dipping sauce, slider with jalapeno cheese.I'd be lying if I said that my tummy doesn't have a little rumbling going on.  Only time will tell!

3.description: I recently got a coupon and the deal was too good to pass up. I have never whitened my teeth in any capacity, as they are naturally pretty white, so I was hoping for some great results. The place itself is very clean and nicely set up and both the front desk girl and the woman who did my whitening were extremely friendly. The best part, my teeth did come out MUCH whiter (she said 2 shades) so I was happy! The only reason I am leaving off a star is because the first 5-10 of the procedure hurt very badly. Felt like needles going into my gums. She asked if I was comfortable and said tingling was good, burning was not. It felt like a little of both so I said I was fine (I didn't want to be a giant baby!). When she removed the mouth piece my lower and some of my back gums had turned white. She said this happens sometimes and they would go back to normal in a couple of days. The whiteness is gone but my gums are a little scabbed up and open sore looking. I've been using lots of mouthwash to make sure they don't get infected and they seem to be healing quickly. I looked online and this happens sometimes when the peroxide gets on your gums. Apparently its not supposed to happen but it's not that big of a deal when it does. I think it's partly my fault for not telling her I could feel some burning/tingling on my gums. I'm just glad it is my lower gums and back teeth so you can't see it when i smile! Overall I will be back in a few months for another treatment as it works great. Just hope no gum burning happens next time!PS...one tip....you can't read or look at your phone really so bring head phones to help the time pass!

1.description: This review applies to their body wraps (yes, i got two body wraps) - I got some YouSwoop coupon and decided to give it a try. The woman was really nice and welcoming. The wrap, on the other hand, is not anything special. You just lay under some heated blanket in some "suit" and you sweat your ass off. I couldn't do the full 60 minutes the first time. And honestly I am not sure whether it really works. I mean yes I lost 0.5lbs, but that's all water weight, and that doesn't mean I burned 3000 calories due to the wrap. I've done some other body wraps in Seattle before my wedding, and they actually apply some cream on you, wrap you first, then put you under heated blanket. I think that's a better and more convincing way to say I've lost calories. The good thing is, if you purchased coupons, you automatically lock in some price. So for the Youswoop, it's $29, and going forward for the next year, even without the coupon, I am still locked in on that $29 per wrap. Not too bad.

2.description: I purchased a Groupon for the body wrap however they did NOT wrap me.  All she did was put me in a sauna suit and under a heated blanket!  That by definition is NOT a body wrap!  I've gotten body wraps before where they measure you, exfoliate the skin, apply a cream WRAP YOU in bandages THEN in a heat capsule and once you're out they measure again and see the amount of inches that were lost!  This place is a rip off - don't waste your money!

5.description: Went in for teeth cleaning and noticed them being a good 5 shades lighter.  Definitely worth the price.  It was quick, I only did a 30min session however It still gave me great results. Would recommend to anyone in need of a quick service with great results.

6.description: I purchased a Youswoop for a 30 minute whitening session. I was very nervous before hand because I've never had this done before and Lasers pointing at my teeth sounds scary. But the technician was very nice so I felt comfortable after meeting and talking with her. I was worried also because Crest strips hurt my gums but she assured me it would be nothing like that (She was right). She got me set up and gave me some magazines and the session began. Just about the time I was getting bored and uncomfortable from being in the same position the session was over. My teeth were noticeably whiter and I was happy with the results. I got a card locking me in for my youswoop price so they will be seeing me again.

7.description: I decided to go here since there was a gilt city sale for only $99.  The Girl at the receptionist desk was extremely friendly and told me to have a seat while I the she got the lady who would be whitening my teeth. The woman came a cross a bit cold. While getting my teeth whitened she wasn't too friendly but got the job done. Throughout she she would stop in and ask how I was with her purse on her arm ( which was a bit odd for me). But all in all a good service. All in all a good service for a good price. I just wish she was a bit more nice.

0.description: They have moved!  New deals on lifebooker.com/referral/…Ritzy Blue Spa and Salon By Whitening Bright Studio2422 W. Roosevelt Rd.Chicago, Il 60608

4.description: I purchased a Youswoop deal for a 30 min whitening session.  I booked my appointment online via their website, good luck getting someone to answer.  I went in for my appointment 2 days ago.  I was 10 mins early, my session started 20 minutes late.  Therefore I spent an extra 30 mins waiting.  3 magazines later, I was led in to the room, I didn't even have time to ask questions, or grab my iPod to play music as many suggested, I had to sit and listen to a the radio playing 80% static, she came to check on me twice so that was good but since you have the tray in your mouth you can't speak.  I was SO glad when the session was over, unfortunately to my dismay there was NO difference with the before and after.  I was at a level 10 (they show you different shades of yellow to determine where you stand) and ideally I should've been at a level 6 (4 shades lighter), nothing changed.  Funny enough that the person said it could be my eyes distorted from wearing the red glasses, so I ought to give it a few days.  Nope, still no change!  So glad I didn't pay $200+ for the session.The first 10 minutes was painful, I wanted to stop.  I felt a sharp pain on both sides of my mouth, and when I went home that night I couldn't brush my teeth, and felt sporadic pain throughout the night.  I'm giving this place 2 stars because it is clean and you get what you pay for.  But think twice before you decide to really go through it.

58.description: Eh.  It was pizza-like-ish, the thin crust with pepperoni.  We were so hungry on our first night at the new place, didn't know what was around, ordered from here through GrubHub.  It was lacking in a lot of things, this pizza, but it was food.The next day the hubs ordered a meatball sub by calling the number on the menu (not sure if it was the same location that delivered).  I don't know how that was.  But later in the day I ordered a turkey sub and bleech, holy salty.  Not a good sandwich.  Sure, ordering a turkey sub from a pizza place, not normal, but hey, I was tired and starving and just wanted a sandwich stupid fast.Despite the astoundingly fast delivery, I doubt we'll order from them again.  Just eh.  Much better food elsewhere.

56.description: I'm terribly concerned that I've never seen the cheese from Bacci Pizzeria actually melt.  The first time I had it, I took it to go and tried heating it in the oven for a good 30 minutes or so (and I live a block away so shouldn't have had to heat it at all), but the CHEESE NEVER MELTED!  The pizza always looks like you just took it out of the refrigerator- even when they set down fresh pizzas straight out of the oven!It's also $5 for a sub-par slice of pizza.  I've eaten it here and there, but only grudgingly and out of total desperation b/c they're open late and on weekends.  HOWEVER, if there's ANYTHING else around that you wouldn't mind eating, I'd suggest you go for that instead.

29.description: PIzza was good and cheap. I would come back

42.description: I was treated to this ginormous pizza at work today. It was the 30'' jumbo pizza with a stuffed cheesy crust. It was too huge, almost impossible for one person to carry. The size caught my eye but I was hesitant to try the pizza. I normally hate pizza. However, Bacci Pizzeria was really good. It wasnt oily or greasy. The stuffed crust was really good- gooey and cheesy. The tomato sauce on the pizza was perfect- not too sweet or generic. Had a really great taste. Everything was perfectThe only thing is that because the pizza is so large, toppings are expensive (totally understandable).  The pizza says it feeds 8-10 people but I think that it can feed double that (unless you have a bunch of starving people). Definitely try to get it for a party. Its a conversation piece and I can say hands down, one of the best pizzas I have ever tasted

23.description: Pizza: thin, so so sauce, it's a little soggy. Everything on the menu is greasy and extremely salty. There's much better food up an down Taylor. Been here about five times for lunch, never left feeling good...

47.description: Freaking giant pizza as big as my head!

8.description: Pizza was decent, customer service was horrible.  My bf and I get there this past Wednesday at around 7/7:30PM, 2 people ahead of us, we wait a little bit, place an order for one slice of pepperoni, and wait a little bit more...okay, that is obviously expected.  More people come in, they place their orders (about 4-5), and they wait.  Meanwhile, the 2 people ahead of us get their orders, then all the people that placed their orders after us receive their orders until it is just my bf, myself, and another guy (who just place his order) waiting.  We do a little more waiting, the cashier doesn't even lift her head up and bother to acknowledge us to ask us what we're waiting for.  Eventually my boyfriend asks if he's getting his slice.  She asks what we ordered and then puts the order in.  The order wasn't even placed!  All that waiting for once slice of pepperoni to be heated up.  That lady was not the one who took our order, but she should at least have the decency to acknowledge us to ask what we're waiting for.  Another worker who just got there, a guy, asks us what is going on, apologizes, and gives us another slice on the house.  Now he was cool...that other lady sucked and she just stayed off to the side for the remainder of our time there, pretending to be busy.

31.description: The pizza is alright. Good choice for a late night delivery or stop in before a night out to the bars or after. However, I love their loaded fries with cheese, onions, and bacon topped with ranch dressing. Definitely a fav and repeat order. Their wings are pretty good too.

34.description: This place is good for large and inexpensive pizzas . I guess they make the largest pizzas around here. And very cheap. Just sometimes they burn the crust  which spoils your mood.

16.description: Bacci is awesome!!!! They have generously donated pizza for several children's events at the branches of the Chicago Public Library that I have managed! THANKS, BACCI PIZZERIA!!!

13.description: If you're a UIC student, you can't walk here. Must drive, it's a far walk. It's $32 for a 30" pizza. But if you order online, you can get it for $28.75. It's enough to feed 6 people! Takes 30 minutes to make. The pizza was so huge, we had a hard time fitting it in the car. You're paying about $5 per person for a pizza that tastes descent and it's kinda neat seeing such a huge piza. Here is something to think about though, you can get two Large 14" Pizza from Pizza hut that's about 5 minutes away and pay $18. So Bacci's is a little pricey, but it tastes way better than Taylor Made Pizza.

11.description: I'm bewildered as to how a place can do so many things so poorly. I'm serious, we've started ordering different things to see if there is anything good here.  Burgers, nope. weird small frozen patty. sandwiches and salads, nope. The fettuccine alfredo wasn't bad, but not good either. The pizza isn't great, but is a great value.  desserts are good. The fries, however, are terrible, both types. i've tried a couple of varieties and i hope someone affiliated with the place sees this: PLEASE FOR BABY JESUS SAKE PLEASE COOK YOUR FRIES! I've never seen fries so white and limpy and undercooked anywhere. not a single crispy one in the batch. I keep ordering them thinking that they are a fluke, maybe the cook was off that day, but nope. Parmesan and pizza fries, which should be great concepts, ruined by potato mush.Oh and they use this neon pink bbq sauce that ive seen in other places and dont necessarily dislike, but it doesn't go well with the food here.

39.description: I would probably give 4 stars for the food on it's own, although admittedly I've only ever had the pizza, appetizers, and the occasional calzone.  The delivery and ordering process should be easy since I always use the web site, but I've had a couple errors recently.  The wrong pizza was delivered once (still good, just not what I ordered).  The second time, they again had the wrong pizza when they called to tell me my order was ready for pick up (was ordered as delivery), and the order took almost 2 hours to get to me.  All in all, good pizza and a decent price, but needs a little more effort at customer service.

37.description: Good Non-deep dish pizza. Giant slices that can probably feed two and a free small soda (pop) for $7 not too shabby.Open late!

0.description: Wow! Bacci Pizzeria Taylor Street has really stepped up their game!!! In my previous review I mentioned the revamping of their menu. Tonight my boyfriend and I noticed an additional change. You know it's been a while when you come in and something seems different, they updated the decor/atmosphere and it looks great! It definitely gives the place a new vibe.Tonight's experience was such a pleasure! As always, the staff really do their best to make sure you leave happy! Living in the area as mentioned in my previous review, it's a nice touch knowing they remember you face and welcome you back with a smile. They always make ordering very easy and do their best to keep up with any special requests. Tonight, the staff reminded me that my last order I went with the Eggplant Over Pasta Dinner - see what I mean about the attention they have when it comes to their customers - they made it easy for me to go with this order for tonight, how could I not! My Boyfriend got a Cheesy Beef and absolutely loved it! Everything was perfect. Tonight's dinner was exactly what we needed, it was nothing short of perfect!We are very fortunate to have such a great place like Bacci's in our neighborhood. You better believe I'll be back for more! Till next time,Thank You!

38.description: 5 bucks for a soda and biggest pizza slice ever made! Ill take it! Great for budget and always ready, they.heat it up on the spot.

51.description: You can't beat the price for a HUGE slice of pizza and a pop!New building is clean and has plenty of seating...I will definitely be coming back!

27.description: I love the huge slice if pizza. It is sufficient for dinner. The taste varies though. Sometimes its amazing sometimes its not so good. I guess it depends on what time you visit. I would suggest visiting this place before 9pm. That's when I usually got the better tasting pizza.

32.description: Didn't get to eat any pizza, but I am in love with the Italian ice deal! Seriously ended up with over a pint of Italian ice for only $2. It was a sweet treat on a hot day, and then a tasty dessert later in the day! Ha!

54.description: It used to be for the community, I can always count on them when I need help, like if I locked myself out, need to make a call or need to borrow a couple of bucks from the employees. But a couple of months ago, employees changed in the restaurant, food changed also. I locked myself out on a freezing rainy day before going to work. I waived and knocked on the door several times. They saw me, waived hands first to show that they are not open, I tried to tell them I'm here not for food, but for a little help, surprisingly they buried their head totally ignored me from then on, during which time I continued knocking the door so hard and loud for 10 minutes and was so surprised at how calm they maintained themselves. A normal person would already know something was wrong and at least came check it out. The only thing that can make them come to the door is if I started to burn this place down. This lack of sense of responsibility is bad for both the community and the restaurant. But who is responsible after all? Most likely the owner.

48.description: The only reason I give it a 4 is because they're fries, I just hate fries that still have skins on them! BLECH! Otherwise? This place is great, I haven't had one thing from here that I didn't like. My favorites are the Bacci Burger and the Cheesy Beef. They're flavorful, deliver on time and  are pretty nice. Sometimes though, one of the girls who answers the phone is a bit..slow..and gets confused a lot while taking your order or tell you that they don't have that certain item, when they do. If you get that girl, just say "yes you do, I ordered it last week, and it's on your menu" she'll then go "oh..ok..hold on" and then when she comes back, she confirms they do have the item. They even brought back soft serve ice cream, which was pretty tasty. I also must say their prices are decent and they're rather friendly.

44.description: I ordered over $60 worth of food for delivery (with a $10 tip ready to go).  Husband calls and orders it on his way home because he's dying for pizza and wings and I'm just happy not to cook. Driver calls an hour later to say he's here so I tell him I'll buzz him up - its number 3.  He says, "No, I can't come up - I'm not allowed to leave my car and I have another delivery that's late." Seriously? So, I'm supposed to find my keys, put on shoes, walk downstairs and meet him at the car?  If I wanted to do that I would have ordered carry-out and saved myself the delivery fee. And being 6 months pregnant the last thing I felt like doing was walking back up three flights with a large order of food. That's why I was willing to spend $75 bucks on crappy pizza.  So I play the pregnancy card and tell him he has to come up - if Papa John's does it, he can do it.  That's when he says he's still at the restaurant and will call me again when he is here. Uh, ok?  Five minutes later the restaurant calls and says the driver is at my door but he's not allowed to leave his car unattended. They do realize this is Chicago, right?  I told them to cancel my order.I ordered Chinese food instead from Hana for half the cost and guess what?  The driver came right on up and got a $10 tip for his "trouble".

24.description: Everyone should try the hot Parmesan fries! They had just the right amount of Parmesan cheese and hot giardinera :)

7.description: Bacci may not deserve the full four stars but they've been there time and time and time again and it almost always delivers. Complaints about the staff may tell you more about the reviewer than anything else. Pizza is solid. All 'Chicago food' is solid--Italian beef, Italian sausage, Rib tips, etc--although the fries have lately become terrible. Blame it on a recent cook? In any case, Bacci is pretty good, especially on Monday for the discount slice.

49.description: Your go to place when drunk; tastes delicious!   However, having the pizza sober is a different story.   Yes the slices are gigantic and Yes they are $5 a slice...but if you are here visiting the city, don't bother.  Go somewhere that is worth it

40.description: Don't get the lasagna.  Noodles, sauce and cheese,  but no flavor.  Just a mess. This place has the worst Italian food i have ever eaten. I have no idea how they stay in business.

53.description: I've explored the menu and the only thing that is decent is the pizza slices.  The burgers are disgusting.  The fries used to be bad but it improved.  I would stick with the jumbo slices and you won't be disappointed.

30.description: Pizza slice and drink are cheap and pretty good if you're looking for something quick to eat. As big as those pizzas are you can get them cut up into smaller pieces to make it easier to eat. The last time I was here I was just a little disappointed because the cashier was busy having a conversation with a customer for 10 minutes disregarding my in the background.

46.description: Foot long pizza slices that are almost as wide as they are long...now that's big!  Veggie for about $6 tax and total.  Wish I could have found a knife so sharing it would have been easier.  Big enough for two, the hubs and I split it and it was plenty.  They sell em by the pie too, the whole pizzas would make for an awesome sports party pizza.  Good crust, good flavor, healthy dose of cheese.  We enjoyed it outside on their very small wrap around patio area complete with a few tables.  I love casual patios because we can walk the dogs and stop at a dining destination along the way.Got a soft serve cone to complete the meal, it was free with my checkin but would cost $1 otherwise.  I wouldn't pay a dollar for after experiencing it because it was the iciest soft serve ever, thats a no go.  Not only that but it was soft so it couldn't be topped very high.  Melted like crazy.  If you like your soft serve icy, get it in a cup...you'll get more.  They did have gelato which I would guess is much better than the machine dispensed slush.Pizza, YEA.  Ice cream, NAY...never thought I'd hear myself say that!

1.description: Bacci used to be great, but recently something changed and they've gone down hill. Save your $and go across the street to Demenzos. I order simple sandwiches and they're either completely incorrect or they take forever to make. Recently, the slices have shrunk, are bland and went up in price. It's a shame as they used to be my favorite.

55.description: HUGEE SLICES! The pizza is that 'old fashioned' flavor that you taste when you think pizza. Reasonably priced, and good for families that want left overs. (yes, I ate my slice in one sitting!) This place is great to go if you are from out of town, I recommend. The only downside was the interior looked dirty and the ladies restroom was gross. More cleaning and this place would be an A+. I do recommend.

9.description: Now they are serving stuffed slices!!!! Amazing!!!! Got to love the way they make their customers happy!!

26.description: They serve the biggest pizza slices I've seen, well, besides De Arcos on 63rd street. I came here for lunch. I ordered a slice of supreme pizza (it had tons of meat and cheese and vegetables), a 20 oz pop and a small fry, I believe my total came to about $9 and some change, not bad considering I ate the pizza for 2 days. The pizza was very tasty.

25.description: These jumbo slices are the real deal! And cheap too! One would be hard pressed yo gind something wrong with the deal beong just $5.

12.description: Their pizza slices are large. That sums up the positive.Otherwise, what you get is an old slice of pizza which they will reheat for you and is cold by the time your half way done having it. The vegetables in my "Supreme" pizza were obviously old and tasted bad.At the end you are thinking, I can't finish this and I'd get a box for the remaining pieces of our two slices. THEY WON'T GIVE YOU A PIZZA BOX!!!! Right! You could have ordered a slice to go and have had it there, but they tell you that we don't give away our pizza boxes because they are expensive. You could get one of the other boxes (that didn't fit what we had to take). That's just stupid!

59.description: came here lastnight. Damarie is amazing she's super friendly. Def made my Night. keep up the good work. as always i enjoyed my slice of pizza :)

21.description: I'm bewildered as to how a place can do so many things so poorly. I'm serious, we've started ordering different things to see if there is anything good here.  Burgers, nope. weird small frozen patty. sandwiches and salads, nope. The fettuccine alfredo wasn't bad, but not good either. The pizza isn't great, but is a great value.  desserts are good. The fries, however, are terrible, both types. i've tried a couple of varieties and i hope someone affiliated with the place sees this: PLEASE FOR BABY JESUS SAKE PLEASE COOK YOUR FRIES! I've never seen fries so white and limpy and undercooked anywhere. not a single crispy one in the batch. I keep ordering them thinking that they are a fluke, maybe the cook was off that day, but nope. Parmesan and pizza fries, which should be great concepts, ruined by potato mush.Oh and they use this neon pink bbq sauce that ive seen in other places and dont necessarily dislike, but it doesn't go well with the food here.

17.description: Just brought the veggie sandwich back to my office. Worst tasting sandwich I've ever had, completely flavorless served soggy, with equally soggy fries, served by unpleasant looking employees. What a waste of $9.80

10.description: This place has MASSIVE slices of pizza. For about $5-6, these slices certainly are not mind-blowing in quality, but noteworthy in quantity. If you're starving and looking for a snack, you may want to consider splitting a slice. But they will heat it up and cut into smaller pieces for you, making it easy to scarf down on the go.

5.description: It's cheap take-out Italian food. Nothing special, but I do indulge in it every so often.  I'm a fan of the Rigatoni with Creamy Red Vodka Sauce. It's a HUGE portion, enough to feed 2 people for at least 2 meals and it costs $9. I've also gotten the Diavolo Pizza and the Bacci Lady Pizza (which is their tasty version of a chicken/bacon/ranch pizza). Both were good and I would get them again for a late-night, lazy dinner option.

3.description: I love their pizza slices, I only wish they were open longer hours on the weekdays. They're my savior as I work late and keep odd hours especially on late nights on the weekends. Their sausage pizza is amazing and I would highly recommend it to anyone. Plenty of street parking around, and they're always pleasant and quick with their service. The food always comes out hot and delicious!

35.description: A perfectly fine lunch option. Giant slices of pizza which taste OK, but it's thick and resists attempts to fold.

19.description: Everyone should try the hot Parmesan fries! They had just the right amount of Parmesan cheese and hot giardinera :)

28.description: I love Bacci pizza.  This location is very clean and nice.  I order from here on GrubHub sometimes and they are always quick and get my orders right.

45.description: My first night in Chicago, I ordered delivery from Bacci. Their stuffed pizza was amazing (and stands up well to reheating, which is important for me since I never finish a pizza in one sitting) but even more impressive were the Nutella bites - a bit bigger than they sound and absolutely AMAZING.

33.description: You definitely get a lot of food for your money. They really are the home of the jumbo slice, but it's not the best pizza. It's not bad but not great. The one thing that bugs me about this location is the counter girls.  They act as if taking customers orders is a burden. The first time I came in I thought maybe they are having a bad day, but they are like that every time I come in. I do believe the owner should have a talk with them.

43.description: If you are hungry, you can't have a simple slice, this place offers good pizza and big slices. Varied menu too not just pizza. And good Italian ice for the end of the meal. The staff was pleasant. Lots of seating available in a spacious room with TVs. + a game room

2.description: Their grilled chicken garden salad was delicious! Plus, they threw in two slices of tomato sauced focaccia bread.

18.description: Foot long pizza slices that are almost as wide as they are long...now that's big!  Veggie for about $6 tax and total.  Wish I could have found a knife so sharing it would have been easier.  Big enough for two, the hubs and I split it and it was plenty.  They sell em by the pie too, the whole pizzas would make for an awesome sports party pizza.  Good crust, good flavor, healthy dose of cheese.  We enjoyed it outside on their very small wrap around patio area complete with a few tables.  I love casual patios because we can walk the dogs and stop at a dining destination along the way.Got a soft serve cone to complete the meal, it was free with my checkin but would cost $1 otherwise.  I wouldn't pay a dollar for after experiencing it because it was the iciest soft serve ever, thats a no go.  Not only that but it was soft so it couldn't be topped very high.  Melted like crazy.  If you like your soft serve icy, get it in a cup...you'll get more.  They did have gelato which I would guess is much better than the machine dispensed slush.Pizza, YEA.  Ice cream, NAY...never thought I'd hear myself say that!

41.description: Ordered our first pizza from here and it was delicious.  Great size pizza for the price, flavorful crispy crust, and fast delivery (pizza still hot when delivered).  Recommended!

52.description: I love Bacci's but this weekend they made me sad. My husband placed an order online which was to have been delivered in an hour. Two hours later we called and were told they just received our order because the printer was out of paper. 45 minutes later we finally got our pizza. No apology or added goodie to the order. What a bummer. I'll still go but I'll stick to pick up!

50.description: I think it's average at best for Chicago Pizza. Let me be clear. I grew up with superb pizza in the South Suburbs, and my family owns a pizzeria. The portions are huge, and the prices are great. The meatball sub was really quite good. The pizza was meh... It's nice to have it so close to work in the IMD, and I love the outside seating in the spring/summer.

4.description: $7 for a slice of pizza and a soda. The pizza is super bland and just kind of bleh overall. Also, everyone that works here is rude and needs an attitude adjustment. The last few times I've stopped by the selection of slices has been terrible and I left without buying anything. Also, they have stated hours and yet they seem to close whenever they want. I would avoid this place, you're better off buying a frozen pizza for $6, honestly.

6.description: Well. It's been over a year and it'll probably be another until I'm foolish enough to return here again. The pizza although decent in quality is just not good enough to put up with the shitty people who work here. The other menu items (as mentioned in other reviews) are to be stayed away from. Burgers are frozen and nobody knows how to cook pasta without making it mush. I get it, this place caters to college kids as you get a lot of food for a reasonable price. What I don't get is the people who you guys hire to work here. Why is it so hard not to smoke near the doors of an establishment, especially when you work there!!! Ahhhhhh!!!!!!!!! Nobody wants to smell this crap, it's disgusting. You shouldnt be allowed to smoke during work hours when you work in food service because the smell sticks to you. Again, just disgusting. Cashiers are still too busy gossiping and ignoring customers. Have a question about a menu item? Too bad, nobody actually knows what's in the food they serve. So the prices went up, quality went down and I'm never going back.

22.description: If you're a UIC student, you can't walk here. Must drive, it's a far walk. It's $32 for a 30" pizza. But if you order online, you can get it for $28.75. It's enough to feed 6 people! Takes 30 minutes to make. The pizza was so huge, we had a hard time fitting it in the car. You're paying about $5 per person for a pizza that tastes descent and it's kinda neat seeing such a huge piza. Here is something to think about though, you can get two Large 14" Pizza from Pizza hut that's about 5 minutes away and pay $18. So Bacci's is a little pricey, but it tastes way better than Taylor Made Pizza.

15.description: Huge slices, fair prices, open late, less than three blocks from my house. For a broke grad student that means this place makes me pretty happy on the regular. Only way they could be better is to add more vegetarian-friendly pizza options but when I'm hankering for pizza I'll take what I can get. Haven't had much besides pizza but I imagine the other offerings are on par; the mango Italian ice is especially delicious.

57.description: I am floored! I have of course had their pizza in the past, but I quickly forgot how good it really is. From the buttery crust to the actual pizza ingredients. The manager was kind enough to give me the student discount that was made for a Monday (I came in on a Tuesday), but here I was thinking it was Monday. When I pulled out my school ID the girl said; "I'm sorry that was yesterday" but the Manager heard her and said, "No you can give it to him, he thought it was Monday," I thought this was really thoughtful of him and made the experience even better. It just goes to show that not all places are trying to make a fast buck, they actually have a really good product and are kind at the same time. I can appreciate this for sure. Their slices "use" to fit the box but this time (as we took ours to go), we noticed that the slices were actually just a tad smaller, since it now slides a little bit in the box. Not a big deal because again the slices are giant anyways and you will defintely be filled up with just one, and for under $6 you also get a fountain drink? NICE!

20.description: You just cannot beat their pizza and pop special. It is a legit huge piece of pizza, about the size of the tray, for only 5 bucks. I love the pizza too, great variety. They also have very good greasy burgers and fries. Gelato is delish in the summer too.

36.description: I ordered online and it was pretty quick, that's about the best thing about this review. I had the Italian beef dipped and the meat was still dry and kind of hard, lacked much flavor. The pizza fries were meh, I could've done without them. The cheese hardened up pretty quickly and the fries were all stuck together in one block. Maybe I'll try the pizza next time.

14.description: Didn't get to eat any pizza, but I am in love with the Italian ice deal! Seriously ended up with over a pint of Italian ice for only $2. It was a sweet treat on a hot day, and then a tasty dessert later in the day! Ha!

3.description: The food was not good! I ordered the scrambled eggs with chorizo for breakfast and it was slimy raw, the service ignored us for some time, so I had to wait and wait to let her know that I didn't want to eat slime. I will not be returning.

1.description: The last visit I had the 3 flautas dinner. All chicken since you are only allowed to one meat selection. Not bad. Just a bit more crunchier than I would have liked. The green salsa may have been spoiled. I have also tried the torta and tacos in other occasion which both were good. definitly one of the best Mexican places in the area.

2.description: Tried a steak burrito because the menu said best burrito in Chicago. Far from the best.. The meat was super dry and salty. I won't ever order food from there again. Waste of money.

5.description: They toast the burritos, which makes them pretty yummy. They can be very slow and unorganized at times and there are often people coming through asking for money. But if you can look past these things its a good place to eat.

6.description: Every time I've been there it has taken forever to get my order.  It doesn't matter how simple or small the order, or wheather or not there are other people there.   I've also heard other customers complain about the wait for a simple order.  The last ( and I mean LAST) time I went there I thought it would be best to call ahead.  I ordered nachos, and said I'd be 15 minutes, of course it took another 10-15 minutes of me asking for my food.  When I got it home I saw the A-Holes threw the cheese on top and didn't even melt it!!!!!!!!!!  The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because sometimes the food was rather good.

7.description: I used to be a fan of Papi's especially when they were on Western.  When they merged with Domenzo's the quality of the food just simply declined.  I tried giving the place a chance a few times by ordering different things, but overall, it's just no good.  I am not a picky eater either.  I would go to Tacos de Luna right down the street now.  That is my new place in the area and I love it!

0.description: Oh, I can't complain about ya' Papi.  No, can't complain at all.  Stepped down Taylor Street yesterday in the odd warmth that was mid-March (until the snow came back this morning.)  I popped in the door right at lunch rush, looked at the takeout menu, and went with the Gordita and a taco al carbon!  You took my five dollars, but I felt like the one robbing you!  This is a simple lunch place on Taylor Street.  It shares a kitchen with Damenzo's Pizza, which confuses me a bit, but no more than Mexican street food in the middle of Little Italy should on an ordinary day.  I was happy with the food.  I was happy that I only waited maybe ten minutes for it, and in the time that passed I sat on the bench near the front of your shop and had a wonderful talk with one of those little old Italian ladies who told me how much the neighborhood was changing.  Your place is that kind of place.  I didn't feel rushed or bothered.  Thanks.  If you go:  Don't expect haute cuisine.  Just very nice, actually authentic Mexican food.  Go for lunch.Don't go for: Decor/ambiance/creative dishes.  It's a glorified Mexican taco stand that shares a kitchen space with an Italian restaurant.  You could call that "fusion" if you were inclined to put a smiley face on it, but they could care less what you call it so long as your belly is full and you're happy...which I was.

4.description: FYI: Papi's has moved from it's original location on Western and you know how sometimes a place loses it's luster when it changes locations? Well this is that story....Let me just start by saying that I LOVE Papi's tacos. I normally will stop in or have the food delivered. So yesterday I decided to order and have my food delivered. I ordered my usual steak milanesa dinner. Now for some reason the delivery guy calls you when he's outside. Why he doesn't just ring the bell I don't know. But it's always been this way and I always say whatever makes you happy....Anywho, the delivery guy called so I went downstairs. When I opened the door i was a little confused because I didn't see a delivery guy. What I did see however was a pickup truck with random junk in the back. And if you think that's not appalling then you should have seen the big ass refrigerator that was also in the back. I see a guy by the truck but he's rummaging around in it with his back to me. So I stand around waiting for this delivery guy who just called and said he was outside. Well lo an behold (you already know this) this was the delivery guy. He hands me my stuff and then proceeds to tell me he has no change. What delivery guy has no change? That's ridiculous. He's lucky I didn't need change or else it would have been a problem.So I was very excited to have my food. I mean Papi's never disappoints right? WRONG. WAY...WRONG. :-(My milanesa looked burnt and the meat was black! I kid you not yelpers. Black meat (shuddering). Oh and needless to say that it tasted funny. Sort of like old grease. YUCK! The refried beans weren't even cooked all the way. Beans should never feel crunchy or solid. So I decided I wasn't going to eat it and instead sit in my house ad sulk. I started thinking you know what? I don't have to take this! So I called and explained to the guy on the phone that the meat was burnt and black and tasted funny. I explained to him that I had been a loyal customer since they first opened and that the meat/batter was not the same. He claimed that even though they moved they are still using the same meat. He then offered to send me a new milanesa dinner and asked for me to return the original one. I gladly obliged.So when I got the new dinner it looked better then the first. It was not burnt at all the only problem was that it still tasted like old grease. I'm not sure what is going on over there but there is no way in hell that they're cooking the milanesa the same. I used to get that ALL the time. Bring the milanesa back Papi's!! I don't want to have to quit you!P.S. My friend ordered a steak taco that was EXCELLENT.

3.description: My girlfriend had a birthday couple days ago . I decide to get her some flowers. They helped me to pick me prefect bouquet and offered free delivery to downtown. I ordered it at 3pm and asked to deliver it before 5pm to my gf workplace . It was delivered before 4pm. Impressive . The prices are affordable .My girlfriend said that it was the best bouquet she ever got .Thank you so much !!! Totally recommend this place .

1.description: Have been having a bit of a rough month and my best friend sent me flowers from Arizona. I was so happy to see that I got flowers, of course! But when I sent her a picture of the flowers to say thank you, SHE was very upset. I think the pictures from what she thought she ws sending to what actually got sent, explain it all!

2.description: I don't normally write reviews, but I felt too good about my experience to not let Accent and everyone else know. Whoever I spoke with was very nice and helpful. It is stressful, to me, picking out flowers. She made it so stress free. They were delivered within a few hours. I originally chose this place due to it's close proximity to the destination, but I will be choosing them from now on.

0.description: This places rocks .. I love fresh flowers in my shop every other week.. Thisflowers shop.. Never let's me down to deliver the perfect arrangement everytime .. The designers know I love lily's and roses .. Especially, pink to go with the colors in my place..  The drivers call me when they are on their way .. Alway's on time .. Prices are great!! Thanks guys are the best..

3.description: This place is amazing! this place just opened and it has been jammed packed with people. I had the smothered chicken with mac-n-cheese and a side of corn.. BEST MAC AND CHEESE EVER! food is cooked fresh and its sooooo good!.  Everyone is so friendly and welcoming. I also had the truffle cheesecake.. TO DIE FOR. Everything is so fresh and delicious. it is worth a try! also you are able to try it before you buy it!!! which is amazing because i was undecided of what sides to get. def. try the mac and cheese!

1.description: We live close and not only want to love this place, need to love this place since no one else is open for anything close to dinner on a Friday/Saturday night.    The place was jammed in the beginning because there is NOTHING here but pizza and burritos.  I love both, but I also love and need a place that is not pizza and burritos at least for Friday and Saturday night dinner with my significant other.  But the name is "Soul Food TO GO" so maybe I want them to be something they do not want to be.  My fault.Unfortunately after three visits and one take out,  I have to agree with the other reviewsThe menu is printed out from Word.  Just stick to the blackboard.They are only cooking certain items each day.  I totally get that.  So write them on the blackboard as today's specials.  Do not taunt us by letting us select three items that are not available from the sheet of paper menu, until we guess what is cooking today.  Loose the PVC patio furniture.  Either upgrade to matching furniture or stick to the TO GO theme.  Take the out.  Now to the food:Mac and cheese.... to die for.  Must is a must have and is what is keeping them in business.  If this was the only item on your menu, this would be  a 5 star review. The chicken and fish were good, not great,I think the Greens are good, not greatRice and beans, a bit bland.If you want dine-in business, please be BYOB friendly.  The last time I was there, they went next door to buy paper cups from the grocery store since they explained that they sold soda in cans and bottles and no one needed a cup....

2.description: I have VERY VERY mixed reviews about this place.First, I called and placed my order. And two of the things that I wanted "they weren't serving today" I called back two minutes later to add an additional sandwich to my meal and I ended up talking to 3 different people before I could finally place my order. The receptionist said my dinner would be ready "in 10 minutes". I was on a strict time schedule so I double checked with her to verify the 10 minutes was accurate, she again, assured me "10 minutes."Well, when i get there of course my food is not ready. Also, the lady that I guess is the person that takes orders had on some bright shirt, with her boobs hanging out and tatoos on them to bring more attention. IN ADDITION, there was a 2 to 3 year old walking around in the little kitchen being supervised I guess by all the workers. UNACCEPTABLE. I ended up getting my food 10 minutes later than quoted when I told them repeatedly what time I needed it ready by.Now to the food, I ordered a catfish dinner with sweet potatoes and mac and cheese.I almost choked on a bone because the fish has many bones in it! The mac and cheese was fantastic. The sweet potatoes were gross (thats if you know what good soul food taste like)  In addition, I ordered a catfish sandwich. When I opened the box, I had 4 pieces of bread and some fish.   No sides, no sandwich made, it was just sloppy!  I hate that my first experience with this place was bad because I had been anticipating its opening.  If you are in the Medical District and there is no other soul food places and you arent on a time schedule and do not care about the venue, then go here.But if you have the opportunity to choose between MacArthurs, Morrisons, Ms Pearls; Dont even consider this place.This is a note to the staff "If you want to bring in professional people to support your business, YOU MUST FIRST  BE PROFESSIONAL!"****UPDATE***I sent two friends to try this place out today and there was a note on the door that read: SORRY WE ARE CLOSED. IT'S TOO HOT.ONCE AGAIN, HORRIFICALLY GHETTO AND UNACCEPTABLE!

0.description: Food specials are good for $5.99 but the variety is at most simple. I ordered smothered chicken for lunch with a side of white rice and mashed with corn bread. Now here's the cut:* there are more items on regular menu (which they ran out of, but cleverly wrote on the chalkboard menu wall)* chicken actually was good until I got to the center, a little undercooked. * I think they needed more soul seasonings to take it to the next level.* I use to work out in this space when it was a gym, and it seems like it hasn't changed too much, it is  a tiny spot and if you want to eat in for lunch, it may seat you and a few friends. * The girls working there are really accommodating. Very pleasant and extremely attentive, when asked if they would be using credit card soon they said that by tomorrow the debit machine would be in. Big Plus. * It was a cool and brisk day in Chicago and the inside of the restaurant was a bit hot so I suggest that you order and pick up vs having to wait and get warmed up on the super hot days* CO Worker was not happy that her fried chicken had two wings vs a wing and breast that many restaurants provide. And for my special I was also surprised that I had two legs as the entree. This is something that does bother me but again, its just me. Okay so for the most part, I didn't mind it as far as taste, but with a little tweaking, I am sure they will get it together and make this place thrive. I have waited for quite a while since seeing their sign last year so I guess the anticipation was high up there. I will give them a four because it's definitely worth you checking them out and trying some "soul" food in the Little Italy (Original) area.

4.description: I went to this place yesterday after  I found out the taco place I wanted to go to was now closed.  I was in the neighborhood for lunch and decided to give the place a chance.I walked in and was looking for some type of menu.  The young lady at the counter gave a sheet of paper in a plastic covering and it was handwritten menu, I thought, "okay".... Nevertheless, I asked her what came with the dinner, she told me  you get 2 sides.  So I said, okay. I had to ask what was in certain sides, due to my non-pork, non-beef diet and she accommodated.  I ordered the smothered chicken, with red beans and rice and greens.  My order came out fairly fast.I walked to cramped front and sat down to eat at the patio furniture set-up, I thought to myself, "okay"......whatever!.Well...... let me say, I could have sent 4 to 5 dollars on lunch at subway and had a MUCH BETTER satisfied meal!.  I tried the red beans and rice first and it had ZERO favor!!!... it was VERY bland and had NOTHING!.  Because I cut down on my salt in-tack YEARS ago, I rarely if ever add salt to already cooked food.  THIS was one of those times and it did absolutely NOTHING to it.  After a couple of I didn't touch it anymore.  The greens were okay, even with all the damn stems in it!. They had a nice favor and was the star of the plastic to-go container.  Then I tried the chicken.  It was fried then laid in a bucket of gravy!!... First of all, DAMN-IT....because I forgot fried is usually the first step (I gave up fried food for lent this year and haven't gone back yet)... Let me say, that chicken wasn't even worth it!!.. The breading was wayyy too thick and again, it had zero seasoning.  It too was bland!!.. I spent 11 dollars for a meal that I could only enjoy a 1/3 of..... Very dissatisfied!.. I will not be back to "try" anything else.  I'm afraid to say, this is a "one and done" production.  I tried to give a new place a chance, it just didn't do it for me.I know that everyone's "taste" are different. Some people have given the place far more stars than I have and that's cool, hey, "everything is everything".

0.description: There's not a more cost effective and greater interior place than the clubhouse aka Hope Cafe. I don't think there's an event that wouldn't  be happily accommodated over at Hope. All proceeds go to to help the voiceless get an education as well. Weddings, showers, bridal, reunions, anniversary and its hidden which makes it super private from the general public. You got my vote!

3.description: Fantastic service. Attentive, polite, and very accommodating staff. I've only been to this restaurant about three times now and I feel like a regular by the warm way I am treated when I come in. Really could not be a more welcoming or comfortable environment.  Great menu with options for just about anybody, a good variety without being too complicated or overwhelming. quality food in perfectly satisfying portions absolutely unrivaled in the area. Really stands out.

1.description: First let's talk about the fact that they had no menu. We got there and asked for one and the dude said "Well what you want we got..." And started naming everything he could. We had the baked chicken which was very good and well seasoned. I had the greens which were great and my girl had the yams which were very delicious as well. The corn bread was dry and then we got to the Mac and cheese which was served in a bowl like oatmeal. It was bland. The place was clean but it was freezing in there. Get your food to go. Pass on the Mac and cheese and get white bread.

0.description: I went to Johnna's for dinner tonight.  I had the fried chicken with mac n cheese and greens.  It came with a piece of corn bread.  The chicken was spiced very well, and  extremely delicious.  The greens were tasty, as was the mac and cheese.  I would definitely go back.

2.description: This place is unexpectedly amazing. Little hole-in-the-wall off of Western near Harrison and the Blue line stop.The team that runs the place CARES. I stopped in for breakfast to go, and was given one of the best, to-go meals I could have imagined (Fresh fruit, nicely laid out, real eggs, had a few requests which were handled and placed on tin foil inside the plastic to-go box so my food didn't taste like the container).Friendly crew, quality, authentic soul food made with care.  Hard to find these days.

5.description: delicious food by nice people with ample outdoor seating. favorite place to eat in my neighborhood!
