6.description: This place has good food and good people.  Living a few blocks away, I've been eying this place for a while now.  With a small front close to the highway, an untrained eye would have write it off.  But I am well aware of the value of a good home cooked meal.  I walked in hoping for a basic breakfast spread, eggs, bacon, hash brown.  After not finding what I wanted on the menu, yes I'm a bit of a picky person, John helped me out and worked out a deal for me.  I got eggs, bacon, homemade hash brown with green bell pepper, wheat toast, jam, and a coffee all for under $8.  And it was gooood.  Real eggs, even got asked while they were being cooked if they were cooked enough (sunny side up).  The bacon was perfectly cooked, and was even offered turkey bacon.  I was very very satisfied with the food, being as picky as I am.  John made sure to know that he has an off the menu soul food menu that changes everyday that I should be sure to check on.  It is clear to me that I will definitely be checking it out and coming back.  There was some sort of criminal show on tv and it was pretty interesting.  It felt like eating at home, even exchanging commentary with John.  This place not only has good food, but also good people.

7.description: I google searched this restaurant and decided to go because I definitely support local businesses. However, I won't be returning to this place again! When my spouse and I walked in, the 'employees' were sitting down chatting; no problem- we were the only customers there. When we placed our order, they didn't notify us that they didn't have certain items on their menu. It wasn't  until AFTER the food was prepared. Speaking of which, our meats (fish/chicken)were cooked on the spot. Our sides were re-heated, so who knows how long the food has been there. The mac & cheese is terrible, so is the spaghetti. These are simple items to make, but there's had NO flavor. Also, the credit card machine doesn't work, wasn't notified of that until afterwards either.

8.description: Once you get past the decor, or lack thereof, the food here is quite good. The menu is very extensive, which I find to be a little overwhelming. But there certainly is something for everyone.  I have been sticking to soul food staples like baked chicken, jerk chicken, green beans, candied yams, corn bread and sautéed spinach.  I have not scratched the surface of this menu.  The staff is very friendly and quick to customize dishes to suit your tastes. I think Johnna's is a great addition to the neighborhood.

9.description: I recently had a chance to check this place out since its really close to my house. I used to go to west side gyros till now, I love this place. The menu has a wide variety of options and a very good price. Everything from basic gyro restaurant type food to steak dinners. The staff is very polite and the service is also very fast which is great. I definitely recommend stopping by this place to see for yourself.

10.description: I went to their grand opening on 8/2/14.The waitress didn't know to take orders correctly, the cashier didn't know how to operate the cash register and the wait was extremely long. Got my food I ordered 2 dinners (chicken& fish) and both were not done. okay I understand this was their 1st day. So I decided to give the place another try I ordered chicken, cabbage, mac & cheese and meatloaf, cabbage, sweet potatoes. I have never had soul food so HORRIBLE in my life. This restaurant is new and clean but the food and service is horrible. a lot of people in the area where food is being prepared is a NO-NO. I noticed one girl taking unprepared food out the back door once i got my food so I decided to go drive thru the alley to see where she went with the food. I saw a big steel freezer in the back by the alley where there is rats. I don't know how the City of Chicago cleared this place to open! beware!I wish I could give this review no stars!

4.description: I hate to downgrade a new restaurant, but I went back and it was very underwhelming. I had catfish that was just so-so. I ordered spaghetti, , but what I got were fettuccine noodles covered with an extra thick meat paste. The macaroni and cheese was not that great. My son will eat anybody's macaroni and he did not care for it, either.

0.description: I use to come here alot since it is convenient to my job, and of course, you can get little things here (unlike a bigger more modern mom and pop store), but very limited. It seems that when Sam left, I just got really bored of coming here. He was the guy who use to greet you at the door and behind the counter. Now Rahid is there, and although he is nice, he's not very talkative. If you want to pick up some lottery tickets and even check them, this is the place. I mean the store is very antiquated and the items (some) are old looking, but again, it is what it is and for what its worth, you can buy frozen Indian entrees here.

I finally found my salon! For years, I've been looking for a good beautician to do my hair. I wanted to be happy with my hairstyle each and every time I went. I finally found it here! It all started when I was looking at a picture of one of my Facebook friends. She posted her new hair style. I was thinking to myself: WOW, whoever did her hair did a wonderful job! So I looked up her beautician on Facebook and inboxed her. To my surprise, she replied and I was able to make an appointment with her. Of course I was skeptical like I always am when I try a new beautician, and I'm always indecisive about what hairstyle I want. LaDonna was VERY patient with me. She told me the options I had and what she could do. She had to fix what the last so called beautician did. So I basically had to start over. I was very satisfied with my hair. Even though I didn't know how she was going to style my hair, LaDonna did an amazing job. I also noticed that since I started going there to get my hair done, my hair has been growing like crazy, which is a good thing! And another thing I noticed, all of the beautician there WORK TOGETHER in PEACE. Nobody's fighting for clients, they are very professional, no profanity, if a beautician is out, the next beautician will do your hair until your original beautician returns, no he said or she said, no talking about one another behind their backs, and it's wonderful! Where do you see that in other beauty shops? NOWHERE. I really appreciate that! Also, ALL of them do a wonderful job! LaDonna, Monica, Stephanie...I don't know the other one's name, but I haven't seen an ugly hairdo yet! They are a little bit pricey, but it is worth every second single penny! I rather pay a bit more than to pay less with a messed up head! If you have short hair and want an an amazing do, this is the salon to go to. I promise you, you will NOT be disappointed!

Tried nanas spaghetti sauce for the first time and was very pleasantly surprised! It was a very nice twist on the traditional sauce that were all used to. The cloves and the cinnamon in the sauce adds such a great flavor! I highly recommend giving it a taste!

1.description: Great urban fashion boutique, comfortable price point with unique items that are great wardrobe additions.  I found the perfect dress and jumpsuit while shopping there about a month ago just before vacation.  The gentleman that was working there (I forget his name) was wonderful.  He wasn't pushy but provided great recommendations and style suggestions were right on point.

2.description: Ok, so i went back - lo and behold!  they were open!  There were some great finds! walked out wiht a new wordrobe.  the owner was veery nice and helpful.  Ok, so i understand the odd hours.

0.description: You Must stop in to get that dress that no one will be wearing but you.. this is ur one stop shop. If you can't find it here you ARE NOT LOOKING....I know i can't walk out without a bag in hand!!!

28.description: Great food and even better prices!! Love having an authentic Indian restaurant in the city. Try the butter chicken and biryani. Will definitely be coming back!

1.description: Family owned place making great indi/paki comfort food. Welcome to the neighborhood and excited to be returning to this place more. The lunch combo was great option so I can try multiple menu items. Went with pepper chicken and Kihari chicken, both were great dishes and would recommend trying both. The pepper chicken was flavorful and spicy without being too hot.  Here's my promise, I will come back and try all the dishes on the menu!  More reviews to come but 1st visit was a success!!

9.description: Love this place!  The food tastes fresh,  I love the amount of heat.  The Aloo is delicious, have had all the biryani dishes,  just tried the Beef Nihari this past friday. Great flavor  but a bitter too salty, could have just been that day?  Would love to see some new dishes, perhaps one  week? Great value

29.description: Was in Chicago on Friday be stopped by for a quick bite. Great people and even better food!

23.description: Despite the near perfect rating, I have to say that I don't think this place is revolutionary or that it is the epitome of perfected Indian cuisine. I think that there is a lot of hype, or perhaps exaggeration, but hey- different people, different viewpoints, different tastes. This place is very small, a tiny and quaint little Indian and Pakistani restaurant. The inside is clean, and it's evident that it has just opened. I was greeted quickly upon arrival by a very sweet older lady, and saw the paper menus in front of the register to order. I ordered chicken Karahi, and the samosa bites. There is no ice with your water, but that's fine. My one problem with the menu though, was that there was an older version and a newer version- they did not specify that until I ordered, and paid more than I thought I was going to. The lady at the register just dismissed it as an "oops these are the new menus after you paid" kind of deal.The food took about 10 minutes to arrive, and when it did portions appeared to be quite a bit smaller than the average Indian restaurant. The food tasted pretty fresh, but it was truthfully underwhelming. It was very bland, very average, and not out of this world spectacular like the other reviews suggested. Yes, the chicken was tender, the samosas were somewhat crunchy, but it was nothing life changing or spectacular. To be honest, I was truthfully a bit disappointed because I had read the reviews of this place on Yelp. The food was not flavorful, my chicken Karahi tasted pretty watered down and bland, honestly. And the samosas were full of oil- I bit into one, and oil squirted out of the other end! I had expected a bit better, but the food is not bad by any means, just lacking in flavors. The portions were also kind of small, and it was a bit just underwhelming.

5.description: Not bad at all! I will be super fair and impartial of course. This area needed this in so many ways so I am quite excited to come in. I came in but no menus, it seems that they have run out so in a few days they should have them, and I'm told by the little lady that they are going to start delivering too.I wanted to try the buttered chicken which of course has a nice and curry tasting feel. The chicken is tender as it melds well with the curry sauce. I am quite pleased, and of course the portions are definitely enough for one or maybe two but I'm selfish. Nicely done with a really good hint of turmeric and fire, of course not too much but enough to make my palate happy.  I decided to also order some rice and that was perfect for this. It's fluffy and lends itself to the wonderful ingredients of this homemade  tasting concoction.  Everything here is homemade and I can definitely appreciate the love taken to make this dish what it is.If you like Indian cuisine well, this is Indian for sure. Not the classiest of places but that's okay, considering it's supposed to be out of your kitchen type of place. Not the biggest storefront of course , as this spot was once my personal trainers place. But enough for a few people to congregate and have a nice meal. Is it expensive? Nah, for $6 and some change I had the chicken in stew curry, a few dollars more got me rice and a beverage. Which by the way is amazing but I forgot the name of it. You will experience a real Indian meal here for sure. Stop by and let them know Damian from YELP sent you, I'm sure they will be pleased.

31.description: Butter chicken is best here. I also had pepper chicken today and it is mind blowing. This place is right across the 157 bus stop and the UIC shuttle so super convenient for students at UIC and medical district. My husband comes almost every other night!

25.description: Cute little Indian/Pakistani restaurant with just one small table and several stool counter seating owned by a friendly mother-daughter team. I came here with my coworker today after he let me try his lamb biryani yesterday. I decided to order just that because the lamb biryani was just that good. The rice was perfectly seasoned and not too spicy. The lamb was soft and tender and falling off the bone. I usually order the chicken biryani at most Indian/Pakistani restaurants because the lamb was often too tough or chewy; not this place. I also tried my friend's channa masala today, and that was great too. I'd definitely come back here whenever I'm in the neighborhood as I can finally say that I have a place I like for lamb biryani.

12.description: Cute little Indian/Pakistani restaurant with just one small table and several stool counter seating owned by a friendly mother-daughter team. I came here with my coworker today after he let me try his lamb biryani yesterday. I decided to order just that because the lamb biryani was just that good. The rice was perfectly seasoned and not too spicy. The lamb was soft and tender and falling off the bone. I usually order the chicken biryani at most Indian/Pakistani restaurants because the lamb was often too tough or chewy; not this place. I also tried my friend's channa masala today, and that was great too. I'd definitely come back here whenever I'm in the neighborhood as I can finally say that I have a place I like for lamb biryani.

21.description: One of my friends suggested this place while we were deciding to order indian food for lunch. We stopped by the place to check out as they don't deliver food (not yet, but guy at the counter promised me they're gonna start delivering food soon). We ordered lamb briyani and pepper chicken. God they were so authentic and delicious and tasted like indian home made food. Pretty good service. It has definitely become my to-go place for Indian food.

16.description: I just went to this place for the first time for lunch, and I thought it was pretty good. I had the Lamb Biryani which was pretty good - lamb had a lot of flavor and spice, and the rice was well-cooked. The presentation wasn't amazing, but the flavors were more than enough to recommend it.In terms of service, it is very friendly, but a bit slow as there seemed to be only one cook. I didn't mind because there wasn't much of a line, but it could be a problem at times when the restaurant gets busy.Overall, very good food and looking forward to coming back.

17.description: Yummy food, freshly made and very flavorful. We happened to explore this restaurant as we were looking for Indian restaurants in University Village area. Also, the food tasted very home made - must try if you are looking for reasonably priced and authentic Indian food. Highly recommended!

10.description: The food is really good and aesthetically made. Its a happy relief from the shitty gareeb nawaz we have on halsted near UIC. Simple dal fry and rice was as amazing as it could be. Butter chicken is also good. Mango lassi was average but the food overall was very nice and extremely affordable.

11.description: Ryhana's home cooked style meals remind me of my mom's cooking.While visiting Chicago, I decided to try this new Halal restaurant and it hit the spot! The food was finger licking good. (I had the pepper chicken wrap because i was craving that spicy Indian flavor). The prices are cheap and I had leftovers to take home!  I can't wait to try the butter chicken people are raving about.The location is super convenient! I don't have to drive all the way north to Devon for some great Halal Indian food :)

26.description: This place is AMAZING. I used to think I liked places like Naansense and Pub Royale, but after eating at Ryhana's there is no comparison. This is as good as it gets. Granted, I have never been to India, but I assume there is no better choice for Indian food in Chicago.

27.description: It was a cold Sunday and I was craving hot spicy food and the food here just hit the spot. We got nihari, butter chicken and pepper chicken, and all of them were terrific.  If I ever miss my mom's cooking (which is a fairly frequent occurrence), I'll definitely come here.

0.description: I had the good fortune of stopping into Ryhana's today, and let me tell you what a treat it was. This family owned and operated spot offers all sorts of Indian/Pakistani favorites from nihari to butter chicken, and even wraps for when you're on the go. Today I had the sihk kebab wrap and tandoori chicken. Both were excellent. The wrap was the perfect spicy. The chicken was wonderfully tender and juicy. At such a low cost, I will certainly be returning soon!

20.description: A coworker told me about this restaurant last week and highly recommended the butter chicken.  The family that runs the restaurant are so nice.  When I went in, I was immediately given a friendly greeting and told more about the menu items.  I was even given a sample of the mango lassi since I'd never had it before.  I got the butter chicken  with a side of rice and naan bread.  It was very flavorful and creamy.  I went again today and tried the Karahi Chicken and that was also very good.  It is not as saucy or spicy as the butter chicken but the chicken is very tender (chicken leg quarters) and also flavorful.  I'm going to try something different each time I go!I highly recommend folks giving Ryhana's a try!

19.description: Butter chicken is best here. I also had pepper chicken today and it is mind blowing. This place is right across the 157 bus stop and the UIC shuttle so super convenient for students at UIC and medical district. My husband comes almost every other night!

2.description: Four star partially because the prices are so reasonable... Some co-workers and I wanted delivery and decided to try Ryhanas. We ordered butter chicken, Karahi chicken, Bihari kabob wrap, naan and roti. The naan and roti were excellent! Naan was soft and fresh. The butter chicken was creamy and well-flavored. The Karahi was a little oily, but overall ok. The Bihari kabob wrap was a bit salty and I would probably skip it if I ordered here again. The entrees (butter chicken and kahari) were both only ~$6.50, which was awesome. It's definitely not small portions. Delivery was quick and easy!Overall, food didn't blow me away, but it was yummy and the price is right!!

32.description: I had the good fortune of stopping into Ryhana's today, and let me tell you what a treat it was. This family owned and operated spot offers all sorts of Indian/Pakistani favorites from nihari to butter chicken, and even wraps for when you're on the go. Today I had the sihk kebab wrap and tandoori chicken. Both were excellent. The wrap was the perfect spicy. The chicken was wonderfully tender and juicy. At such a low cost, I will certainly be returning soon!

18.description: 3.5 stars - Pretty good for the money - had butter chicken, chicken biryani, and a vegi dish.  I have to take at least a star off for forgetting a naan in the order, promising to credit my card for it but never doing it.

13.description: Despite the near perfect rating, I have to say that I don't think this place is revolutionary or that it is the epitome of perfected Indian cuisine. I think that there is a lot of hype, or perhaps exaggeration, but hey- different people, different viewpoints, different tastes. This place is very small, a tiny and quaint little Indian and Pakistani restaurant. The inside is clean, and it's evident that it has just opened. I was greeted quickly upon arrival by a very sweet older lady, and saw the paper menus in front of the register to order. I ordered chicken Karahi, and the samosa bites. There is no ice with your water, but that's fine. My one problem with the menu though, was that there was an older version and a newer version- they did not specify that until I ordered, and paid more than I thought I was going to. The lady at the register just dismissed it as an "oops these are the new menus after you paid" kind of deal.The food took about 10 minutes to arrive, and when it did portions appeared to be quite a bit smaller than the average Indian restaurant. The food tasted pretty fresh, but it was truthfully underwhelming. It was very bland, very average, and not out of this world spectacular like the other reviews suggested. Yes, the chicken was tender, the samosas were somewhat crunchy, but it was nothing life changing or spectacular. To be honest, I was truthfully a bit disappointed because I had read the reviews of this place on Yelp. The food was not flavorful, my chicken Karahi tasted pretty watered down and bland, honestly. And the samosas were full of oil- I bit into one, and oil squirted out of the other end! I had expected a bit better, but the food is not bad by any means, just lacking in flavors. The portions were also kind of small, and it was a bit just underwhelming.

4.description: Came in tonight about 10 minutes after their closing time and thankfully Ryhana's Cuisine didn't turn us away-- THANK YOU THANK YOU! We ordered takeout; the same food order my Boyfriend and I had from my last review. I gotta say, they have definitely stepped up their game in my book! really looking forward to seeing how this place develops with time. We're happy to support our neighbors!Everything tasted great! Kudos Ryhana's Cuisine and thank you!

24.description: Hands down, the BEST Indian/Pakistani food I've had yet in Chicago! I went there THREE times in ONE week because the food was so tasty. I've had almost half the menu and everything has been excellent and worth coming back for. I highly recommend the flavorful butter chicken and pepper chicken, the fall-off-the-bone tender nihari, and delicious sikh kabob. My new favorite drink is the plain lassi, which is a sweetened yogurt drink. Even if the food were just okay, I'd go back for the prices... I'm happy to have food a great place for inexpensive but amazing food!

6.description: Had the pleasure of dining at Ryhana's.The food was pretty good.Im definitely adding them to my list of places for Indian food.I was there about 2pm during the week so there was plenty of street parking.They dont have too many items to choose from but the four I ordered were delicious.It was enough for 2 people but thats how I get down because I like to try different things at the same time and dont mind having leftovers.People running it were really nice and helpful.Would be nice if they had more to choose from but its a small place so my guess is thats probably why they dont add more to the menu.I was content and will go back next time Im in the area.Im really glad I have a new spot to go to thats not a big hassle for me to get to.

22.description: Had a taste for indo/pak food last night and came across this gem in the uic area.  Ordered nihari, butter chicken and some naan for the family and some guests.  We had a feast.  The food was delicious and affordable.  Really cannot go wrong here.

15.description: First time I tried Indian food, good flavor and vegan dishs but was too salty esp for the dal fry. Not too greasy.

7.description: Can you say yum!!! This place is amazing and so close to home. Perfect spice. I got the butter chicken, pepper chicken and lamb curry. I would recommend all three. Move out of the way!! This new hotspot on Taylor street will blow your mind!

8.description: Great selection of vegetarian dishes : Fresh naan bread , excellently cooked rice and aloo masala ( potatoes in spices ) . Great prices , excellent freshly cooked food !

30.description: First off, let me say that I'm soooooo happy this place exists. It's a 30 second walk from my apartment and I've been dying to have cuisine like this close by. When I came in, I was greeted by a sweet older woman and a younger woman who was working as the cashier. They apparently aren't fully open yet, so I had two options to choose from. Note that their final menu doesn't have a ton of options, but it does have some good ones, including cheap wraps for a quick lunch. I went with the butter chicken, which was rich and nicely seasoned (although slightly salty, but if you get rice, it kind of mellows it out). In my opinion, this place is super cheap. I paid $8.96 for a curry, rice (you can choose between rice and paratha), and a pop. Considering just how many places in this general part of the city charge $12 for entrees and an extra $2.50 for rice, this was suuuuch a steal. I also received a ton of food, and I'm pretty sure that after adding the rice, this is going to last for at least two more meals. I'm thrilled to have a place like this in the neighborhood, but my one complaint is that I wish there was something like a chicken vindaloo on the menu. This might have to do with regional differences in cuisine or just a preference on behalf of the chef, but I love spicy food and wish there was more of it. I hope this place sticks around and I can't wait for them to be fully open so I can try more menu items.

3.description: Biryanis for days! There's only a few restaurants in this area that I can eat on a consistent basis without feeling too terrible about my health. Ryhana's is one of them, though some of the food here is pretty spicy which is kinda nice in this freezing winter.I've had the opportunity to try quite a few dishes since everything is really reasonably priced. The butter chicken is saucy and well seasoned with enough chunks of chicken. It definitely goes great with one of their biryanis which come with a good helping of rice. I also had their lamb curry which is a bit sparse in the meat area and has quite a few bones, but was still tasty. Their lentil Daal Fry is good, but is an oddity since  it's served with a toasted dinner bun instead of either paratha, roti, and naan--it might explain why it's only priced at $2.50.What's wonderful about Ryhana's is that they have daily specials. These tend to knock a few dollars off what's already a cheap meal. In conclusion, takeout here is a MUST if you're looking for quality ethnic grub!

14.description: The wifey and I were in the area and decided to try Ryhana's Cuisine. We are Indian so we know when the food is up to par or not. I have to say the Butter Chicken and Nihari was the best we ever had. I wish we lived closer so this could be a more frequent stop  Will definitely go out of our way to visit again.  Also try the Mango Lassi. I'm not really a mango Lassi type of guy but i was pleasantly surprised.

58.description: The era of pizza places that offer huge single slices is disappearing. So I'm glad places like Damenzo's still exist. My first encounter with a Damenzo's pizza slice will be forever memorable. It was cut up and put on a plate for me and it literally looked like a half a pizza was served. I loved it. I've also tried their famous pizza puff, but to me, it seemed a tad too big and bready for me. I did love the tomato sauce it came with, it was great for dipping. Everything we ordered seemed fresh and delicious. They get a big thumbs up for their cheese fries, I'd definitely get them again.Overall, Damenzo's will be my goto spot to scratch my itch for huge pizza slices. It's great for groups and families so definitely give them a try if you haven't already. Bon apetit!

56.description: I have been coming here for several years now, thanks to the close proximity to my job..  This place has become our go to spot when the hospital cafeteria has bored our tastebuds. When the conversation of giant pizza slices comes up.. this is the first place that comes to my mind...  What is funny, is that when we mention mexican food in my office, this is probably the first place we think of as well, lol.. How can this be you ask?? well let me tell you that Damenzo's was initially an Italian staple here on Taylor street, offering giant pizza slices, yummy pastas, sandwiches and salads.  A few years ago, the owner opened up a taco joint around the corner "Papi's Tacos" on Western Ave...  If I am not mistaken, I think he earned best burrito in chicago honors from one of the local newspapers at one point (don't quote me on that)..  Anywho.. a couple of years later, the two restaurants are now merged at the recently remodeled Damenzo's location on Taylor St.  Now when I dine here, I wrestle over what I want to eat..  Do I want a giant slice of sausage pizza or a burrito?? A steak torta or a giant calzone??   Good thing is that everything here is pretty damn good, so regardless of my choice, my stomach will thank me!The owner and staff are very friendly and eager to get your order taken and served.      The restaurant is clean, and has plenty of seating in the two dining areas and the outdoor patio.  Must have:  I say try the one fo the giant pizza slices or the giant calzone..  Both are very tasty and very big, so keep that in mind.   You can easily share a calzone between two people and a pizza slice is almost too big for one person.   Prices are very reasonable, $5 for a slice and a pop,   About $6 for the calzone..   Fugettaboutit!

29.description: Placed order for delivery, on time, was still hot. Pizza was so good, loved the sauce. Toppings were very generous.

42.description: Awesome Chicago Style Stuffed Pizza! Out local go to pizza joint... not great atmosphere, a total delivery or carry out place, but the food is awesome!

23.description: Great place, my brother brought me here for a pizza puff that has kept me coming back ever since... Nice pizzeria with a New York feel that is nestled in Chicago's west loop.

47.description: The pizza is good and they offered us a discount for my class when we had a class pizza party.  They own a lot of businesses in the neighborhood and they seem to care about the people who live here.

8.description: Always great food the service is good and prices are decent I eat here maybe 4 times a month

31.description: Service is fast and food is amazing. I'm originally from Chicago and I always come here when I visit to get my beef. I have also tried their pizza too. If you are in Chicago and looking for some good food definitely stop by here.

34.description: great pizza, and beef, very good, a lil hard to get service, but understandable.

16.description: This banquet hall is just hands down amazing!! I just attended a wedding there this past Saturday. Although I never even knew this place existed because it is well hidden between other buildings, the inside is just gorgeous! It brings a chicago urban vibe along with gorgeous architecture plus intimacy. The bar was big, although they probably should have had two bartenders. The fettuccine alfredo and chicken parm were soooo good too. Loved the layout and brick walls. Friendly staff, great for a wedding or party, awesome mezzanine level for a dj so they aren't in the way.

13.description: I've been coming to Damenzo's for years!!!! My father introduced me to the place when I was a little girl. He'd bring us here for the biggest slice of pizza and Italian beefs. I've never had a bad issue with the service it's usually pretty good. The food is always HOT and fresh! You can watch them make the food also!!! I remember as a kid coming in here watching the guys flip the pizza dough in the air. Today I called my order in after my younger cousin had them deliver her a small pizza. I was unaware that they delivered so I immediately  jumped on the phone to place an order. The delivery charge is $4.50 so I ended up just coming in and picking up my food. Great food!!!

11.description: For what it is, Damenzo's is a great neighborhood pizza spot. It's not the best tasting pizza, but it is good and serves its purpose. I highly recommend them, especially if you are doing large parties. Their overall value is way better than most local pizza places (price, taste, and service).

39.description: I've had a taste for pizza - so I decided to get a slice at lunch. You would think that good pizza is a given in Little Italy - uh, no.  Any place around here that sells slices makes mediocre pizza - at best.  I had not been to Damenzo's in YEARS so I figured I would go back for a slice see if it was any good..now I know why I had not been back.This place is a friggin zoo at lunch - no system, order, of even a hint that anyone cares about the chaos of just trying to order.  Friggin' disaster.  It's was damn free for all!  U can't tell who ordered from who was waiting for their food.  Two huge menus - neither lists slices of pizza as an option, but they did have a Mexican Food section ?? so I had to ask whether they still sold slices.  No clear indication of whether there was a line somewhere - can't figure out where to pay - let alone where the hell do I wait for my food??As far as the pizza - ew.  Yes, it's a big slice - but bigger isn't better, it's just bigger - and this big slice of cheese pizza was a waste of $4.  As I waited for my food, I see a guy walk over to the oven with a pizza box and pull out a nasty old slice of pizza and threw it in the oven - yep, you guess it - I got a nice big slice of reheated pizza  Not even a slice that was sitting under a heat lamp - this looked like it was the last slice from last night's frat party.  So after the counter person yells at me that my slice was ready - I received a brown paper bag, with my reheated slice of pizza sitting on a piece of wax paper - obviously folded in half to fit in the bag...which it barely did - the tip was protruding from the bag.  Now, I know I shouldn't be too picky about packaging, but it's getting chilly out, and I have to walk to my office with this paper bag.  Of course - you guessed it - pizza was cold by the time I get back to the office.  And the clincher - it tasted worse than a frozen pizza.UGH...NEVER AGAIN!  I guess if I want good pizza I should venture anywhere BUT Little Italy.

37.description: I have to say this pizza was pretty awesome! We stopped here on a late night after a Christmas party......so the late hours are super nice! The staff was friendly. The french fries and pizza were very good and nicely priced. The pizza isn't the best I've had, but definitely worth coming back for. Their menu is extensive as well, they have everything from traditional Italian dishes to tacos. The pizza slices are humongous......enough for 3. We would definitely stop by Damenzo's again if we're in the area.

0.description: I lived off of damenzos for quite some time last February, and surprisingly my GI tract had never been better. For catering to every demographic, damenzos is killing it. Pizza bigger than my head, tortas, tacos, chicken wings, sandwiches, desserts. This places leaves little to be desired.My favorites include the pizza and Mexican food; their tacos are super delish. You can spend 5-10 dollars here and be uncomfortably full for hours. It's a great bang for he buck. Did I mention that they're open late?!In review, I like this place a lot. If I could continue eating here everyday without consequence to my body, I would in a second. However, it's become more of a sometimes snack due to obesity. Go check it out!

38.description: This review is actually for Damenzo's Banquet hall around the corner (741 S. Western).  They're owned by the same family.  After a site visit, we were hooked.  It's hard to imagine how beautiful this tastefully remodeled church is from the outside.  Beyond that, it's very well laid-out for a seated party of 100 people - or more for cocktails.We held our office holiday party here, and everyone raved that it was the best ever.  The food was good, the staff were AMAZING - attentive, professional, patient.  It was the most effortless event our organization has ever had.  The mezzanine was great for our DJ (we brought one in), and the acoustics were perfect for both dinner and dancing.  They even let us do a pre-party tasting lunch so we could make informed menu choices, and adapted their offerings to our needs.  If you're looking for a place to host a reception, holiday party, large family event,  or corporate luncheon, this place should make your short list.

51.description: I love the pizza but I would change the crust. If they do that, the pizza will be perfect.

27.description: If you are looking for authentic Italian cuisine  that is just like mom used to make, then Damenzos on Taylor street is your place. Outstanding meatballs the size of a softball and KILLER lasagna are just a few of the choices you will find. With great service and great value as "bookends" to your experience, you can not go wrong at Damenzos. I was truly blown away. Thank you Dominic and your crew for a delicious and enjoyable eating experience.

32.description: Awesome pizza slices. Been coming here since I was 6 all the way from Little Village whenever my dad fixed TVs here. They have tasted the same after all these years. A one of a kind flavor that nobody can mimic. This is the spot to gobble down on great pizza.

54.description: The jumbo pizza is incredibly large, cheap and delicious. I came in on Saturday night and received my jumbo slice of sausage pizza in less than 3 minutes. So happy that this place is a hop, skip & a jump away from where I live!

48.description: Food here is a hit and miss.  The pizza is good but not great.  The mexican food is beyond disgusting.  I got sick from eating it here.  The fries are greasy and soggy.  I would only stick with the pizzas here.  Everything else on the menu is either average or dissapointing.

44.description: Italian joint with some Mexican fare.  Tacos and tostadas or pizza and pasta...and so much more.The hubs was treating because he is always craving pizza.  It's $4 total (including tax) for a jumbo, and I mean JUMBO, slice of pizza.  The pizza by the slices only come with one topping; pepperoni, sausage or plain ol' cheese.  We each got our own.  It is such a big slice that I ended up sharing a fair amount of mine with the two little fur babies and I was still pretty full afterwards.The crust is damn near amazing, better than the place down the block's crust IMHO.  It's hand tossed thin crust and baked to perfection.  The crust held up all on it's own, I could eat it one handed without a mess.  I only wish they offered more by-the-slice topping variety.  I love my pizzas topped with lots of veggies...but I'd still choose this over the place down the block.

24.description: Don't know what happened to Damenzo's. Ive been coming here for 11 years and it's always been great. Yesterday got the worst slices ever from there. Not that much cheese and it was like they were sitting there the entire day.. Not fresh at all. Really disappointed.

7.description: This place has turned into an absolute mess. Part pizza parlor, part Mexican restaurant, and a deli counter to boot. Ordered tacos and a side of rice.  A couple bites later I leave the food and walk out, sometimes it's best to just cut your losses.  Just. Awful. As mentioned in another review, this place is pretty grimy.  With so many options available to consumers I'm shocked this place is still in business.

49.description: I've been going here since my days living across the street while a student at UIC.  Their pizza slices are HUGE...and that's an understatement when I say that.  For just over $3 a slice, you can feed about 3 people with that same slice!Not the best pizza I've ever had but worth the money especially if you are in the area.

40.description: The beef & pizza is good!  However service is everything to me & I was told by one employee they never accept credit cards for delivery (which is a lie) & the delivery guy will not get out of the car to deliver. Also if you order pickup; you are courteous & wait to be asked "how may I help you?" Forget about it. The rudest person with the biggest mouth gets served first. The customer service leaves much to be desired.

53.description: I love this placeOpen late, good prices, good food.  Atmosphere leaves something to be desired, but thats par for the course in this neighborhood.  Their pizza is huge/cheap but not my favorite.  I get the burritos a few times a week:  gigantic burrito with tonsss of steak and beans and rice on the side... all for a shade over 8 bucks.    Guys who work here arn't overly friendly, but pretty decent overall.

30.description: I love Damenzo's I live in Pilsen but have had them deliver to as far as 55th and Loomis and Lake/Pulaski love them for that.....but the food is very good and consistent. The Calzone is humungous and delicious and I love their cheesy beef and the container it comes in. Friendly fast service (if the delivery guy can find your address, ha ha).

46.description: The pizza tasted delicious and it's huge! They have a good selection of food like pastas, pizza, even turkey burgers lol.  I will be coming back, but just remember to bring cash because they do not accept credit cards!

1.description: One star for size and one for price. That is all they get! Ordered a family size pizza for game night with friends and the pizza was so bland that I refuse to allow my guess to split the cost! Half sausage, green pepper and onions. The veggie half with spinach, tomatoes mushroom and onions. The tomatoes sauce taste like Hunts straight from the can and the crust was no better. And was that fake cheese? That cheese had no taste at all! We tried to sprinkle our own seasoning, red peppers and Parmesan cheese but it did not help. There was very little spinach and a few slices on the edge that didn't even have cheese!!!! Will be "Un" book marking them and throwing out the menu. I guess the people at my job order it because you can get extremely large pizzas for a reasonable price. I rather pay more because I love pizza and this was a great disappointment.

55.description: I only come here for the jumbo pizza and I've never been disappointed. I think it puts Bacci to shame. The slices are just as big but they have more meat, more sauce, and more flavor. Drunk or sober this pizza is still delicious. They stay open late so they can enable my bad decision making. I appreciate that, haha. The people are a little gruff but I'm not there for the ambiance or the personalities, I'm there for amazing pizza and that's what they give me, every time.

9.description: Ordered lunch delivery from here for the office. 8 different orders and the food was here in under 30 minutes... That's pretty much unheard of so if you're looking for fast delivery and live within a couple miles, this is your spot. I had a grilled chicken salad which came with a ton of fresh mozzarella cubes and ripe tomatoes. The chicken was well seasoned and a large portion. They didn't put salad dressing in with the order but we had some in the fridge so it's all good. Also tried a bite of veggie pizza which was awesome. It was still plenty hot which you can't always count on if you get delivery. Everyone who got them also seemed to love their beef sandwiches. They have a bunch of vegetarian options as well. Would definitely order from Damezo's again.

26.description: I put four stars because of the behemoth of a sandwich I got from here! I ended up with the Damenzo Sandwich (#1), which had mortadella, salami, and something else that I can't remember right now... I watched the entire time they made the sandwich, and the veggies were so fresh and so clean clean! And oh my god are they GENEROUS! I ate a quarter of the sandwich and was stuffed. I did not eat anything else for the remainder of my six hour drive home. What a pleasant surprise!I guess the only negative thing I can say is about myself, which is that I did not try any pizza :)

25.description: I've been coming to Damenzo's for years!!!! My father introduced me to the place when I was a little girl. He'd bring us here for the biggest slice of pizza and Italian beefs. I've never had a bad issue with the service it's usually pretty good. The food is always HOT and fresh! You can watch them make the food also!!! I remember as a kid coming in here watching the guys flip the pizza dough in the air. Today I called my order in after my younger cousin had them deliver her a small pizza. I was unaware that they delivered so I immediately  jumped on the phone to place an order. The delivery charge is $4.50 so I ended up just coming in and picking up my food. Great food!!!

12.description: This is some amazing homemade tasting, old school Chicago thin crust pizza. One of the original 'giant slice' places, their quality is head and shoulders above their imitators. Damemzos is the perfect definition of a real deal Chicago neighborhood joint and that 'hood is west-taylor street/UIC/medical-law-triangle-zone-area. Sometimes they can be insanely busy with long wait times but that goes for any good pizza place. Discovered them while going to UIC and have been ordering from them for 15 years. Hands down one of the best old school pizza places and a prime example of Chicago style thin crust.

59.description: Wow!  Big slices and great tasting. Ordered two jumbo slices of sausage and a drink and my total was only $9!

21.description: The best pasta in town. My bf and I lived right up the street from here and we'd have dinner here quite a bit. The pasta is delicious, the portions are huge! So be prepared for left overs. Try the chicken Alfredo, that's our favorite!

17.description: Italian joint with some Mexican fare.  Tacos and tostadas or pizza and pasta...and so much more.The hubs was treating because he is always craving pizza.  It's $4 total (including tax) for a jumbo, and I mean JUMBO, slice of pizza.  The pizza by the slices only come with one topping; pepperoni, sausage or plain ol' cheese.  We each got our own.  It is such a big slice that I ended up sharing a fair amount of mine with the two little fur babies and I was still pretty full afterwards.The crust is damn near amazing, better than the place down the block's crust IMHO.  It's hand tossed thin crust and baked to perfection.  The crust held up all on it's own, I could eat it one handed without a mess.  I only wish they offered more by-the-slice topping variety.  I love my pizzas topped with lots of veggies...but I'd still choose this over the place down the block.

10.description: The pizza slices are tasty and absolutely huge!!! The establishment provides a large variety of different foods to eat. I don't recommend eating at the restaurant, the decor isn't very inviting, but the food is fantastic. It's an excellent spot for take-out orders. I recommend the pizza, one slice will have you full for hours. It is the largest slice of pizza that I have ever eaten. I definitely recommend trying their food for the experience.

5.description: The service is terrible ,got 2 slices with a friend both of our slices had someone behind that counters hair in them .. Heard a guy behind the counter yelling at a customer that had a delivery on the phone .. This place is a mess .. A shame to its close to home.

3.description: Where do I start with this place????? First of all, we ordered a pepperoni and sausage pizza with "buffalo" wings and a side of fries. Got home to eat the food, found that the pepperoni pizza wasn't even pepperoni, it was just cheese pizza that they just threw pepperoni pieces on. And it was so obvious since the pepperoni curled upwards. On top of that both pizzas were slightly cold. Moving on to the "buffalo" wings and fries, the wings upon opening were drenched in so much buffalo sauce that you could barely taste chicken. The chicken tasted so old, it was like they left it out in the desert to dry out for 2 days and clearly used the sauce to hide it. The fries were just pure mush. We called the manager to get a refund, normally it'd be courteous for a manager to say, "oh I'm sorry, you can come in and we can replace the order for you". Instead, this manager starts arguing with us in such a demeaning tone, talking about how they never give fresh pizza unless it's a whole one, and that it was in fact pepperoni pizza. Just the nerve, and finally says, "well if you don't like it bring it back and I give you your money", definitely never going there again. This isn't coming from a one time customer, I've given this place so many chances but enough is enough. Complete waste of money, frozen home run inn has tasted better.

35.description: Where do I start?  It's not just about the pizza at this place!  The pasta is also fresh and delicious!  My favorite is the shells and broccoli with shrimp, it's flavorful and delicious and they use FRESH broccoli and shrimp.  If you haven't tried the chicken panini sandwich or the other new sandwiches on their menu you are missing out.  The Eggplant Parmesean and Cheese Beef are also really, really good.  Large portions of delicious fresh food at a reasonable price...this is my new favorite spot!!

19.description: The best pasta in town. My bf and I lived right up the street from here and we'd have dinner here quite a bit. The pasta is delicious, the portions are huge! So be prepared for left overs. Try the chicken Alfredo, that's our favorite!

28.description: Great calzones- I mean they are HUGE and filled with all sorts of ingredients- meats, sauces, cheeses all fire baked in a wood burning oven.  All of this for about 7 bucks.  The kids love getting these pizza clouds and so do we.  Pick up the phone, call one in and go get it (takes about 15 min to make).

45.description: Like, the pizza is pretty good but not GREAT. However, customer service sucks. Sergio is a liar he should be fired. Asked to speak to manager and spoke to someone posing as the manager. Delivery guy tells me manager isn't in till Monday. 3 HOURS for a pizza! ARE YOU KIDDING ME! And no discount for their tardiness. Never ordering, eating, or calling this place again. I guess this is what I get for trying something different, huh? If I  could rate this as no star I would. FALCOS PIZZA 4 LIFE!

33.description: This banquet hall is just hands down amazing!! I just attended a wedding there this past Saturday. Although I never even knew this place existed because it is well hidden between other buildings, the inside is just gorgeous! It brings a chicago urban vibe along with gorgeous architecture plus intimacy. The bar was big, although they probably should have had two bartenders. The fettuccine alfredo and chicken parm were soooo good too. Loved the layout and brick walls. Friendly staff, great for a wedding or party, awesome mezzanine level for a dj so they aren't in the way.

43.description: Not only are the jumbo slices enough to feed a family, but they are goooood.  Quick dinner Friday night with the family.  This is one of my hubby's fave local spots...he used to stop in regularly after work during the week.  Great neighborhood pizzeria, friendly staff and tons of space in the dining room (complete with televisions and nice granite topped tables).Cheese and pepperoni are our faves, along with the fries, which seem to be double-fried or something...they're that perfect medium of soft-to-crispy consistency and they're delicious!  2 jumbo slices, a side of fries, 2 bottled waters all under $12. Go Damenzo's.

2.description: I went there with a friend yesterday after he had a proceedure at the hospital around the corner. Neither oif us had eaten all day and we were starving. He got a slice and a pop and I had the mostacholi and meatballs. We both got the minestroni soup. Wer had the unfortunate luck to get Minia to take our order. Not only did she NOT get the order correct, we asked for the reciept three times, were never given one, and she told us she only charged us for one of the drinkls. Well, without a reciept we had no way of knowing. She even came so far as to come to the table and begin to argue with us when we voiced our displeasure- all while I was on the phone with a client. Then came the horrible food... My pasta was swimming in water before they put the sauce on it (despite being asked to make sure it was drained)- so I had soup instead of pasta and sauce. Our soup, which Minia forgot to give us after charging us for it, was brought to the table cold. Further, while my friend ate his, it was soo watered down I found it to be inedible. When Minia AGAIN came to the table looking for an altercation, this time she got one as we both started screaming! I have never had such a horrible expierience ANYWHERE! The pizza, however, was off the hook and looked amazing!They really should focus on keeping people with poor customer service skills away from the customers. Minia should not be allowed to deal with the cistomers AT ALL! If you see her, RUN! She is rude, surley, and does not seem to care about anything- and it shows!

18.description: Damenzo's Pizza has a soft place in my heart.  They delivered pizza for my nursing group for over 15 years.  Always wonderful pizzas and deliveries.  Nowadays, I purchase their pizza's for my birthday parties. Just absolutely delicious pizza.  I highly recommend this business!

41.description: Love this place! Everything is delicious including the Mexican food and the portions are huge!

52.description: The pizza is great! It is spiced differently than most.  Every time I have friends try Damenzo;s pizza, they often say without me mentioning anything, "This pizza is delicious!"I would not come here to eat nor bring anyone out to eat, but if you are looking for good carry-out pizza..go here!  The customer service is not great as the guys are not friendly.  But, I will continue to come here for the great pizza!

50.description: I can only review the steak torta. I actually went in today because I had an obscene craving for churros (which they don't carry) and so instead ordered a steak torta. It was seasoned well, the bread was toasted and yum and the filling was perfect. But the stars of the show were the salsas- the red (orange?) and green that came in teeny tiny little cups in the bottom of the bag-- I could drink those things! I can't believe I've lived here for 5 months and not had it before. Will def be back.

4.description: NEVER AGAIN!!!!! This place is a terrible place to order pizza especially if you're getting it delivered. I order a pizza I waited one hour when the delivery guy finally arrived he brought the wrong order it took me ten minutes to get intouch with someone from the restaurant, Finally when they finally answered they were very rude I waited an additional 30 minutes for a new pizza the pizza arrive the pizza was cold the fries were cold and they brought the wrong drink. Third time ordering here and last time every time I order I had a bad experience the workers are rude and unprofessional.

6.description: Bad service , called 50mins before they closed to pick up a small pizza and was told it was too late!!!! WTF it takes 15mins to make.... Will never call them again

22.description: Pizza puff game is crazy. It's HUGE. I like the steak nachos, mozzarella sticks, and Italian beef mmmmmmm

15.description: I just ordered a cheesy beef and 2 steak tacos...tacos were horrible..dry and burnt..paid $20..I am so pissed..these can't be the same owners..their food and service was never this bad...Management sucks..no customer service at all..They just lost a longtime customer!!! UGH... I am so pissed!

57.description: This is a place that I eat at frequently because of the proximity to my work vendors pick this up and bring it for me & my staff like they are doing me a favor, they think they are getting some secret pizza place only "insiders" in Chicago know about. Not even close G fresh honey suckle. Not at all my favorite pie, they are very nice customer service wise and also the inside of the restaurant is OK. Their gigantic badonkadonk pizza puff makes me full for 3 weeks when I eat it. I like their cheese, but the crust? Damn yo, work on that crust holmes, the shit is like a cracker, and not the racial epitaph. Talkin straight up saltine style crust on the west side AKA the best side AKA the honey BBQ chicken breast side. Love this hood, but man, Damenzo's step that game up.Straight cornered the market on hard tack pizza.

20.description: This is a disgrace to the tradition of Chicago Pizza.  I was up late at my hotel while in town and opted to try Damenzo's since it was open late and delivered.  As a former Chicagoan, I love and miss genuine Chicago pizza.  I ordered a deep dish pepperoni.  Such a disappointment: flavorless crust with no body or depth, mediocre sauce and cheese.  It was more like a NY-Style pizza jammed into a pan and then baked. Not worth the $20 I paid for it.  Do yourself a favor and choose another pizza place in town: almost any option would be better.

36.description: Ordered a.veggie pizza yesterday after Taylor st failed...it was super cheesy and sooo delicious. I also added garlic salt  at home and it was even better.

14.description: I put four stars because of the behemoth of a sandwich I got from here! I ended up with the Damenzo Sandwich (#1), which had mortadella, salami, and something else that I can't remember right now... I watched the entire time they made the sandwich, and the veggies were so fresh and so clean clean! And oh my god are they GENEROUS! I ate a quarter of the sandwich and was stuffed. I did not eat anything else for the remainder of my six hour drive home. What a pleasant surprise!I guess the only negative thing I can say is about myself, which is that I did not try any pizza :)

0.description: Good food and great prices... Location is ok and dine-in area is small...

12.description: This place has great food but the service is terrible. Girl at the register did not even say hello and was extremely rude, I will make the trip to another Harold's due to the customer service. The owners really need to reconsider hiring someone who is friendly and has at least the common sense of not being so rude!

3.description: I'm SOOOOO GLAD this location is open.. it's close to our apt.. the food has ALWAYS been great... NEVER a disappointment...

1.description: When I found out about this location being opened 5 minutes away from my job, I was happy but at the same time skeptical because all Harold's Chicken are not the same. The Harold's on 87th & Dan Ryan is the best. I asked my co-workers about this location. They said it was just "OK". One day I decided to give them a try. Anybody that knows me personally...I am a VERY PICKY eater! If I have 1 horrible experience, I won't go to that restaurant ever again in life! Anyways, I ordered the 4 wing meal with the fries and drink. I placed the order over the phone because I didn't want to wait. When I got there, it was a line. I had to wait a little while for my order. WHY call ahead if I STILL have to wait once I get there?! Maybe I didn't have to wait if the cashier wasn't talking on her phone while she was working! She was talking on her phone while she was packing the orders and on the register too! Who does that?! Cell phones carry germs! I want my food clean! Talking on the phone when you're on the clock and supposed to be helping customers! I can't even touch my phone when I'm on the clock at my job! Ok...about the food. It's pretty good. I would say second place. Hot, fresh, and delicious, but like I said, all Harold's  are not the same. I would definitely go back, but if I see that girl in her phone while she's on the clock one more time, I'm going to say something!

2.description: Take out only, looks like they just opened but I guess it's been a while. Your choices are chicken wings, chicken livers, chicken gizzards, fried chicken...get it? But, for any place that has the audacity to offer one type of menu item, it better be good, and Harold's Chicken held its own. The skin was crunchy and flavorful, and the chicken hot and tender. Takes a bit to be fresh-fried to order, but a good lunch stop if  you're in the area.

9.description: Worst Harold's location I've been to. I've been to three or four locations, and this is just the worst in terms of service and quality of food. If you want tiny pieces of chicken, which is over fried and stale, and you want to wait about 20 mins for your order to be ready, even though there was nobody ahead of you, then go here. If you want good fried chicken, then go somewhere else. All they basically do is fry the chicken a bit, and put it in the refrigerator, and then when you order it, they take it out the freezer or whatever, fry it some more, and give it to you. WTF is that?

10.description: This place is so pathetic. I called today to order a 2 piece wing dinner and the girl says I cant place a 2 piece order over the phone (Although I do it every tuesday, but ok) When I get there, she asks what my order was, and I told her directly that I tried to place my order but u said I couldnt place a 2 piece over the phone. And she said, "well you cant"  Thankfully, the manager/owner (someone of high authority) was there and he corrected her and also included, "that if someone wanted to place an order for a small fry, you place the order"Both of the girls there are ridiculously rude. I was actually paranoid to even eat my food because they are both caniving, ghetto, hood ratted little girls. Its so ridiculous that people dont understand that your customers pay YOUR wages. Without them, you have no business. I will NEVER BE BACK TO THIS PLACE.

13.description: I have been waiting for this location to open for nearly 10 months. I eagerly awaited its arrival and was let down... slightly. My love for fried chicken may be too great to give this a less than "A-OK" rating. The meals are cheap and affordable for the amount of food you receive. However....The chicken wings were small. I got a bucket of 24 and I am hoping this was a one time instance. I came around lunch time, so that may have already been a factor playing against me. The chicken wings came with a spicy sauce that had a good amount of heat and taste. In fact, I still have some sitting in my fridge. I also ordered the chicken gizzards. They were well made, and had a good consistency in them. I got them the only way they should come, with fries and hot sauce and ketchup drizzled over everything. I will return with a new review after I get a 1/4 chicken dinner to see what that will be like. I will also give them another shot at the chicken wings to make things right.

16.description: As a Southsider Harold's is always a good quick meal. I was excited to see a new location near my house and that's where the excitement ends. I go in 10 mins before close and turned away because I guess the crew wanted to enjoy their weekend early. How can you support a black business if the customer service is never  any good? Harold's is only about 3 months old and you are turning away customer's already?  I hope the owner reads this and realize his staff have lost a potential customer and any recommendations.

6.description: This is by far the WORST HAROLDS EVER!!!!!!  I don't know about everybody else but fried chicken is meant to be crunchy . When I get my order my food is soggy as if it's been sitting for a long time. But that's the least of my problems,  the customer service here Sucks! They always on the phone , snickering , and when they see you come in they never speak the wait for a while before they come up to u. Also they don't wear hair nets can you say NASTY!!!!!!!!! IT'S BEYOND GHETTO . The problem is to many young females who are very immature this resturant will never get my service again. For great chicken go to J&J fish & chicken located on kedzie n chicago ave. Great fish n chicken n so fresh and the service great u get more for ur money unlike harolds.

15.description: Everyone is always saying how lucky we are to have a Harold's come into our neighborhood, so I had to check it out.  Yup- pretty awesome fried chicken. My mom likes gizzards, so we also got those too.  Thumbs up for sure!

0.description: This location is for carry out only, not that you would want to sit and eat in here. It looks like a whole in the wall but the food is great if you're looking for some fried catfish, chicken, gizzards, or liver. Basically if you're looking for something fried! I had the catfish meal for lunch. It was warm and flaky but not too salty. Call to order ahead of time if you're on a time crunch. The young cashier was talking on her phone while taking my order then started a FaceTime conversation when she she was handing over my order. The cook was also on his phone while making my food which seems kind of gross. The staff and aesthetics of this location are extremely ghetto BUT they must be doing something right because I'd go back for the catfish!

5.description: I have tried several times to get food from this location to be rudely told they were completely out of all chicken...and then "everything". Harold's chicken is good but not worth the rude treatment.  I highly doubt they were completely out of everything. However if they do run out of food they should probably post a sign saying what they are out of.  Staff during the night are rude and simply stated: jerks.

11.description: 2 stars only because the food was decent. I called in at 8:13, told my order would be ready in 15 minutes. I arrived at 8:23, paid for my order. Only to watch people order and get then get their food before me. My order was ready at 8:44. What's the point of calling in at all? It wasn't even crowded. Probably not crowded because of the customer service issues. The staff was polite enough, but evidently not organized. I was given a phone number for the manager Theresa. Asked for her business hours, none known, but they gave me her number. I will be calling Monday morning.

8.description: I work in the area near this Harolds and it is terrible. The customer service is the worst I've come across. The young lady working the cash register and answering the phone needs to be fired immediately. Her attitude is terrible. It is almost impossible to get someone on the phone to place a call in order. I only have 30 minutes for lunch and do not have time to walk, wait, and walk back to my job, so being able to phone in an order is very important. The one time I visited this location, I tried to place a phone order, however, no one answered the phone. I decided to go ahead and walk over and there were several people comng in picking up phone orders. When the lady at the front was asked why the phone wasn't being answered she became irritated and did not answer the question. So I had to wait the 10-15 for my food that I was trying to avoid.The food is just OK. It's Harold's - nothing spectacular. It certainly is not worth over looking the piss poor customer service. I have no idea how this place stays in business with that miserable lady working the register.

4.description: Still love any Harolds. Although this one is new and I had put it up when it first started to show signs of opening, it finally did. I think that the taste of Harold's at this location will eventually catch up to the rest, but regardless, its awesome. There is no sitting area or in dining, just pick up and go. Which is good, considering there are less then 8 parking spaces in the parking area. Snuggled between Subway Sandwiches and Jason's Chinese Wok, gotta love it that some variety has finally made its way to Western and Taylor, I've waited long enough. Now the taste of the gizzards and chicken. Not bad, not bad at all. I like my meal drenched with hot sauce not on the side, and I enjoy the fries they provide, but the bread I am really not into. At least it absorbs any oil that's for sure, don't get me wrong, I use to love carbs of bread, but enough with the chicken and gizzards in their drenched filled glory is enough to give you a heart attack, not literally but you get the point. Seriously, not a bad place, I just hope I don't get hooked enough to come by everyday. I JUST MAY!

14.description: Its open as of today and its delicious.  More to come!

7.description: I loved their cat fish fillet dinner combo... I usually take out when I'm too tired on weekdays. Their hot sauces are good and they're open late nights. I found the kitchen very clean compared to a few others I've visited.

3.description: Hands down, Gustavo is the best massage therapist I have ever experienced! I have had many massages throughout my life....some good, some not so good. Nobody compares to Gustavo's massages! He has a deep love and true gift for massage. If you want the best massage ever, go to Gustavo! If you want your body to feel the best its ever felt, go to Gustavo!

1.description: This was my second time receiving a massage from Gustavo. I did a hour and a half massage this time. I felt so relaxed and alive after his massage.His massage room is beautiful and super clean. Gustavo communicates with me spectacularly allowing me to get completely comfortable and address all of the issues I want worked on. Gustavo creates such a comfortable and peaceful space that he's become my main massage therapist.I was in a work related accident a few years ago which causes chronic lower back pain. Gustavo stretches me and manipulates my muscles in such a way I'm actually healing. He knows all the trigger and pressure points.  I'm actually getting my best friend a gift certificate for a massage from Gustavo for her birthday.

2.description: A massage with Gustavo is SO much more than just a massage! Gustavo is well versed in many modalities of healing both physical and energetic. You can go to him to just relax and get your body worked on or you can set an intention to heal your WHOLE self and he will work wonders with you. This man is much more than a massage therapist I would like to call him an Urban Shaman. I always feel like a new person after a session.

5.description: Creeper. Took me for a bunch of money after making me feel awkward & causing weird, painful neurological issues during what he called a "Goddess Massage."

0.description: I've been to 50 different Masseuses and Gustavo is hands down the best!  He knows how to body work and gives an amazing massage. I highly recommend him!Try his in-house service, it is awesome.  I invited a few of my girlfriends over for wine and massages.  Gustavo brought over his table, set up some candles and aromatherapy and transformed my second bedroom into a spa.  So fun! He is super knowledgeable about overall healing and wellness and one of the sweetest people I know.  Do not go anywhere else.

4.description: After my massage with Gustavo I was entirely rejuvenated.  He targeted parts of my body that I didn't even know were holding stress.  For instance, I thought it was just my lower back that was hurting, but Gustavo worked on my legs and my pressure points in a way that restored my entire body.  I recommend getting a massage with Gustavo wholeheartedly.

29.description: Finally some real quality food in this neighborhood! All of us working in the med district thank you, Jarabe. One visit and you'll see that this place is head and shoulders above anyplace else around. Very creative gourmet menu options with high quality ingredients, at a good price. The mojo mushroom burrito is killer! Deliciously marinated shrooms packed with flavor. I love that they have an option to do slaw instead of lettuce - so good. The salsas are spicy and unique, not the standard. The smokey meat cooking on the grill smells amazing too. Can't wait to go back and try more!

42.description: I live down the street & was curious about the new restaurant that opened on Taylor. We ordered carne asada burritos, and they were great. Although they were not big, they were full of nice chunks of quality meat with red cabbage, avocado, cilantro, sour cream, and beans. The horchata drink had texture and good consistency of not too sweet, or watered down. I'd like to say that the owner was extremely friendly. We will definitely recommend this place to our friends, and you should definitely give it a try.

23.description: Let me start off by saying that the folks who run this place are friendly as hell and seem to really care about putting out a quality product. I had been excited to try this place since I moved to the Tri-Taylor area and when my boyfriend visited, we decided to give it a shot. We ordered tacos al pastor as well as adobo chicken. The chips we received were fresh out of the fryer and pleasantly salty. And here's where the problem comes in. Although nicely seasoned otherwise, the meat is lacking in salt, which caused me to subtract one star. I'll be back to try other menu options, because I like the flavor overall, but I would like a slight increase in the salt level.

47.description: I'm picky when it comes to Mexican food, but Jarabe far exceeded my standards, along with my friend Johnny's (he's vegan and gluten free).I do eat meat though, and lemme tell you -- the adobo chicken burrito is SO good. If you're a burrito fan you have got to come check out Jarabe. Easy on the wallet too, with vintage records playing in the background. Great experience.Teddy, the owner, is a super friendly dude too. 5 stars easily.

8.description: Jarabe wish you were closer to downtown and not so far south!  I order lunch for my staff once a month and they have been begging for me to order them anything related to mexican food.  I have to say I definitely surprised them when I ordered Jarabe, they were ecstatic.  Trust me this is big shoes to fill since my staff all come from hispanic background and enjoy their culture, food.I ordered the carne asada and the chicken adobo tacos, poblano rice guac and chips.Huge hit!  My team kept raving about the carne asada, chicken taste, quality etc.  I will definitely order again and highly recommend to anyone looking for amazing tacos.As for the service, placing the order and delivery arriving on time...flawless.Can't say enough, great job!

31.description: I know these guys from a few years ago when they had the food truck (still have).  I FINALLY got in the store this Saturday and had the carne burrito.  EXCELLENT!  Perfect combo of ingredients and the steak was well seasoned and really tender.  Not chewy like some burritos I have had.  Now the only problem I have is getting in there more often to sample all of their food.  Believe me, I will......  BTW - the green hot sauce rocks....hot and flavorful.

34.description: This place is newly opened and is like 20 steps away from my home. It has a nice vibe and the people are very welcoming, I had the Carne asada burrito and it was delicious, I really liked the burnt smokey flavor of the steak in it. My friend got the pulled chicken burrito which was also pretty good.According to me the homemade chips were a bit oily but the sauces were really good, although they weren't very hot.I am definitely going back again and this time for the tacos.

16.description: Decent tacos and clean establishment.  The meat did not have that marinated steak taste.  The tacos al pastor were similar which seamed to lack flavor.  The size of their items are perfect and the variety is enough to satisfy since they offer tacos, tortas, and burritos.  A breakfast menu is available as well.

13.description: Grubhubbing on a lazy saturday afternoon, my beau and I accidentally stumbled upon a new kid on the block named Jarabe. We took a shot and decided to give it a try. Boy were we pleasantly surprised! Fast, delicious, authentic, and inexpensive Mexican street food....delivered right to our door. This food truck turned store front is the real deal for authentic Mexican fare. We ordered a variety of items to give Jarabe a fair shake and we ended up loving just about everything. We ordered chips and guac for an app, a side of green rice, al pastor burrito, and three types of tacos: chicken tinga, al pastor, and the carne asada. Where do I begin? The food was all so delicious. Guac so fresh. Green rice was very moist and flavorful. The tacos were AMAZEBALLS...each one better than the next. And the best of all: al pastor burrito. This my friends, is money! Pure heaven and a MUST try. Also to note: about 90% of their menu items are gluten free...a major plus if that's your thang. This was out first time ordering from here but most definitely won't be the last. Kudos to you Jarabe, for a job authentically done:)

11.description: I recently started working in the area and stumbled across this place one day at lunch.  I had an excellent burrito and now several days later I just enjoyed chilaquiles rojos.  I had a choice of four meats and went with the chorizo.  This place serves really wonderful authentic Mexican food, beautifully prepared with noticably fresh ingredients.  It doesn't hurt that everyone working there is very friendly and accomodating.  It is definitely worth a visit if you're in the area or even if you're willing to travel for good Mexican fare.

39.description: I never cared for Birria (goat) before unti Jarabe appeared.  The person behind the counter told me they have the best goat.  So I gave it a try - WHOA.  Fantastic in a taco.  Came back and had it in a burrito.  Still excellent.  The Tinga chicken (shredded, chipotle seasoned) is my second favorite there, the chips are amazing, the salsas are different than your normal taquerias.  Gourmet Mexican street food.Oh, and there's Dark Matter coffee on tap....!

37.description: I found this place through grubhub and now I'm hooked. Try the green poblano rice and the steak and eggs tacos. The owners are awesome . I'm horrible with names but tha is for the chips...I will keep sending people your way...

0.description: Have been back 3 times now and still loving it!  Space is pretty small so not good for groups larger than 4.  Even then there are only 2 tables for groups of 2+.My new fave is the chilaquiles (salsa verdes).  Make sure you add the steak.  It's an extra $2, but totally worth it.

38.description: Great new food option in the area! Gotta give it a try!- Carne Asasa tacos are delicious! You'll want seconds- Tortilla chips and guacamole are worth coming for alone!- Birria (goat)! I've never had goat before trying it here and I have really been missing out- Excellent spicy (or mild) salsa to accompany any meal!- Affordable and well worth your money I'll soon be a regular!

51.description: Had a fantastic experience at 'Jarabe' the new kid on the block offering a twist on traditional Mexican cuisine. I had the chilaquiles verdes and sampled three different types of tacos that sounded mouth watering.Results were as great as expected! The chicken was juicy and full of flavor and he chips had a great crunchy but not too hard texture. Chips come with three different types of dipping sauce which offer the pallet three variations of spicy flavoring. The tacos came with a healthy portion of meat the main ingredient complimented by onions and cilantro. I really enjoyed the tinga taco and the birria taco which is goat meat slow cooked and super tender! Overall I had a great experience, the staff is super relatable and the restaurant itself is cozy.
