27.description: First time here since I work down the street and all I got to say is meh.  Had the tacos al pastor and did not satisfy.  Maybe I had the wrong meat.  Al pastor is a very spiced pork (achiote is used) usually spit grilled.  What I had was basically grilled pork meat that tasted like a pork chop I cut into little pieces, which is fine but just don't call it al pastor because it is not.  If you over cook pork, especially it gets dry.  I basically had charred dry pork tacos.  The only flavor was the pineapple and salsa.  Also, onion cilantro and pineapple should be diced into very small pieces not big ol' chunks.  These are not traditional style tacos, they are an interpretation which I'm all for, but only when it works and btw burritos aren't Mexican street food; they aren't even Mexican.  Give me a pambazo or flauta any day!

32.description: So juicy tender so yummy burrito! Just what i was craving for.. Glad i found this place through EAT24. I was about an hour late for my pick-up order but my food was not cold and soggy. Super friendly staff too! Def stop by again. There is no big sign outside of this place but it's right next to a grocery called... forgot! But yeah highly recommend!

48.description: The Carne Asada torta is amazing!  The steak was delicious and tender. The poblano rice was also very flavorful.  The chips and variety of salsa/spicy dipping sauces were a bonus!!I will be back soon to try something new off the menu!!

44.description: We tried all the tacos on the menu for lunch.  Our favorites are carne asada and tinga! We definitely will come back!

24.description: The Carne Asada burritos here are amazing! Never disappointed. Great spot on Taylor Street for authentic Mexican food!

7.description: This place is pretty dope. The service was excellent.I yolo'd and tried 4 different types of tacos and sadly I like all four. Lol. They have regulars and a lot of traffic which says a lot about an establishment. I overheard of a burrito bowl.It isn't on the menu but the fact they have it and all else above will definitely bring me back.Also they give complementary chips & salsa.Just saying.I'm sold and will be back.

49.description: Grubhubbing on a lazy saturday afternoon, my beau and I accidentally stumbled upon a new kid on the block named Jarabe. We took a shot and decided to give it a try. Boy were we pleasantly surprised! Fast, delicious, authentic, and inexpensive Mexican street food....delivered right to our door. This food truck turned store front is the real deal for authentic Mexican fare. We ordered a variety of items to give Jarabe a fair shake and we ended up loving just about everything. We ordered chips and guac for an app, a side of green rice, al pastor burrito, and three types of tacos: chicken tinga, al pastor, and the carne asada. Where do I begin? The food was all so delicious. Guac so fresh. Green rice was very moist and flavorful. The tacos were AMAZEBALLS...each one better than the next. And the best of all: al pastor burrito. This my friends, is money! Pure heaven and a MUST try. Also to note: about 90% of their menu items are gluten free...a major plus if that's your thang. This was out first time ordering from here but most definitely won't be the last. Kudos to you Jarabe, for a job authentically done:)

40.description: This place is delicious! They need to be on this list: timeout.com/chicago/rest…

53.description: Glad to have another Mexican restaurant in the area.  Have been to Jarabe a couple of times and so far I really like what I've tried.  I had a Chicken Tinga torta and some vegetarian tacos.  Everything tasted really fresh and flavorful.  They offer several aguas frescas, as well as fresh tortilla chips with some killer good salsas.Looking forward to stopping in for breakfast one day soon to try some items off of their breakfast menu.  I have a feeling I'll be returning often ...  and will need to add a lot of extra time at the gym!Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE who works there is super friendly. Welcome to the neighborhood!

30.description: Yummy tacos from this little hole-in-the-wall on Taylor street. I had been looking for it for about 2 weeks and I only found it because I was walking home from the hospital when I passed by a very small shop it and went in. No sign or anything on the outside. I had the carne asada and chicken tinga tacos. The carne asada were solid but we a little more overcooked than I'd like (the owner says they are better the earlier you come in and asked me to come back again) but the flavor was good. The chicken tinga were my favorite of the two since the flavor was so different than what I've had before! I wanted to try the birria since everyone was raving about it but they ran out long before I got there. I definitely recommend this place! Just make sure you get there early ;)

46.description: Incredible tacos, variety of amazing sauces & salsas. Super friendly service & convos w/ the brothers. We are so full! We are so coming back for the Birria.

1.description: Not many people get to make it over to this area, being closer to the VA and farther from university village but this little restaurant is the bomb! My gf lives close by and we heard they served breakfast tacos here at jarabe. It's definitely a little nook with odd hours, but the food is fantastic and the complimentary chips they serve you look deep fried, are extra flaky and wonderful with accompanying salsas.All the tacos here are under $3 and they are some of the meatiest and most packed I've ever had. The al pastor here was tasty and was prepared with small pineapple chunks for sweetness. The tender carne asada came in large chunks but was a little lacking in the salt. I found that weird because the carne asada breakfast taco, which looked the exact same as the regular carne asada taco, but with egg and cheese was so much better. It was so flavorful that I wolfed it down in a few bites and wondered why my regular taco wasn't nearly as good. Weird.Anyway, Jarabe is awesome if you're around during the lunch hour. And get the breakfast tacos!!!!!

9.description: I ordered a Jarabe taco bar to cater a small mid-week wedding.  They were great in every way.  When I called the location they were helpful and answered all of my questions and also via email.  When the day arrived they were right on time, set everything up and even made a special trip across the city to get something I neglected from my order. The food was AMAZING, guests cousins stop raving about it.  The price was very fair and the taco bar corns with everything you need for the tacos.  Highly recommend for any party!

26.description: The birria tacos are really good, though they were really juicy one day and then kind of dry the next. Staff is super sweet and accomodating.

25.description: Came here before a sox game and it was incredible! Got three tacos, (carne asada, tinga, and al pastor) their chips are addicting and have an array of salsa (including avocado salsa). The owners are so welcoming and great people. Had great conversations with them. Super affordable.

12.description: I love this place and am so grateful to have yummy Mexican in the neighborhood!! The food is so fresh and tasty. My husband and I love the carne asada and chicken Tinga burritos the most and the guacamole is delicious! Plus they serve Dark Matter coffee, which is local and delicious if you're a coffee nerd and need a boost. The guys are very friendly and welcoming. I hope you stick around!!'

21.description: Decent tacos and clean establishment.  The meat did not have that marinated steak taste.  The tacos al pastor were similar which seamed to lack flavor.  The size of their items are perfect and the variety is enough to satisfy since they offer tacos, tortas, and burritos.  A breakfast menu is available as well.

17.description: Holy moly.. the chilaquiles verdes is perfection! Huge portion for only $8. Spicier than expected, but balanced out well with the fried eggs and sauce. My boyfriend's carne asada burrito was also delicious. Seating is limited inside, staff is friendly, and there's a good amount of street parking in front on a weekday.

10.description: I LOVE this place. I wish more restaurants had such a succinct menu. Less options, but all are crazy delicious. Salsa is so good, they use red cabbage slaw instead of romaine. When I opened up my burrito there was one open end of the foil. Just so thoughtful. And the guys that work here are so sweet. Happy happy.

5.description: I love this place!!!!! I've tried all their chicken items.. Chicken burrito, adobo chicken and the shredded chicken. I LOOOOVEED ALL OF THEM! Their chips are also made fresh in house. They offer three different hot sauces and they're also all good. Everything is made in house, made to order. The staff is friendly, funny, and very accommodating! I will definitely going back! Oh yea get the horchata!! Yummmmm! My total bill was $11 for two tacos, and a Horchata. Since I ate there I also got a basket of chips. Totes full from the meal!!!

3.description: In the mood for some Mexican breakfast and saw reviews and excited for this. I had the steak and egg tacos and goat. I thought the steak was good but not as flavorful as I hoped it would be. The tortilla was soggy when I got it. The goat was on point good flavor and definitely can taste the tender meat. My wife's breakfast burrito was not good she said she wouldnt go back. We got carry out so could have affected the experience.

35.description: Best chips I've ever had. Seriously. Also, their Jamaica tea is a must-try! The guys working there are super friendly and create such a welcoming ambiance. The couple times I've gone they have thrown in free chips and salsas while I've waited which was a nice touch.

19.description: I know these guys from a few years ago when they had the food truck (still have).  I FINALLY got in the store this Saturday and had the carne burrito.  EXCELLENT!  Perfect combo of ingredients and the steak was well seasoned and really tender.  Not chewy like some burritos I have had.  Now the only problem I have is getting in there more often to sample all of their food.  Believe me, I will......  BTW - the green hot sauce rocks....hot and flavorful.

28.description: So good!We waited for this place to open with some excitement as we live right down the street. It's been a kind of sad location with lots of openings and closings of places we liked. Well, Jarabe was worth the wait! We've now been here a kind of embarrassing number of times for breakfast and lunch or dinner and it's all great food. I haven't had anything that wasn't delicious.

45.description: All the food is delicious and I'm excited to have a good place for breakfast in the tri-taylor area. There is dark matter coffee so stop there before you head off in the morning. The owners are nice dudes who care about the neighborhood and have great passion for their food. They have awesome plans to turn the place into somewhere to see local music, so support them.

33.description: I'm so excited about Jarabe in Tri-Taylor. We need more places like this in the neighborhood.Go if: - You're craving a traditional style taco, where the emphasis is on the preparation of the meat.  - You prefer simple fixin's on the taco.  - You want your food cooked to order (be prepared to wait about 10 minutes, 15 if there is an onslaught of deliveries)Word up to those traveling to this spot: there's no outdoor seating, and I would guess only 8-10 small tables in the restaurant.

43.description: Tri-Taylor is a bit of a restaurant desert other than pizza and hot dogs.  This is a welcome addition to the area.  For now they are only open for breakfast and lunch, but they deliver and truly care about giving everyone a great experience.I have eaten most of the menu and it is all great.  We definitely will come back!

2.description: Jarabe is such a gem, I almost don't want to write a review, just to keep them to myself! The brothers who run this adorable little restaurant take their food very seriously. I am yet to try a single thing on this menu that didn't completely hit the spot (even the vegetarian food is phenomenal)! My very favorites are the chorizo breakfast tacos, and ANYTHING with the chicken Tinga. All of the meats and vegetables are cooked perfectly, expertly seasoned, and served up in any vessel that wets for whistle (I'm taking to you, burrito bowl ladies). Whatever these guys are doing, every single person in the UIC area needs to try it. Friendly service, fresh ingredients, amazing salsas, Jarabe has got everything any Mexican food lover could want.

18.description: This little hole-in-the-wall is easy to miss because they're so new, they don't have a real sign outside yet.The guy at the register was nice, friendly, and able to explain the gluten-free options for me.  There was a crazy lunch rush that showed up there just after I ordered because a lot of people walk over from the Medical District around noon.  I got some tacos, although not the goat that everyone is raving about because they had run out of it.  And I got the jalapeno rice.The highlight for me were the sauces, which were really delicious.  I put it all over the rice because otherwise it would have been incredibly bland.  I was disappointed, having always found Mexican rice to be good enough to eat without any doctoring.  It may not be exciting by itself, but neither should it be bland.  And I may have fallen victim to raised expectations after reading all of these other 5 star reviews, but the tacos didn't knock my socks off either.  The ingredients were all very fresh and the descriptions sounded appealing, but I felt like the flavor just wasn't everything I'd hoped for and didn't live up to the build up from other reviewers.  The idea of these tacos was better than the actual tacos.  Maybe I need to go back and try the goat.It's close to work and I'll be giving it another shot.  Personally, I don't really care how "foodie" a place is, and I'll even settle for ingredients that aren't fresh from the farm or whatever, I just need my Mexican food to bring the flavor.

41.description: This is hands down one of the best places for Mexican food in Chicago. From one of the best  food trucks in the city  to an awesome place to sit down and eat. The owners really care and get to know the customers and the food they serve is outstanding. Honestly if you want to go somewhere and REALLY have a great meal. This is the place to go!!

52.description: For those of you who don't know, Jarabe is the storefront restaurant from the brothers who were responsible for the La Adelita food truck, which had my absolute favorite Mexican food of any truck or brick and mortar in Chicago. I didn't think it could get much better than that, but with the space and resources of the Jarabe kitchen at their disposal, they are churning out the most delicious and authentic Mexican food you will find in Chicago. While their dishes are unique, these guys simply make the classics BETTER than anyone else. Tacos, Burritos, Tortas, Chilaquiles (my personal favorite, on a bed of ridiculously tasty chips), etc. My girlfriend tried the breakfast burrito and gave me a bite so I could experience the crispiness of the potatoes, truly unique! As she pointed out, breakfast burritos are often drippy messes stuffed with too much eggs and cheese. This was a balanced, nuanced Burrito with a variety of flavors and textures. In fact, she just texted me a picture of it with the caption "Remember this???" I think we'll be back.Okay, I wanted to give the previously mentioned chips their own paragraph. If you stop in and don't get a full meal, you're missing out. But if you don't get at least some chips and salsa/sauce/guac, you're letting down the whole human race. These chips are what I call "two-ply" meaning it's almost like they're made of two thin chips joined together. They sort of bubble up as a result and are flaky, crispy, warm, and perfect. They are made fresh several times a day and heated in the oven for maximum warmth/crispiness. Just the right amount of coarse sea salt. If you love tortilla chips and salsa, you will not want to go back to the bagged, bland, or otherwise stale chips found at 90% of other Mexican joints.Seriously, SO satisfied with our meal. Best chips on earth. Hope this place gets the business it deserves, cause it's so damn tasty.

50.description: Jarabe!  You make my eyes water and my tummy full!I am obsessed with Mexican food so of course I had to check out this hot new spot from the taco geniuses behind La Adelita Food Truck, which was one of the first gourmet food trucks here in Chicago.Right of the bat we were served a piping hot bowl of freshly fried tortilla chips.  Many modern Mexican restaurants have done away with serving chips at the table (unless you order them) but what may be worse than not serving chips at all is when they serve you stale ones.  This was not the case here.  The chips were salty and delicious and came with four different and unique salsas - salsa verde, roasted tomato, chile de árbol, and avocado.  I would eat any of them again, but the avocado and arbol were my favorites.  The salsa was spicy, and made my eyes water, which made me very happy, because I eat a lot of spicy food and feel sad when chefs make their salsa bland to make up for all the wimpy palates out there!As far as the food, I had three tacos - the carne asada, the al pastor and the adobo chicken.  Everything was delicious and freshly prepared.  The chicken was very tender, the carne asada was smoky and flavorful, and the pastor was spicy and sweet with fresh pineapple chunks.There were a lot of other things on the menu that looked awesome - the breakfast menu in particular was intriguing.  My dining partners-in-crime both had tortas with tasty crunchy rolls.  Everyone was pleased with their meal, the pricing was affordable and the service was great; all in all, a perfect lunch from Jarabe!  Taco there or regret it forever!

4.description: I work nearby, and I live in Pilsen, so if there was a cuisine I was hoping would pop up on Taylor St, I have to say it wasn't Mexican. However, Jarabe has won my approval with their delicious breakfast tacos, perfect for Treat Yo'Self Day (which is Friday mornings, for me) with steak or chorizo and eggs, and breakfast potatoes. I also like the carne asada and al pastor tacos for lunch too. About $3-ish bucks per taco. There are only a handful of tables inside the small restaurant, but the staff are friendly and takeout is quick.

6.description: Glad to have another Mexican restaurant in the area.  Have been to Jarabe a couple of times and so far I really like what I've tried.  I had a Chicken Tinga torta and some vegetarian tacos.  Everything tasted really fresh and flavorful.  They offer several aguas frescas, as well as fresh tortilla chips with some killer good salsas.Looking forward to stopping in for breakfast one day soon to try some items off of their breakfast menu.  I have a feeling I'll be returning often ...  and will need to add a lot of extra time at the gym!Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE who works there is super friendly. Welcome to the neighborhood!

22.description: Jarabe catered our backyard wedding party, and it was utterly incredible. We reserved their taco cart, which was a perfect size for our group, and the guys did a fantastic job - super friendly with guests, great senses of humor, and of course made tasty, tasty tacos to order. Our friends and family are still raving about it weeks later. From reservation to setup to face-stuffing joy, everything was super easy and painless. Can't say enough good things!

15.description: Great new food option in the area! Gotta give it a try!- Carne Asasa tacos are delicious! You'll want seconds- Tortilla chips and guacamole are worth coming for alone!- Birria (goat)! I've never had goat before trying it here and I have really been missing out- Excellent spicy (or mild) salsa to accompany any meal!- Affordable and well worth your money I'll soon be a regular!

20.description: Such an awesome spot! Best barbacoa in the city, great prices, awesome staff. One of my favorite spots for chilequiles, you have to try them with barbacoa and rojo sauce... or with chicken and verde sauce! They also have a food truck, La Adelita. Great for breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner!!

36.description: This little hole-in-the-wall is easy to miss because they're so new, they don't have a real sign outside yet.The guy at the register was nice, friendly, and able to explain the gluten-free options for me.  There was a crazy lunch rush that showed up there just after I ordered because a lot of people walk over from the Medical District around noon.  I got some tacos, although not the goat that everyone is raving about because they had run out of it.  And I got the jalapeno rice.The highlight for me were the sauces, which were really delicious.  I put it all over the rice because otherwise it would have been incredibly bland.  I was disappointed, having always found Mexican rice to be good enough to eat without any doctoring.  It may not be exciting by itself, but neither should it be bland.  And I may have fallen victim to raised expectations after reading all of these other 5 star reviews, but the tacos didn't knock my socks off either.  The ingredients were all very fresh and the descriptions sounded appealing, but I felt like the flavor just wasn't everything I'd hoped for and didn't live up to the build up from other reviewers.  The idea of these tacos was better than the actual tacos.  Maybe I need to go back and try the goat.It's close to work and I'll be giving it another shot.  Personally, I don't really care how "foodie" a place is, and I'll even settle for ingredients that aren't fresh from the farm or whatever, I just need my Mexican food to bring the flavor.

14.description: I live down the street & was curious about the new restaurant that opened on Taylor. We ordered carne asada burritos, and they were great. Although they were not big, they were full of nice chunks of quality meat with red cabbage, avocado, cilantro, sour cream, and beans. The horchata drink had texture and good consistency of not too sweet, or watered down. I'd like to say that the owner was extremely friendly. We will definitely recommend this place to our friends, and you should definitely give it a try.

28.description: OK, if you guys havent tried the pad thai here, get yourself over here and try it out.  Tell them Andy "Extra Spicy" sent you.  Seriously.  They'll know.Pad thai at a chinese restaurant?  That's what I thought at first.  But I was like, yeah, let's try this out.  So I did.  And I like it.  It's not a traditional tasting pad thai, but they have their own sweet sauce.  I always get mine extra spicy, and it always comes packed with flavor and is very saucy.  They use some interesting vegetables like mushrooms, onions and green peas.  Very interesting.  Very good.  And they top it off with about a half cup of crushed peanuts.  It's just packed with flavor.  And if you can finish a whole serving of this in one sitting, you're a bigger man (with a bigger stomach) than me.  I get it with either chicken or beef, and both taste great.  It's top 3-4 pad thai places for me in the city right now...I've ordered this so much in the past year, they know me by my voice...Me: "Hello, can I order carryo..."Them: "Extra Spicy?"Me: "Ye..."Them: "10 minutes Andy" (click)

1.description: Just ordered take out from here.. Started off with the crab rangoons and egg rolls, both were below average but not bad. Next, I moved onto my wonton soup. I opened it and was immediately confused by the over abundance of lettuce and lack of broth. I hadn't even begun looking for the wontons, when my eyes settled on a very noticeable hair deeply intertwined within the lettuce... Obviously, lost my appetite a little after this, but powered on through to my meal. I ordered the orange chicken (I know... Very original), which was ok but still below average for most other fast food Chinese restaurants I've frequented. My boyfriend ordered the sweet and sour chicken, which he enjoyed but still thought the sweet and sour sauce was below average. Prices are really cheap for a lot of food, so that's a plus! Sorry, but I'm probably not going to give this place a second chance.

9.description: Since I was stuck at work for Easter I decided to treat myself to some Chinese food...I found Jason's Wok through YelpGreat and convenient way to order food online!I ordered shrimp lo mein, an egg roll and sticky buns!The lo mein and sticky buns were delicious!  (Sticky buns are similar to zeppoles except covered in regular sugar instead of powdered sugar)The eggrolls were just 'ok'The portion size of the lo mein was impressive and they sent 8 buns for ~3 beansTotal order (with delivery) was ~$14I will be ordering from there againBenefit greater than the cost   :)

29.description: I've been here a few times.  I've had a few dishes there.  I like this place, because it's close to me.  But the foods are starting to all taste the same in terms of ingredients and smell.  So I've been sticking to the basics such as egg rolls, which are good usually.  I'll try a smoothie next time.  They look very enticing!  The fried rice has been a bit dried out, particularly the meat.    And where are the cute Asian gals that this place needs!No connection to the neighborhood's culture of ethnicity and college students.   And please keep the cooks eating their lunch out of public view.

23.description: Portions are massive, and it's inexpensive. For cheap Chinese food, it was much better than I expected. I live down the street, and go here sometimes when I don't feel like cooking. A warning, their dinner combos cannot be finished by one person. They are just impossibly huge.

5.description: The food is OK, but I don't know what it is about Chinese food places where the people answering the phone's are just rude. It's a put off and they no nothing about customer service. I also expect my delivery to be delivered to my door. not for me to pay for delivery and have to come outside and get my food. But to offset that, I just don't tip. Find some customer service!

31.description: There are not very ,many chinese restaurants in the area, and it's kinda nice to see this one open finally....I'm very picky when it comes to Chinese, and usually stick to their Lo-Mein, and Shrimp Fried rice. So far, they make them well, and the shrimps  that comes with really are the large size ones, not the puny things you normally see at the other chinese restaurants.The one thing that has me going back to this place almost everyday is their mango smoothie. They really do give Joy-Yee a run for their money!!! They serve the real fruits(not the powder or liquid crap that others do) and there has not been a day when the mango smoothie has disappointed.

25.description: I always come back here for there bourbon chicken lunch/dinner special and their delicious selection of smoothies.  I highly recommend Mango+Strawberry Smoothie with Tapioca.

12.description: I think that for lunch this place is the bomb, And that is good! They're lunch specials are wonderful and very economical. You can get a good helping of lunch special and an eggroll with a pop? For less than $7? This is definitely the place to get that at. The service is not bad and the food is awesome, I mean not super duper awesome but still its not a bad place to eat.

21.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! So I'm a nutrition student so Chinese usually isn't on my takeout list much. However, Jason's wok has some delicious semi-healthy options for when I'm super hungry after the gym. My usual go-to is the green pepper chicken. It's simple, chicken, green peppers, and black bean sauce with rice and a side of crab Rangoon (which I substitute an egg roll for). It's tasty as heck and just what I need after a workout. Go protein! Every time I go there, anytime, the ladies working the front are so nice and just overall happy to serve me. I think they know my name. Oh, and my meal only runs $6.05 and even comes with a drink! And most the time it makes two meals! This place just rocks! If I ever move to a different neighborhood, I will definitely make the trip back over here once in a while for some awesome food! :)

16.description: LOVE THIS PLACE! So I'm a nutrition student so Chinese usually isn't on my takeout list much. However, Jason's wok has some delicious semi-healthy options for when I'm super hungry after the gym. My usual go-to is the green pepper chicken. It's simple, chicken, green peppers, and black bean sauce with rice and a side of crab Rangoon (which I substitute an egg roll for). It's tasty as heck and just what I need after a workout. Go protein! Every time I go there, anytime, the ladies working the front are so nice and just overall happy to serve me. I think they know my name. Oh, and my meal only runs $6.05 and even comes with a drink! And most the time it makes two meals! This place just rocks! If I ever move to a different neighborhood, I will definitely make the trip back over here once in a while for some awesome food! :)

17.description: First time i order from here food is good but delivery service really sucks maybe next time i will order take out instead.

10.description: Shrimp with lobster sauce and veggies fried rice, yum. I got the lunch special and had enough for dinner. The shrimp were fresh and the vegetables were crunchy and its conveniently located next to my nail shop.

11.description: I've been ordering from here for over a year now and I love this place. It's fast, reasonably priced, and the portions are generous. 5lbs of Lo Mein for $8? Sign me up! The online ordering makes it even better. Will definitely be having Jason's Wok leftovers in my fridge in the future!

26.description: Jason and his Wok dropped off a beautiful color menu with pictures of delicious entrees of appetizing food directly at my door step (go-figure) about 2 months ago, so I figured this place LOOKS good on paper, and Im certainly feeling like a lazy delivery day is in order, lets try some delivery. Perusing the color menu I select Triple Delight and she selects the Governors chix, which is her go to and for good reason as it is pretty standard and generally tasty, however the  fried battered chicken depends on a half way decent brown sauce. As far as that was concerned, epic fail, with a consistancy, aroma, and overal tomato appeal one generally associates with ketchup (gross, two bites: one to be disgusted, second to verify disgust before tossing). Fried rice, not good, bland, yet salty and seemingly decent after the ketchup "what have you"   It had pieces of chix but not much else other than soy in it.As for the triple delight, the meat was very greasy for some reason and the "delicate" sauce was also bland, yet very edible, so we finished that one off. The hot and sour soup was interesting, a deifferent version, and while it was not what I had been wanting originally when ordering, i enjoyed the original take and heaping hot bowl they delivered. The smoothie was pretty good, but nothing special, just a standard mango-strawberry. I had to pay a delivery charge (rightfully so) but that negates any possibility for a sympathy star for Jason's Wok as I didnt get a great deal that most of the in-house diners have yelped about. The portions are large, but that doesnt do much fro me when the food has no flavor. Probably more of your, "Oh its lunchtime, oh that place called Jason's wok is across the street and cheapo chinese is exactly whats on the budget and mind right now kinda place"

27.description: My palate is very picky and unadventurous so I always stick to the basics, the orange chicken lunch special. In a nutshell it was good. Was it fabulous? No. Was it everything I dreamed? Hardly. It was just alright. On the other hand, I love me some pad thai, and I think I am with Andy on this one that it is pretty darn good when you ask for it spicy. I like it better than Thai Bowl on Taylor, because it gives you way more bang for your buck, but be warned they go crazy with the peanuts, which I don't particularly hate. One order at Jasons Wok equals two orders at Thai Bowl for relatively the same price. My only gripe with the place is that once my boyfriend and I asked for chili paste as a condiment and they charged us $0.50 for a tiny container. Its not like we asked for our food spicy that time and wanted more, or like they had already given us some and we wanted extra, nope they just wanted to charge us $0.50 for the tiniest amount of chili. I am not sure if they got rid of this because last time they didn't charge so yay!

35.description: Update:  Had food there another time or two, and it was OK.  Not great.  Not something I'd crave.  Just..alright.  So Although I will leave my original comments below the dashes, I took away one star.  :C  They were nice, but I can't give it 4 stars right now until the food improves to something better than just ok.-------------------------I went to Jason's Wok on Sunday night to grab some food.  I live in the area and was pretty excited a Chinese place was opening up nearby and hopeful that it'd have some good food.I give it 4 stars because apparently the night I walked in, they weren't actually open yet, but they made me food anyway!  So nice!  I don't know why they left the door open, Chicago has alot of weirdos walking about, like me for instance.  The food wasn't bad either, maybe a 3 star though for now.  I had some pretty good Orange beef.  The crab rangoon, however, is not so great.  Huge baked shells, but not alot of filling in them at all.I'll update when I go back to try something else.  I really like the take out menu, since I usually do most of my reading in picture form.   ;)  Lotsa pictures, and alot of choices...I'll definitely go back.

0.description: Jason's Wok, a great place to check out if you are in the area or just so happen to live in the neighborhood like my boyfriend and I. We have ordered from here several times and each time seems to get better and better! The food is great and the staff is pretty nice too if you give them the time and patience they need to make your food to your order! I find it hard to believe the harsh reviews, really! Each one of our orders, past and present, has always been a deal that you couldn't beat! The staff really give you a bang for your buck, you get a ton of food - you get quantity and quality in every order. The staff truly make it a point to get you what you want without having to wait forever! I've ordered take out as well and that process was quick and easy also!I should mention that I have certain food restrictions, being a strict vegetarian, and have no problem ordering food with special instructions and ingredient adjustments. Have not had a problem and the special orders are always something to come back for!  Honestly, we are happy to have Jason's Wok next to us! Always there when we are in a pinch or when my boyfriend is craving Chinese food! Check it out!

20.description: So glad to have new restaurants in our neighborhood. I'm not a fan of any of their beef dishes (beef quality is so-so) or their tofu (kind of crumbly at times), but their orange chicken and orange beef are the bomb.  They run great specials and reward loyal customers with free egg rolls on occasion.  They also have some great specials if you are ordering for a large group. I forget the denomination, but they offer free sweet and sour chicken with a $XX purchase.  They deliver too!

19.description: I wanted to give 2 and 1/2 stars, but my tablet wouldn't let me.  My boyfriend and I found this place and yelp.  Very close to our place, read the delivery wasn't great so we decided to do carry out.  My boyfriend called and placed the order for two dinner specials--Kung po and orange chicken.  There menu says the dinner specials come with chicken fried rice and a soup or a soda.  It also said the Kung Po came with an egg roll and the orange chicken with a crab Rangoon.  We ordered soups and then I asked if they could replace the fried rice with chow mein noodles.  They said fine for a $1 charge.  That was all fine.  They were friendly on the phone and in person when we arrived to pick it up.  Great.Until we got home and opened the order.  There were sodas, which at first we thought was nice because it said soup OR soda.  But then we noticed there was no egg roll or crab Rangoon.  Big disappointment for me because I LOVE crab Rangoon.  Then I opened my dinner to find a good size portion of orange chicken, but instead of nice yummy pan fried chow mien, it was an overwhelming amount of the hard crunchy, salad topper style crunchy chow mein noodles like the blue canister of La Choy ones you can buy in the grocery store.  I mean, I get I requested a little change to my meal which always can open you up for mistakes, but who in their right mind would think that someone would want those in place of fried rice?I give the two and a half stars for friendly fast service and ok tasting food otherwise.  But overall I think we'll go back to our usual spot, a little further away but never skimping and always get what we ordered.

33.description: finally got to try this place last nightdelivery was actually on time, yay!  but the food was horrible.  my chicken and broccoli was covered in lumps on cornstarch, and the chicken was tough.  my wife got short ribs which were good, but covered in WAY too much sauce, fried was ok, and egg rolls were inedible.  plenty of other places to get better Chinese food...

2.description: This is a middle-of-the-road Chinese place that delivers exactly what you'd expect. When you're in the mood for inexpensive Chinese food that tastes pretty much like every Chinese place place, they're perfect. The atmosphere of the restaurant isn't terribly comfortable, so take-out or delivery is the way to go. The short, quick taking of orders over the phone could easily come off as unfriendly, but I mostly just find it fast and efficient.

34.description: Ok, heres the deal.  This is one of my new lunch spots.  Food is not too spicy, so if you into spice, ask for it very spicy.  If you are a spice wuss like me, anything marked on their menu as spicy is OK, its not spicy.  Egg rolls are average.  Food portions are excellent (large).  The lunch specials are large, and you probably will not finish.  I like the chicken wings, they are huge, and a large white rice is only a dollar.  The interior space is nice and large for a place like this, more of a fast food space than a restaurant type space, but most business here is to go.  They make fruit smoothies if you are into that.  A good value here.

32.description: Just another run of the mill, uninspired Chinese place.  I went because they have seating and I like to try to support local bussines.  I ordered at the counter, Egg Foo Young and a glass of water.  He charged me for bottled water which is a sneaky trick these crappy places pull if you're not paying attention.  I had him take it off.  When my order was ready he hadn't gotten the water.  This is a new place, they should go out of their way not to piss the customers off.  I went to try to eat the food but didn't stand a chance with the flimsy, cheap-ass fork that twisted out of shape once it touched the food. They could've purchased sturdy plastic utensils, but cheaped out!  I was pissed that I couldn't eat there and had to take it home.  The food was average.  China Town is 10-15 minutes further, I will never eat at this place again.

18.description: Only tried their orange chicken n it's so good prolly can wat off of it bout 3 times!

13.description: Ordered BBQ fried rice, chicken egg foo young and wings. Everything was just ok. Wings a little over seasoned, too salty. Better food, prices, and service at the Chinese food place on Madison (except this place has tables).

4.description: Food here Was ok. Nothing to special when it comes to Chinese food. Crab Rangoon was pretty bad. Mongolian beef was a bit spicy for me. I like it a bit sweeter. I'm not sure if I would order from them again. They are pricey but do give good portions. The taste and quality are lacking.

24.description: I would give it 3 and 1/2 stars, but I can't.  It's pretty good, the portions are huge.  My husband thought the orange beef was a little fatty last time, but I liked it.  I think I've ordered from here three times, and plan to again.  Their sides are average (egg rolls, pot stickers, etc), but I've had a few dishes I really like, such as the Mongolian Beef (very flavorful).  I love huge portions, so that's a plus.

6.description: The new women with orange hair is one of the rudest counter helper I have ever meet at a business.  Portions are getting smaller and less quality.  Never going back.

22.description: Jason's Wok is much better than your typical Chinese spot. The dinners can be split for two people. The orange chicken is the best I've ever had. I was never a fan of orange chicken and would only eat it if someone else had bought it, but I get there's consistently. I got a lunch order for a coworker and she has been telling everyone about the delicious food she had. Their rice is always fresh and fluffy. And there smoothies are taste like it is real fruit! Very quick service, even for delivery. Very clean establishment, but they have the heat on off, so don't try to dine-in,

15.description: Best value in the city!  Food is really good, and the portions are HUGE.  I usually get the Orange Chicken and fried rice dinner, egg rolls and crab rangoons.  So much food my family can never finish in one meal.  Staff is very friendly and fast.

7.description: The portions are pretty good but taste-wise (at least for me) was just mediocre. Their shrimp fried rice was yummy.The egg foo young and crab rangoon was a little disappointing.

8.description: Crazy cheap for how much food they give.  I've been here about half a dozen times now, and the food is consistent, very tasty, and the take-out boxes are always stuffed to the max.  The lunch and dinner specials are an especially good deal.  If coming with a group, consider the group meals, but keep in mind how HUGE they are.  I'd usually recommend ordering one size smaller than you'd expect when getting a group meal. Also, the "spicy" options tend to be on the milder side, so ask for "extra spicy" if you want some heat.Overall, my favorite local Chinese place.

30.description: I think that for lunch this place is the bomb, And that is good! They're lunch specials are wonderful and very economical. You can get a good helping of lunch special and an eggroll with a pop? For less than $7? This is definitely the place to get that at. The service is not bad and the food is awesome, I mean not super duper awesome but still its not a bad place to eat.

3.description: Next time I'll hit Harold's next door.  Nasty.   Mabel even a BK Halloween whopper.  And yes his a review but not long enough so Yelp added it as a tip.  All rice in lunch special.  Won ton suck wp

14.description: If I could give negative stars I would. TL:DR Did they end up charging my credit card? YES.  Did I ever get my food?? NO. I ordered once before when they first opened, because a menu was put into my mailbox.  Note, I live 3 blocks away from this restaurant. The driver called me 2 hours later because he was lost and needed help finding my house. I couldn't believe it. I could have walked and picked up my food faster than he attempted to deliver it.  He got my address wrong! Sigh. By the time I got my food it was an ice cold, congealed mess - barely edible. The restaurant had no apologies for me.  I wrote them off.Cut to tonight, I see all these rave reviews on yelp of how great the food is, I decide to give them a second chance. I made the mistake of telling the restaurant, "I live around the corner - last time your driver got lost." They argued with me! They told me their driver has 5 years experience, no way he could get lost, he knows the neighborhood - he doesn't even deliver to where you say he ended up, you must have ordered from a different restaurant - not us. You made a mistake, not our mistake. I pointed out that as a business, part of keeping customers is to not yell at them and tell them they are wrong. I wasn't asking for anything. I didn't ask for a discount, I didn't want anything free - all I wanted was to give them a second chance and get some hot food on this cold rainy night. I was so upset by the time I got off the phone with them I decided to call them back - when I was argued with AGAIN. It really takes a lot to get me upset - but I was, so much so, that I ended up cancelling the order. No business from me Jason's Wok - even if you are less than a mile away :(Edit: 55 minutes later, I get a phone call, "I ordered delivery?" (since I called an alternative place, I said, "ok, be right down!" without thinking)  I get outside, and there is no one there. I'm standing outside in the rain.  I try calling back the number 312-929-5679, and at the same time, he calls me again, asking if I'm going to come down. I say, "I'm standing outside!" He seems confused. I ask, "What restaurant are you delivering from?" He refuses to answer, and instead asks me to tell him my address again.  He again refuses to answer what restaurant he's delivering from when I repeated my query, so I verify my address - apparently Mr. 5 years delivery experience is LOST AGAIN - and this time after I cancelled my order! He says something, but it's so hard to hear out in the rain with the traffic, I have no idea what it was he said. I tried calling him back from inside my building - no answer. Never did find my place, and finally answers the phone when I tried calling him back over an hour later -  Did they end up charging my credit card? YES.  Did I ever get my food?? NO.  He confirmed he delivers for Jason's Wok, but when I asked him if he tried delivering to my house, but got lost, he said he'd need to call me back and hung up on me. I know this place has many positive reviews I won't sway anyone from staying away, but I wish I could.  This is absolutely no way to run a business.  I want my money back!!!!

3.description: Unassuming, no-frills, local neighborhood spot for really good food.  The shrimp is butterflied, battered, and fried to a good crispy crunch.  The scallops are equally good along with the clams.  We usually get a side of mac salad along with our shrimp/seafood.Good value on the amount of food you get, plenty of space in the dining area, and service is fast and pleasant.

1.description: NEVER AGAIN!  Seriously will never go here again.  How hard is it to make a grilled cheese????  I even decided to get chips instead of fries so it would be faster.  What did I get after waiting 30 minutes???  A sad looking sandwich - not even hot - and the cheese was not melted all the way through.  And I am afraid to eat the chips because the expiration date is missing - looks like it was wiped off.  NEVER AGAIN!!!!  If their staff can't handle the lunch rush, or can't handle making a basic grilled cheese, they need to consider hiring more people.

0.description: Had the shrimp and wing combo. Shrimp was good and the chicken wings were super crispy...delicious!! Nice little place. Seems like they have a Chicago theme going on. I actually build Chicago flags made out of wooden pallets. If the owner is interested I can gladly build one for your restaurant!

2.description: Although I PROBABLY didn't get food poisoning, but I'm really not sure that's much better. I went to Joes Shrimp House against my better judgment.  I decided to order the Jumbo Shrimp dinner and I also got some fried Clams on the side.  The dinner came with fries and coleslaw.  Everything was fried from frozen, nothing fresh (not surprised).  The fries were soggy, the clams were over breaded, and the shrimp was nothing special either.  There was nothing special about the breading or the flavor, other than that little bit of freezer burn taste that you get from food that's been frozen for a long time.  The coleslaw was a different story.  I took one bite and it was soggy, mushy, and tasted like it had gone bad.  I thought better about taking another bite because I was already taking a risk by eating here in the first place.  I thought it smelled a little 'off'.  Although I would give it one star because it didn't kill me and there weren't necessarily any obvious health violations, I wouldn't recommend it either.Even if this is your only choice for somewhere to eat, I would still recommend reconsidering.  I cannot recommend this place and I won't be going back.  I don't know who wrote the good reviews, but it must have been long ago, before they stopped caring.  Don't go here.  There are numerous places available just down the street, and even a pizza and taco place right across the street (that I haven't tried) to go to.

5.description: Really excellent food.  Various menu.  The hard shell tacos are awesome because they're fried.  Totally bad for you of course, but delish.Garden salad looked fresh (was for co-worker) and generous portion.Prices are excellent.  They really do need a website though, so you can find their menu easily.  I had to call and request they fax it (and they had to go next door to do it).

6.description: If you guys are not feeling this sea food restaurant I really recommend you trying goose island shrimp house , which is located on division across from jetro!

7.description: I love Joe's. I am so glad they re opened. This is the kind of place you may see a high ranking city official duck into to get a quick bite and not be bothered. A very rare gem in a neighborhood with a Burger King, KFC, White Castle & Church's Chicken. Fried taco's? Dude, OK, whatever. But I got em here, and I have not seen them anywhere else. They are awesome. And they don't come out and tell you, "HEY FATASS! WE HAVE FRIED TACOS!!" No. You have to order the taco dinner, and they ask you, hard or soft shell? You tell em hard. Like your arteries will be. But daaaaaaamn, they are tasty and filling. For like $8 you can get this awesome dish with rice and beans. And you know what else? They have my favorite lunch dish in this hood. For like $5.99 you get a plate of grilled chicken breast with a lovely tangy light flavoring on it, a big piece of french bread, salad, rice and beans. SO full after, but don't feel shitty. Love this place. But the name is Joes, as in "Eat at Joes" this is def a "Joes" diner. Don't come in expecting white pristine counters and stuff, this is a working man's place. Come here if you, like me, start your day before 6AM & don't stop churnin till the butter gets in your wallet, nahmsayin?

8.description: Love this place and so glad we live right around the corner. This is our go-to place for delicious fried seafood. You can't beat the portions and price. The guys are friendly and the service is fast.

9.description: After the passing of the original Joe, I'm happy to see Joe's has reopened.  Food is still excellent, they have their original cook, the mexican lunch specials are still where its at, Crispy Tacos, Tostada's, Pork Chops, Flautas, all excellent.  They do an mean Breakfast sandwich too.  How come my bacon never turns out this good?  Calling ahead for take out is still the best way to go at lunch though, unless you have the time to sit and eat.  Great food, great value, good people.

10.description: I ate here with a friend of mines and the food was horrendous.  The service was just as bad.  The ladies working there gave us the wrong order.  The food took forever.  This was also happening before they merge with the shrimp house.  I was actually a fan of the shrimp house when it was on western.  Now the quality of food and service has gone down along with price going up.  Will definitely never be going back.

4.description: Joe's is back. After an 8 month hiatus (due to the passing of Joe the owner), a new kid is in town named Kevin. He has taken over the business and has expanded the menu. This time around the breakfast is awesome and they have included the thick Texas Style French Toast. Oh wow, for $5.25 you get 4 slices of THICK toast battered just right. I know that for sure I will be coming back later for the lunch items. Many of us are just so happy that someone decided to reopen since its been a long 8 months, but that's not important anymore. The memory of Joe (who was a staple here in Little Italy for years), is now going to live on forever again, so lets congratulate the fact that they have reopened, reinvented and stood with some of the old staff. Although a different edge is here, the food is now upgraded to a more full menu.

3.description: Decent place to go for the money.  Stay away from the chiles rellenos.  Stick to the basics: burritos, tortas, tacos.  It's open late, which is good, but going after a certain time may be suspect.

1.description: Hmm.. how can I review this place? The foods were good, the French fries is delish, but this place seems very unorganized. The line of ordering and picking up were blend together and the cooks/cashiers seem to run around in the back, that I feel it made the order take too long. I never really dine it, so not sure how the dine in experience is. But for to go order, expect about 30 mins wait - I ordered tacos, french fries and baked manacotti. Will I come back? Yes, but I will call first to order, no more walk-in.

2.description: I love this place. I remember when it all began. I was super excited we were getting a taco joint on my block and it has certainly been a blessing! They stay open late and food is fast and inexpensive. They serve breakfast all day long which is really nice. I especially like the milanesa torta and the milanesa dinner. The horchata is excellent. And if you sit inside and eat you get free chips and salsa!

5.description: Oh Papi's. What happened? When Papi's first opened up on Western Avenue, I was excited about the prospect of having a Mexican fast food place around the corner. I was not expecting it to become one of my all time favorites that even offered breakfast and some legitimately higher end dinners. And then one day... it was gone. Papi's moved around the corner to Taylor Street to share a retail space and kitchen with Damenzo's (a pizza place). The resulting situation is one of chaotic disorder and god-awful service; no burrito should take 35 minutes. The quality of the food has also suffered, and while it's not as bad as the service, it is now only mediocre at best. I even went back a second time before writing a negative review to make sure the first time wasn't just an unfortunate fluke. What a disappointment. RIP Papi's.

0.description: Yay for Papi's!We've been to this taco joint about 10 times. I always have the chicken tacos and my husband has had the quesadillas, torta, tacos, scrambled eggs and mexican sausage (they serve breakfast all day).We never imagined that a small place in the middle of nowhere would end up becoming one of our favorites.The food is much more authentic than the Mexican food chains.You gotta try it!

4.description: I've only had a few items here.  Steak tacos and chorizo burrito come to mind.  i like the tacos because they serve it just like i want, with a corn tortilla/ onions/ cilantro and a lime wedge.  The chorizo burrito was huge and tasty.  the guac was disappointing.  only had delivery at work so can't speak for the actual joint itself.  will definitely be ordering from here again

3.description: I came here on a random Thursday for a manicure around noon. The staff was okay and  they got me in and out. The place is not the best on the inside, but the instruments they used came out of the sterilization machine, they did not cut my cuticles and make them bleed like other nail shops. I would come back, they are conveniently located to my job and they are fast and affordable, $13 manicure.

1.description: By far the worst place EVER!!  They do NOT listen to the customers wants or needs at all!!!

2.description: Disgusting. And not sanitary. I would not be surprised if you got a flesh eating disease from getting your nails done here. The bowl they prepared for my hands had nail clippings in them. When I brought this up to the manicurist (Jason) said it was my own nails and not to worry. How it could have been mine I have no idea because he did not clip my nails at all. Also the cuticle clippers were not removed from a sanitary bag but rather a drawer that was covered in powder. I was horrified when he began on my nails knowing that the bacteria of another persons nails were covered in it. When I stopped half way to leave they charged me $12. I will never ever be going back. I've worked at a nail salon for 2 years as a receptionist and have never in my life been to such a disgusting salon. Beware!

9.description: Unfortunately it turns out that this place does not sanitize their pedicure bowls properly, nor their tools.  My good friend contracted a nail fungus  and will be loosing one of her toenails!!!  STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!

10.description: Technicians were not friendly and my wait was exceptionally long. I asked about my wait time and was told 10 mins, however I was left soaking in the pedicure bowl for over 30 mins. Additionally I found that they re-use nicer polish bottles and fill them with cheap polish. Very sketchy, unsanitary salon.

4.description: I went to this "nail salon and spa" yesterday because they were the only nail salon close to me open. I have been there maybe two times before and just couldn't understand why they have soooo much attitude with their customers, so I said im not going back there to give them any more of my coins, but low and behold they were the ONLY nail shop open ugh... so I went there again. To make a long story short I went in for a fill in and no chip. I picked a color, it was a muted pink and the guy brought back a grey color and said this is the color you picked! I said to him "when you put this silver color on my nails, it's going to come out pink?" so we went through this four times until I asked the owner to help him find the color I wanted and she said "he can find it he knows what he's doing!" with a frown on her face. I said clearly he don't if he thinks silver is pink! She goes over to the polishes on the wall only to bring back a soft pink. I said this is not the same color. She attempted to go back to the wall of polishes and turned around mid way and said "I dont have time for this!" (It was only myself and one other person in this place) So I gathered my things and paid them for the service that they gave and said I hope you have time to wait for another customer because I dont have time for your attitude. I will never step foot in this shop again!

6.description: It doesn't open at 10A y'all, I've waited multiple times to be there early and nobody even shows up at 10. Are they still in business?

12.description: I work near this nail shop, and was one of their first few customers when they opened. I really loved it at first. The owners, Matthew & Kim, are really nice. Kim did AMAZING eyebrows and was my go-to person... however she no longer works there. I went in about a month ago and got my eyebrows done by another person, but whoever that lady was messed them all up. Also, when they first opened, I thought they did a great job with on their pedicures and manicures, but now when I go in I tend to have to wait for a really long time before I am seen. It's also extremely unprofessional to have your staff sitting in the pedicure/massage chairs with no shoes or socks on watching videos on a laptop or watching tv... especially when I am waiting for a ridiculous amount of time for a manicure (apparently that person didn't know how to do a fill-in). I had high hopes for this place. I feel like it can get better- but Matthew would have to tighten up on his staff a little bit, and hire people that are multi-talented so a customer won't have to wait because someone doesn't know how to do a particular service.

5.description: I needed a quick manicure and my normal place, Pinky's was too far and I would have had to search for parking. This one was near my house and I thought you really can't mess up a basic manicure. Particularly a manicure where you only get a buff out, no polish. I was wrong. I had to ask for my nails to be cut and evened out. She did not ask what shape I preferred for filing and I didn't say. I was expecting square, round, or oval. I have no clue what I got, kind of a round with square edges poking out. Not nice at all. Then simple buffing. She did not buff them well at all. They were not shiny. The little glimmer they had was gone by the evening. Never again. And while I was there someone came in for their eyebrows. When she was finished she had none, and was red all around the eyebrow. I guess that's how she liked them. When the technician saw me staring, she goes "You like eyebrow?" I said "No!" I had just had mine threaded immediately before coming to this place, I guess they wanted the hair was remaining removed, too!

11.description: So dirty and such a long wait...not worth the wait! They expect you to sit with your feet in the water for 15 minutes! And they lie and say someone will be right with you. Forget it!

8.description: Sat in the broken massage chair until water went cold. Didn't even get my pedicure.

0.description: This place needs more nail technicians and little bit better service they move to slow on a busy day. You wait 1-2 hrs for service if they are busy. Oh and they need to update their info (phone #) you have to search for it on face book.

7.description: Still recovering from the toe fungus contracted at this nail joint. Huh ..one doctors visit, months of medication, plus wearing closed toe shoes all summer, makes for one nuisance of a pedicure. Warning to people thinking about going to this place to get your nails done its a 6 month commitment!

12.description: clean, good food, and good service.  They just added kabobs to their menu!!! The kafta and ck kabobs are amazing! Their dill rice and lentil soup are very flavorful.  It's cheap and the portions are good size.  Probably the best kabobs I have had in this city yet and I have eaten at Rezas, El souk, Alhambra, and Shokran.  Highly recommend it.

7.description: Good standard gyro at a decent price, but we've gone too many times when their credit machines were down or they were closed during regular hours.As an update to 7/15, I think there is either a new owner or new management and they now take credit! Good basic eats on the fly, very inexpensive, and nice people working there.

3.description: This place is about 2 blocks from me so it would be my go to place in the neighborhood.I always order the 3 chicken wing and 3 chicken tender combo. It never disappoints. The portions are huge and the chicken is very flavorful. I also get the chicken nuggets. $5 for 15 nuggets with fries and a pop you absolutely can not beat that on a college budget.I would recommend this place if you are in the neighborhoodFastAffordableGood

1.description: I used to be a regular here. Until I bought a groupon and came in to try and use it they gave me an attitude. False advertising to get people to come in using groupons and force you to pay full price. Even if they said it was a mistake and told me I would have understand. But the foul attitude for a loyal customer for 4 plus years is the reason I will never go here again.

2.description: This is the best late-night/open-most-of- the-time, fast food option in the area. Because of this, I probably order take out once every 1-2 months (when I'm feeling lazy)! I always stick to the gyros. It's cheap, you get huge portions plus a drink, the service is always friendly. Plus the fries are AMAZING! I've had the burger, which is good too but I now go back to the gyro. This isn't gourmet food but definitely some delicious fast food!

9.description: Fast, cheap and decent food. The burgers are just ok, but I really like the gyro. The portion sizes are adequate, and for such a small place, you've got a lot of options.  There are a few small tables for eating in, and I've never had trouble finding a seat. The previous owner was more personable, but the new owner isn't a terrible guy, just not super friendly. Doesn't keep me from stopping in, since the neighborhood doesn't have a lot of variety.***Update***This place has changed hands more times than I can count, and the service has really suffered. I went back for my beloved gyro recently and it is nowhere near as good. Had to take away a couple stars. Bummer.

18.description: Revised 2/12 - Never eat here again...the place has changed owners 3 times since the young greek guy who remodelled the place left and the food just gets worse and worse. Food poisoning city! Run!Despite the fear that a 'Do The Right Thing' style race war could break out any second inside my neighborhood gyros-spot (or g-spot), I've learned toaccept this place as OK food in the edible spectrum and a necessary evil. Since I'm eating junk in the first place, who am I to critique?? The new middle eastern menu is a welcome addition to the hurting menu and saves me a much longer trip to find a decent falafel or kefta sandwich. I do miss the former and authentic greek owner and his endless supply of pretty cashier ladies but the new owner is nice and gives samples if you are polite and talk to him like a human being. I don't go there looking for casual atmosphere, hip clientele or gourmet food. I go there because i want something I'll regret eating and swear off for a few  months. I'd take this place over white-castle, Bacci, Damenzo's, generic hot-dog place, incarceration themed hot-dog place or K.F.C. any day.

10.description: This is another place my office likes to frequent, but I can do without. The quality is inconsistent and the food isn't worth chancing another bout of upset stomach (read: explosive diarrhea) from improperly stored cucumber yummy sauce (tzatziki) or underdone chicken.So, when it is good, it is satisfying enough. And when it is bad, I have to take a cab home because there's no way the bus will get me to the privacy of my own bathroom in time.

13.description: Not the best greasy spoon around, but it's conveniently located.

16.description: Ownership changed hands, this place sucks now.

17.description: They have great food at great prices but their gyros aren't even close to being the best in the city.

15.description: Since the change in ownership, some things are better and some are worse. I love that they are now open on Sundays and are open until 2am. But prices have increased and the quality of the food has decreased a bit. We call ahead to order and they never remember to include cheese for the fries or extra sauces that we request - even when we ask them as they hand us the bag, they lie and say the extras are in there, and they never are. But when you're craving a gyro and don't want to commute to Greektown, this place definitely satisfies the craving.

0.description: I live literally a block away and thought I'd give this place a try. When I first walked in, I was taken back by the appearance of this place, but soon found that the food made up for the inside. I tried the double bacon cheeseburger. It was amazing. In addition, the guys behind the counter were friendly. A good place to stop for a gyro or burger for sure.

5.description: This place is only 2 blocks from my house, and I"m kicking myself for not going here sooner. I'm originally from New Orleans and I've been searching all over for some good fried catfish and have been disappointed. Not until yesterday when I ordered a 5 piece catfish dinner from Westside Gyros. The catfish was seasoned and fried perfectly! Large pieces, on top of seasoned fries. Dinner also came with a salad, cole slaw and a drink. All for 10 bucks. I couldn't believe it. I will be back often.

11.description: Why do people even bother with assessments like "best _____ in the city"?  This place is a tasty, welcome treat on the west side.   Though it looks like a dive from the street, inside the place is very clean and done up with 50s sign decor. Come on, admit it condo-dwellers of Harrison and Western -- you want to eat at more affordable, clean places like this one.  This is a certainly a nice change from Bacci's or White Castle.However, gyros are *not recommended* while driving.

8.description: I really like this spot. It's close to my house, and the food is above average and the prices are way within reason.  With that being said, I have only ordered a few different things.  I have had the chicken tenders,which are amazingly huge and made from real chunks of chicken breast.  I get sauce on the side, but they'll toss the sauce on them if you would like.   On four occasions I have had the 900 calorie artery buster - aka "the gyro cheeseburger".  I don't know quite how to explain that experience, but I do have to talk myself out of ordering it each time I go in there (either that or call the paramedics just before I start eating it).  I have had and Like the gyros. The fries are included with many items and the food is always prepared quickly but properly and it tastes good.Definitely a good spot for a fast food type menu, but I don't think I would be inclined to drive across town for it, but if in the area and the menu type is what your looking for you wont be disappointed.

4.description: Great for a quick meal. The items are decently priced and you get a large portion when you order. I ordered the gyro and it easily lasted me like 3 meals. The food itself isn't amazing, but its not bad. Perfect for when you're starving and need a lot to eat. Unfortunately they one gave one pita with the huge box of gyros so make sure you order some extra. Slightly shady area so I wouldn't go here alone at night. But really nice employees inside the restaurant.

14.description: This is a nice neighborhood burger/dog/gyros joint.  The burgers, dogs and gyros are all good, and the greasy pizza puffs are great for hangovers.  They've got a lot of daily specials for $4.99 and I've pretty much tried them all.  Not bad for the price.  They occasionally forget the gyros sauce for takeout orders, so make sure you check your bag before you leave, or else you'll be eating a gyro with whatever you have left in your fridge (ketchup, bbq sauce, relish...).  I have yet to figure out when they are open or closed - sometimes I try to order at 10pm and they're already closed... sometimes I drive by at 1am and they're still open... if you're going to go here late for a hot dog craving, call first to make sure they're open.

6.description: I have to admit that for some reason I love the gyros here! Seems like they may have just gotten new owners, but I was relieved to find the  gyros were still spot on! The fries have improved, too -- gotta love that. Haven't tried a lot else here, my boyfriend likes the pizza puffs, but I'll let him write his own review. Can't beat the prices or the fact that it's super close to home.

1.description: Richardson Seating is Chicago's premier manufacturer of commercial restaurant furniture.  Richardson Seating specializes in 1950s style chrome furniture, floor mounted bar stools, and custom logo bar stools.

2.description: Richardson Seating is Chicago's premier manufacture of custom restaurant furniture.  I purchased 12 bar stools from one of their online dealers.  Since I live in Chicago, they let me pick them up to save freight.  Unfortunately, I still had to pay sales IL's ridiculously high sales tax.  They were very nice when I went to pick up and helped me figure out how to fit them all in my Jeep.

0.description: Retro diner chairs, bar stools and logos  -- this is the coolest chair  company in the world. You can see their stuff on TV with Playboy Series and they make logo stools for True Blood and other shows.All kinds of chairs, American made, heavier construction and better materials than similar priced competitors -- find the details when you compare and you'll choose then.They're a manufacturer but you can buy their stuff on other sites if you only want small quantities.

3.description: For the second year in a row we had our company holiday party here.  There were about 90 guests.  We did appetizers, full open bar and buffet dinner.  If you have never been here, it's worth a site visit because the outside is deceiving. It is a uniquely beautiful location, with arched vaulted beamed ceilings, exposed brick walls, hardwood floors, stained glass windows, and a "choir" mezzanine.  It has a full bar and booth seating, as well as side rooms for buffet spreads.   The mezzanine is perfect for a DJ, and the acoustics work well for softer dinner music, as well as post-dinner dancing in the area in front of the bar.The staff are friendly and flexible, working with us as our planned activities (awards presentations) and timelines shifted throughout the night.  Once this gem gets discovered, I know we'll be competing for dates for events.  I wish Damenzo's that success, though - it is well earned and deserved.

1.description: Used this place for a baptism... Let me start by saying this place is absolutely beautiful inside! Arched wood ceilings exposed brick walls and old stained glass windows as this place was a church previously. They also work with great decorators that will customize look as you want it! As for the food... Outstanding! The vodka sauce pasta is the best i have ever had. If this place was a restaurant i would order weekly! We also had the chicken vesuvio that was very tasty. Sausage and peppers and bruschetta for appetizers! All greatService was great... Family owned and operated. Very friendly! No complaints at all. Definitely recommend this place!!

2.description: My son and his new wife had their wedding reception there last night. The food was over the top. Appetizers were sausage and peppers, pizza and brussetta. Dinner was salad and bread, chicken marsala and Fettuccini Alfredo. Desert was cake, ice cream and a chocolate fountain. There was more than enough for evéryone. The disc jockeys had a place to set up on an upper level, out of the way. The place is beautiful. The owners also own another place across the street and allow guests to use that parking lot which is huge in Chicago.

5.description: Had a post graduation celebration for 60 ppl, from the start of our planning process to the end of the event the service was amazing and extremely professional.  Each request we made from food, decor, setup and bar options was met and exceeded our expectations.   Food was a huge hit, hard to do with so many ppl (especially kids!). Vodka sauce was a crowd favorite.   The space is beautiful, we didn't add any of our own decorations.   This place is a hidden gem!  We will be back!

0.description: This place is amazing! Very accommodating and the food taste great. The owners are very attentive to detail and requests. My daughters party was a hit! Thank you Natale & Lenny!

4.description: We rented the location for a milestone birthday party. The food was excellent.  The staff is great.  The place is beautiful inside and can be set up to your liking. I would use them again for our next event.

3.description: Great atmosphere. Barbers are great at what they do. Sammy is real cool. Fades, sports and street fighter 2. Come on! Amazing!!! Plenty of parking. Great location. Leather couches to sit in. Come early, place gets packed on the weekends.

1.description: This place is terrible. You walk in and nobody addresses you for 45 minutes. The barbers are on their phones while the customers are in the chair waiting for them to finish the haircut. Incredibly unprofessional. I will not be going back.

0.description: This place is fantastic:- Design - the shop itself is very nice, with flat screen tv's on the wall and music playing in the background. The mural of Michael Jordan on the wall is a welcoming site for all Bulls fans.- Chairs - the barber chairs are upholstered leather, which allow you to relax during your haircut- Barbers - my barber was Jason, who was really nice and did a great job with my hair- Affordability - no more expensive than any other barbershop

2.description: the owner recently added an archade machine ... it costs $0.50 cents to play ... SAMI needs to bring the price down to $0.25. BRING IT DOWN SAMI !!

5.description: Some of the worst customer service I've experienced in a while. My story goes like this; I walk in, get instant stares. Fifteen minutes after listening to their APPARENT sponsor WGCI blast throughout the barber shop, every single barber was sitting down doing nothing. After twenty minutes I finally get the courage to yell over the 2 Chains song that was playing and asked, "is anyone available to line me up?!!" The guy smiles and goes, "Of course" as if It was obvious and I was the idiot. After my $15 lining I made up my mind that I wouldn't return. None of the barbers ever explained to me that this was by appointment primarily. They just simply gave no f**ks. It was a waste of time and way over priced. The people rating this place above three stars have to either be employees or regulars. Point blank.

6.description: Would have been nice to know before hand that u need an appointment. I paid for parking outside and waited for an hour. Ppl just walked in and I was skipped 2 times. No one said anything. If you don't know them personally they treat you like you are invisible. I asked what was up and they told me to come back in 45 minutes. Not good business. If you don't know them personally expect to be skipped like crazy.

7.description: True to their name they do an excellent fade here. I used to go to Rockstar Fades on Taylor/Racine but they got shut down so I heard about Taylor Made from a friend. However, I'll be looking again because making an appointment here is useless. Me: Can I come in at 6:15?Guy on phone: Yeah, all right.[he hangs up]Me: Well, I'm pretty sure he didn't ask for my name ...So, I show up at 6:10 and now it's 6:30... still waiting. If I hadn't had dinner plans I would have just gone somewhere else. This is the second time this happened, so it's not a fluke. That's without complaining about the loud TV / simultaneous radio, patrons drinking, etc.

8.description: This place is legit.  Nice atmosphere, friendly staff.  TVs and music are a great distraction.  Décor is comfortable and pays homage to Chicago, Chicago Sports, and Marilyn Monroe of course (nice!).I am new to town and only have only been there a couple of times. I left happy a happy man both time and will definitely be back.  Big Jon is meticulous in his craft and did me up right.

9.description: Average fades but "ambience" is pretty good, for guys anyway.  ESPN on and hip-hop music playing.  Was $15 for fade and trimmed my goatee.

10.description: Exactly what Taylor St. needed!!...An all around GOOD BARBERSHOP! All the barbers there are very professional yet not stuck up. Inside of the shop is very inviting with the flat screen tv's and music playing in the background.... Prices are also very affordable, and I GUARANTEE you'll be happy with your end result! I've taken my son there several times and I've NEVER been disappointed.

4.description: Not bad. Taylor Street now has new girls in town and these girls can do the hair and other cosmetics. Impressive, this place is really updated with its Flat screen TV and the beautiful depiction of Michael Jordan on the wall.
