Males and Females are really going to love the way this place caters to really upgraded hair styles, fades, hot shaves, Tapers, Braids and even Mohawks and graphics are done. Its not pretentious at all and the young ladies who greeted me were really innovative with their styles. I have to admit, Taylor Street needed this new do up and they are going to change it up in here. So if you want to enjoy a nice hair cut and style but more than just that, get pampered and understand that this place is going to be a staple here on Taylor Street, and the specials that they are offering are really going to turn up the volume. Let them know you saw it here on YELP.The barbers name is Sam, and the ladies are Megan and Micha. Check them out and specials are going to be done from time to time.MON-FRI: 10 AM - 8PMSaturday 10AM -7PMSunday Closed, hey rest is needed for the customers that will infiltrate soon. Happy Yelping!

3.description: We've ordered food to go quite a few times at this location where things are no better than okay - they've been polite to me but slow, only one person working the inside window despite a line of customers, and sometimes out of certain items. Since we like KFC, we stop here every so often.  Last Sunday, anxious to try KFC's new "boneless" chicken, we again went there, but when we got home we discovered that we paid for but didn't receive four extra biscuits and had been given all the wrong sides (macaroni & cheese instead of cole slaw, for example).  I had even asked the woman at the counter, "Did you include our extra biscuits in the bag?" and she said "Yes."  But, besides that, the taste of the boneless chicken was somehow a letdown, too - especially oily skin and a strong pepper taste.  (I read that KFC predicts that 60% of its business this time next year will be boneless chicken.)  We'll stick with the original recipe chicken breasts and drumsticks and wings WITH the bones.  And IF we go back here, we'll be sure to check our order before we go out the door.

1.description: Extremely slow. I wouldnt recommend this location unless you feel like waiting a long time for food.

2.description: For what it is, this place is okay. Slow as molasses and sometimes some of the chicken is undercooked. I just think that drive thru should always be faster then inside but in this case they are wrong. If you complain about something it seems that they don't care. On several occasions it was brought up to the drive thru worker that the food was not given to me correctly or chicken was undercooked last time I ordered, but I was told with attitude: "well you should of turned around than", ummm I wasn't fishing for something free I just wanted it to be understood and have a limited lunch time, that please look over the order before giving it to customers. And forget it, the flamboyant attitude was given to me, but not without me reading the heck out of the worker first. I mean I am a consumer not your "friend", And I approached "you" with all respect. So now I'm going to read you your rights and they are as follows: "Consumers are defined as individuals who purchase, use, maintain, and dispose of products and service, food or otherwise. This is a consumer law, I told him: "now are you sure you want to ge rude because we do have rights and I have no problem reading you yours". He gave in and said: "I didn't mean nuttin by it". Ummm moral of the story, yes you are considered a food worker and you should do your job with pride but you need to understand that some will challenge when something is not right. Its not a personal attack on you, but its about correcting what is wrong, I don't want free items anywhere and that was not my intention, but I came to you with a serious issue and it's a respectful way of approaching. Okay I have a headache now. All of a sudden I feel like going for sushi, chicken has become so passe'.

0.description: I stop by for my lunch break every once in a while. Their service is slow, and the cashiers seem like they don't know the menu board. When you only have a limited time to eat, every minute counts. Did I mention that they are slow? I have to repeat the order about 2 or 3 times for them to get it right. Make sure you check your food before you leave. The food is pretty good. No problems yet. The only reason I give them 4 stars is because they have spicy chicken.

1.description: Rick's is definitely the kind of Dive Bar that continues to prove itself to be a landmark of the neighborhood! Whether you are coming in for a late lunch, dinner, and or drinks! Rick's has something for everyone. The service is pretty impeccable and the staff is undeniably friendly! Since the first day my boyfriend brought me over to Rick's, this bar continues to remind me why we keep coming back. The crowd this bar caters to is totally diverse and undeniably friendly: Young, Old, College Students, CPD, Neighbors... to say the least! Just goes to prove the fact that they've got something for everyone! Their menu is pretty great! Burgers are always on point and the specials they have to offer is the icing on the cake! Everything is made to order, typical bar food but so much better! The drinks are always on point and you can't beat it's neighborhood prices, seriously!Rick's is the place where everyone will eventually know your name! It's so nice to have such a welcoming gem in the neighborhood. RIck's being so close to home, it's definitely become a goto spot for my boyfriend and I! They never disappoint, we will continue coming back for more! I definitely recommend paying Rick's a visit!

9.description: Went here Friday night. Not crowded at all which was nice. Nice good neighborhood bar with a pool table, darts, juke box, and a little dance floor. Nice place to chill out and the bartender was friendly. Check it out

12.description: This bar is great. I stop by every so often and have always enjoyed myself. Kurt is an awesome bartender.

21.description: Popular bar crowded with college kids and dating couples.  There are small booths and seating all around the walls of the bar.  There's always good music here with new DJs coming in every weekend.

16.description: I eat here for lunch a lot.  I give this place 4 stars based on the burger and onion rings alone.  The shrimp is actually really well done too.

17.description: Good neighbor joint with decent food. Kurt is a great bartender!

10.description: Above average dive bar. Food was your usual bar fare, but yes the burgers are really good and the jalepeno poppers were pretty good too. Reasonably priced drinks, very friendly bartenders, good music, and the TVs are great for catching the game. Looks like I will be making this one of my regular spots in Tri-Taylor!

5.description: Something about this place is just so perfect. It's your local neighborhood bar. Nothing special except the people. I love bringing people here and the appeal seems to come out more after you have 1-2 beers. You socialize with your neighbors, you put money in the jukebox, you order some bar food, and you just have a good time at home.

11.description: Great dive bar on Taylor & Western. Small, but cozy. Cheap drinks and friendly staff. My husband and I had a few drinks there last night and enjoyed the relaxed and unpretentious atmosphere. Perfect place to go for a couple cold ones and unwind.

3.description: i'm not a dive bar kind of gal but i had a great time at rick's. i flew in late on a friday night from san francisco and found rick's to be the only open place in the hood. the service was great, the customers went out and got me white castles (i was starving) and a very nice man walked me home - no funny business. i love chicago. i love rick's!

0.description: Friendly crowd and pleasant bartenders make this a great spot to grab a few drinks!Sometimes there isn't anyone at the bar, but at worst case you're stuck with one of the bartenders, both of whom I've met have always been very friendly and personable. The hours are a bit strange, so it can be difficult to tell what's going to be a busy night and what isn't. On weekdays it has a small after-work crowd. Wednesday's are always popular for the $3 burgers. On Saturday's it doesn't open until 8pm and doesn't get busy until much later. Can sometimes be a really fun crowd and dancing on the pool table has been known to occur.I have never had a problem with the clientele here. They are always very friendly and up for a chat. A great place to come even if you are going out alone. You won't ever leave without making a new friend. You don't even have to worry about someone taking your seat or stealing your jacket while you go out front for a smoke. Crowd is mixed with students, people from the neighborhood, people who work close by, or people just trying to escape the typical bar scene found a little further north in Chicago.Beer selection is modest, but filled with the standards as well as a few more interesting ones available in bottles or cans, but you won't feel overwhelmed with a massive gimmicky beer list. Always easy to find something that you will like, even for the more snobbish of beer drinkers. Prices are affordable as well. Bar is on the small side, but I like it and it feels like a cozy, neighborhood hangout. Nothing tacky or gimmicky about it. A darts board and small pool table will satisfy your competitive edge and a juke box is available to play your favorite tunes. A condom machine in the bathroom is a welcome sight as well, not enough bar restrooms seem to have them anymore.some closing remarks:"find me a warm seat and a cold drink and that is all i need for some time to think"  - Herbert Hoover, 31st president of the US of A

20.description: Too many college aged people around here. I didn't like the scene and felt way too old when I went here!

19.description: I like Rick's for a quick beer and good burger.  It's not my favorite neighborhood Friday night haute, but it's a chill place to meet coworkers for happy hour, catch a Sunday game with friends, and not overpay for a beer and drinks.  Nice plasma tvs by bar so you can catch any game.  Small dollar pool table is one of the last of it's kind in the city.  I disagree with the comment made about too many college kids.  I don't mind them at all although I haven't seen a lot at Rick's.  They mostly hang out at Hawkeyes and Drum and Monkey.

2.description: My favorite little dive bar in the city.. Mainly because of its proximity to my house. Prices are lower than most other bars in the city and it has good variety for a small neighborhood bar. Friendly crowd. The bartenders are always fun too! It's got a jukebox that's always playing, the smallest pool table I've ever seen and a darts board. I have a great time every time I'm here and always leave feeling pretty good :)

18.description: They have free popcorn and pretzels.  The beer is cheap.  Pool and darts.  Neighborhood is really shady, but the bar is a nice dive and the patrons are friendly.

13.description: Their bar is average, however, if you turn around the corner on Taylor and visit their Cafe, their HAMBURGERS and CHEESEBURGERS are the BEST I've had.You know you have a good hamburger or cheeseburger when you reheat the leftovers and the hamburger tastes better than when it was fresh... I mean, their food is great, but their 1/2 pound angus cheeseburger tastes really good when it is reheated in the microwave... Their jalapeno cheese poppers are really good and  their french fries are excellent!  Yummy! And you can't beat the prices!

4.description: Rick's Bar is the perfect dive bar. Very cheap booze. Surprisingly good food, including cheap burgers on Wednesday nights. One drawback is the weird hours. For example on Saturdays, they do not open until 7 or 8 PM. This is a bummer when Hawks or Bulls games start earlier. The bartenders are very friendly and chill as well. The owner's wife was in last time and took pictures of my group to include on the Facebook page. Good place.

6.description: Just a good old bar. There's absolutely nothing fancy about this place and that is just fine with me. I've been in just for drinks and to eat dinner. Rick can grill a heck of a burger and the fries are tasty too. But what I like about this place is that it's just a neighborhood bar. There's a tiny little pool table, a juke box, and TVs everywhere that is almost always playing sports. It's a nice little stop if you find yourself down there with some time to kill.

15.description: A nice and relaxing bar to get some drinks.  I agree with Miss M.  their burgers are fantastic.

7.description: I swear on my life that this place is a front for something...I've been here maybe a dozen times over the past year (I literally live around the corner and a girl has got to do what  a girl has got to do). About 10 of those times, there has been zero, zilch, 0, nobody (shall I continue?) there. It's weird. The bartender is nice enough, probably average in every regard, but I think she is a student because she's more wrapped up in her large textbook-looking monstrosity then anything else.  The food is pretty darn tasty and the beer is cold but everything else is no different than a garden apartment kitchen. Our neighbors have always said this place is a cop bar and perhaps it used to be but   certainly not now. I'm not sure how they stay in business but I'm glad they are there when I need them and really,let's face it, that's all that matters...

8.description: Awesome local bar with friendly staff and good service.  Food was excellent too.  I highly recommend checking out Rick's if you are in the area.

14.description: Hidden gem of a bar. Definitely check it out!

12.description: Love this place.  Great milkshakes in the summer and a fantastic greasy chili dog year round.  The place has history and the owners are really nice.  Support our local businesses!

3.description: Clean, good prices, good food, friendly staff.  The best fresh cut French fries I've had in a long time.  On the down side, no seating at all, just a small ledge to stand and eat, and Styrofoam cups for soda.

1.description: The hot dogs I had were good. The fries were ok. It just drives me nuts that I am forced to buy a drink with my order. "All" orders come with a drink and fries. I don't like it when places require you to get a so-called meal deal. So... from now on, if I know I don't want a drink (which is almost always) or a fry (which is sometimes) then I know not to come here.

2.description: Location has reopened under new management and I think it is better than before!! The new owners cleaned up the place and are very nice! Menu has changed a bit with added items. Almost tried everything so far and no disappointment!

9.description: Here's the thing. Its a hot dog place, with a Italian ice place attached. Set your expectations accordingly. Would give 4 stars if the hot dogs were plumper and the Chicago style had everything except ketchup, not just mustard, relish, sport peppers & celery salt. They have a mofuckin, "French Fry Sandwich" in case you wanted to get super carbed up. Can I have a spaghetti shake with it?

10.description: I'm not scared of a grimy hot dog place. Good thing too. This place is a little grimy. But the dog has a nice natural casing snap to it and that's what I'm looking for. The hot dog special includes a skinny all beef hot dog on a poppy seed bun, a small fry and a VERY small drink. For $3.69 it's a good deal. That being said, the soda is in a 12 oz. Styrofoam coffee cup and the the fries, while perfectly delicious, aren't more than a child's handful. On the cusp, but still a good deal. What I found a little disconcerting was the way the condiments were staged behind the counter. They were just sitting there, uncovered, in metal bowls. I'm no wilting flower but come on... would it kill you to slap a lid on those things between customers? Not bad. Not great. Don't go out of your way but if you're stuck in construction traffic on Western there's no reason not to stop for a snack

4.description: I liked the hot dog meal with fries and a small drink because it was cheap. The customer service is ok. The hot dogs were small, and all bunched up with the greasy fries.

6.description: Fried hot polish with hot sauce and ketchup on the fry. Period! LOLThe ice cream and italian ice is really good too.

0.description: Desire: "Icee" (slang for: Italian Ice)Location: Polk & WesternName: Polk & Western (very creative, indeed!)Restrictions: Cash only. Decor: Stark white, but clean. Flavors: About 30. Verdict: Excellent Iceeeeeeeeee. The raspberry/strawberry combo kept me totally chilled out, even in the presence of five or six preteen girls unhappy with just about...everything. Except, iceeeeeeee. True that.

5.description: I been going to this hot dog stand since I was around five or six.  My parents use to take me there after church on Sunday.  I'd get the hot dog and fries and my parents would get the watermelon Italian ice.  When got older I would get one for desert.  I really wish SOMEBODY not going to mention any names would make the watermelon Italian ice this summer hint hint.   I am 42 now.  They treat me and my family like we are family.  I'm extremely picky about my hot dogs how they taste.  This is my favorite hot dog stand.  It's run by to for the best people.   Thank you for all the years you've made me and my families dinning experience consistent and enjoyable.

13.description: sure its pretty obvious that their italian beef was procured from a mass food distributor...  sure the au jus must be made from shitty beef bullion cubes...  but hey, it at least seems like they attempted to make home-made giardiniera.  (albiet 95% carrots and virtually flavorless)it was the most reasonably priced beef i've ever eaten, and also very similar to gov't hospital food. i ordered a chicago dawg and cheese fries too because i'm a cow.  much to my regret "chicago style"  has only relish mustard and onion.  this all upsets me to say as the staff was SUPER friendly however pathetically organized.

11.description: A nice place to grab a hot dog special lunch or a late night snack.  The dogs are a bit on the skinny side so if you have a hearty appetite I suggest grabbing two.  You'll find your sausage wrapped up with the fries which are also little skinny sticks of greasy heaven.  You can come in here and be the only one ordering and then the next thing you know the place is filled with moms and their strollers, business men, cops and teens.  There is really no place to eat your meal here so it's best to grab your grease stained bag and eat on the go!  Bonus points for having cherry RC on tap and being next to an Italian ice shop.Cash only, go figure

8.description: Four devoted softball practicers need to be rewarded in some fashion, right? Oh, and the little cousin that apparently is our mascot (if mascots like to roll around in the sand and get as dirty as can be....seriously, we have our own little Pig Pen), we had to reward him for....well, you can't get everyone else a treat and not the little kid who hangs around the entire time. It's just not nice. So he got a treat too.They promise that there is an icee shop around the way, which is what the Coaches were craving (and what the coaches crave is what the girls get, especially if they are paying, y'hear?!) Not the cleanest shop, nor the nicest, nor is the best icee I have ever had, but a great assortment of ices at reasonable prices that are sure to quench your greatest summer thirst if you want something a bit more refreshing than your standard ice cream cone.Three larges and three smalls set us back a little over $15. Not bad at all for a taste of summer. I went with the strawberry cut with a little lemon and it was delicious. The girls raved over the lime. Everyone had sticky smiles afterwards. A good practice day, indeed, for our devoted Reds.Cash only.

14.description: Not saying it's all that great, but thy the French dry sandwich.

7.description: If you don't go for the Dogs go for the ambiance and neighborhood.
